loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
This is Muhamet and his wife, Shefikat, being photographed in the stable of their animals. 

Muhamet is 53 years old and has two children in their early 20s.  They live in rural Elbasan. They plant veggies and crops and have orchards for their personal use. About six months ago they bought a dairy cow that now has a calf.  They sell raw milk and will sell one baby calf a year. 

Muhamet has been doing labour work for the past five years earning about $300/month and their oldest son who is 24 years old works as a car mechanic for a pay of $400/month. 

Muhamet and his family are looking at building a new stable and this is why they are requesting your help through this loan.

loans.use: build a stable

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is 58 years old, living in a remote area of the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district. She has three dependent children. Nowadays, she does rice farming on five hectares of farmland as the main source of income for her family. Her husband is working for others for a fee in Thailand to earn more income. Chanthou has been in her current business for 33 years. Not having enough water to do farming is the main challenge for her farm. 

This is Chanthou's eighth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Previous loans have helped her to earn good income to support her family’s living conditions. Chanthou is now leading a group of two members to take out a new loan of 200,000 riels (KHR). The other member is seeking 200,000 KHR as well. Chanthou will use her loan portion to buy household supplies and renovate her old house to have a better house to stay in. She hopes that this loan will expand her current business to produce more income.

loans.use: to buy household supplies and renovate her old house to have a better house to stay in.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Betrice is a mother of three children who are in school. She is in her mid-thirties, supporting her family by running a grocery selling beer, soda, water, and spirits. She has been managing the business for three years now. She runs her business from 6:00 a.m. to 11 p.m. and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her second loan via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy grocery stock of drinks (beer, soda, and water). She dreams of expanding her grocery business. She will share this loan with her loan group "Malumbo," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock of drinks (beer, soda, and water).

loans.name: Ada Cecibel

texts.es: Ada de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la elaboración de los alimentos y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ada, 41 years old, lives in her own home with her mother. She has worked selling tortillas for the past 8 years. Her business is located in her home which is why she has many customers. 

She manages to move forward with the earnings she obtains. The client is requesting a loan to buy wholesale corn and lime, to continue preparing foodstuffs and to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 46 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melchora has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Melchora is borrowing 8,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Roger Arturo

texts.es: Roger es un microempresario dedicado a la comercialización de productos capilares y tratamientos de belleza, inició su negocio en el año 2011, cuando identificó la oportunidad de abrir un local en el municipio de Soledad y comercializar estos productos que son muy utilizados en salas de belleza y estilistas que laboran a domicilio o simplemente vecinos y transeúntes del sector.  Sus compras las realiza en el vecino país de Venezuela donde este tipo de productos son muy comerciales y rentables, permitiéndole tener mayores utilidades en su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en productos capilares como shampoo, masajes, tintes, ampollas, queratinas, esmaltes para uñas y demás.  Roger es padre de un niño de 6 años a quien desea ofrecer una excelente calidad de vida. Su meta de negocio es aperturar otra sucursal y continuar prosperando.
texts.en:
Roger is a small business owner selling hair products and beauty treatments. He started his business in 2011, when he saw the opportunity to open a store in the municipality of Soledad and sell these products which are used in beauty salons and by stylists that work at home or simply neighbors and people passing by in the area. 

He does his shopping in the neighboring country of Venezuela where these kinds of products are very available and affordable. This allows him to make better profits in his business. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in hair products like shampoo, conditioners, hair dye, serums, keratin, as well as nail polish, etc. 

Roger is the father of a 6-year-old to whom he wants to give an excellent quality of life. His business goal is to open another branch and continue prospering.

loans.use: to invest in hair products like shampoo, conditioners, hair dye, serums, keratin, as well as nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 47, from Pasay City. She has been an entrepreneur for almost 20 years and became a member of Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) in 2004. With CCT's regular weekly fellowship*, she was inspired to work harder for her four children. In fact, she was encouraged to continually grow her business through the Word of God that they study.  

As of today, she is still operating a small store of variety products. Through this small stand, she is able to meet her family's basic needs. Aspiring to a better life, she wants to improve her inventory so she can also develop her sales. She asks for help from you. 

Susan humbly wants to avail financial support amounting to 11,000 Philippine pesos to be used to buy more products to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this chance to prove that she can really make things happen. So far, she's praying for the good health of her children and dreaming that all of them will get decent jobs someday. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, shirts and many articles of clothing in different sizes and styles.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña Maria de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieto, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una galera para colocar techo en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de laminas, cuartones, pago de mano de obra y demás materiales de construcción y así poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
Maris is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her son and grandson. 
She has worked for several years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With what she earns from her sales is able to get ahead.
She wants to improve her home by building a fenced in area to put in a roof in the place shown in the photograph but she does not have sufficient finances. She is requesting the loan from INTEGRAL to buy sheets of metal, lumber, pay for manual labour and other construction materials and in this way be able to have a safer house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, lumber, pay for manual labour and other construction materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old, married to Tom, and supports a family of four children. She has been practicing farming for the last eight years earning KES.30,000 per month. 

Gladys has applied for her loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 49 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Narcisa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries.

Narcisa has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Mario Alex

texts.es: Don Mario de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (frijol y maíz) desde hace 10 años, también trabaja como jornal,cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono para el cultivo de maíz y así poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Mario is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has worked as a farmer for 10 years growing staple grains (beans and corn). He also works as a day laborer. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries, as shown in the picture. With the income he makes, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for the corn plants. With this he will be able to have a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old, married, and supports a family of five children. She has been practicing farming for the last 16 years, earning KES17,000 per month. 

Mary has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Vilma Marbely

texts.es: Vilma de 37 años de edad, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, vive junto a su compañero de vida y  sus dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente. Vilma es una mujer la cual siempre se ha sentido apoyada por su pareja pero  a pesar de esto ella busca diversas formas de poder aportar en lo económico al hogar y darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que no les haga falta nada en la vida, es por esto que se dedica comercializar productos de belleza como: perfumes, maquillaje, cremas y otros más, esto representa una gran ayuda para ella y desde luego en su economía. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI, y así seguir adelante con su negocio, surtiendo la cantidad de productos de belleza que vende, lo que le servirá para vender más y aumentar sus ganancias. Con el monto solicitado comprara, tintes para cabello, lociones, cremas para la piel y el cabello entre otros productos de belleza para así aumentar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old, she is a responsible and hardworking woman who makes a great effort to get ahead. She lives with her life partner and their two children, who are 13 and 9 years old and are both currently studying. 
Vilma is a woman who has always felt supported by her partner but despite this she looks for different ways to be able to contribute to the income of the home and give the best to her children so that they won't lack anything in life. This is why she works selling beauty products such as: perfumes, make-up, lotions and others. This is a great help to her and of course to her income.
It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so that she will be able to continue moving forward with her business, stocking the quantity of beauty products that she sells, which will allow her to sell more and increase her revenue. With the sum that she is requesting, she will buy hair dye, lotions, skin and hair creams, among other beauty products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, lotions, skin and hair creams, among other beauty products.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for this business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Primitiva is 65 years old now.

Primitiva has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies.

Primitiva has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Primitiva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other supplies

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sharon is 30 years old and two of her children are in school.

Sharon has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Sharon has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Sharon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, cultiva granos básicos tanto para el consumo familiar como para comercializar y así generar ingresos para ir cubriendo los gastos de su hogar, actividad que aprendió de su familia y actualmente tiene un horario de cuatro de la mañana a diez de la noche, es casado y solo su esposa depende económicamente de él.
El crédito que ha solicitado lo utilizara para comprar abono, semilla de maíz e insecticidas, espera aumentar el área de cultivo y que su cosecha sea abundante para contar con alimento por una larga temporada y atender a sus clientes.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para salir adelante y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
José cultivates basic grains both for his own consumption and to sell.  This is how he generates income to cover the expenses of his home.  He learned this occupation from his family.  He currently works from 4:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  He is married, and only his wife depends on him economically.

He will use the loan he seeks to purchase fertilizer, corn seed and insecticides, in the hope of augmenting his cultivation, increasing his harvest and tending to his customers.  His dreams are to continue working in order to get ahead and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, corn seed and insecticides in the hope of augmenting his cultivation area and increasing his harvest.

loans.name: Santos Benjamin

texts.es:
Santos es un agricultor que principalmente siembra maíz y frijol, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, tiene más de 15 años de trabajar de forma independiente con un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde. Santos tiene una familia formada por su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad, toda la familia depende de económicamente de él.
Está preparándose para sembrar granos básicos, no tiene el capital suficiente para realizar todos los trabajos agrícolas de la temporada, por tal motivo se decidió a solicitar un crédito que utilizara para comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas, estos materiales le serán de ayuda para obtener mejores cosechas con las que espera cubrir las necesidades de su familia y las demandas de sus clientes, no representa problemas para realizar la inversión.
Los sueños de Santos son hacer mejoras en su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos para que en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Santos is a farmer who primarily grows corn and beans--he inherited this trade from his family. Santos has been working independently for more than 15 years, his schedule is from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. Santos has a family made up of his life partner and his two children ages five and eight. The entire family is financially dependent on him. 

Santos is preparing to plant basic grains. He does not have the necessary resources to carry out all of the agricultural jobs of the season, for this reason he decided to request a loan which he will use to buy manure, seeds and insecticides. These materials will help him get a better harvest with which he hopes will cover his family's needs and his clients' demands. He does not foresee any problems in making this investment. Santos' dreams are to make improvements to his home and to support his children so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celestina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned good, diapers, and other groceries. 

In the future Celestina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sara Marisol

texts.es:
Sara es madre soltera, vive con su hija, no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero, como medio de subsistencia instalo un atienda de consumo, ofrece huevos, pan, café, azúcar, etc., a los vecinos de su comunidad, atiende al público de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Está pidiendo ayuda con un crédito para invertirlo golosinas, boquitas, sal, aceite, entre otros productos que le faciliten tener un negocio más competitivo y brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, pretende continuar trabajando y cancelar con buena calificación la deuda.
Sara sueña con poder comprar un vehículo para trasladar la mercadería de la tienda con mayor rapidez.
texts.en:
Sara is a single mother and she lives with her daughter. She does not rely on financial help from others but as a means of subsistence she set up a general store that offers eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, etc. to the neighbours in her community. She attends to the public from six in the morning to four in the afternoon. At the moment there are no difficulties in her business.
She is requesting help with a loan to invest in candy, salt, and oil, among other products that will allow her to have a more competitive business and provide better service to her customers. She hopes to continue working and pay back the debt well.
Sara dreams of being able to buy a car to transport the store's merchandise more quickly.

loans.use: to invest in candy, salt, and oil, among other products that will allow her to have a more competitive business.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija, la manera que tiene de generar ingresos económicos para cubrir todas las necesidades familiares es comercializar mariscos, oficio que aprendió con la ayuda de amistades, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio.
Comprará camarones, pescados y moluscos, de esta manera tendrá variedad de producto fresco para ir cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes, la esperanza de José es mantener su negocio con vida para mejorar la situación financiera de su familia.
Sus sueños son adquirir una motocicleta para movilizarse con facilidad y atender a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his life partner and his daughter. He generates income to cover his family's needs by selling seafood. He learned this trade with the help of friends. He has more than 15 years of experience in this business. 

With this loan he will buy shrimp, fish and mollusks and this will give him a variety of fresh product to meet his customers' demands. Jose's hope is to keep up his business so that he can improve his family's financial situation. His dreams are to buy a motorcycle to get around easily and serve new customers.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish and mollusks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow of good quality.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to expand her business, and thereby increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Rudy Alexander

texts.es:
Rudy, es propietario de una tienda de productos básicos para el hogar y además brinda en su comunidad el servicio de un molino nixtamal, aprendió el oficio muy pequeño cuando apoyaba a sus padres en un negocio similar que poseían, su ventaja es que en los alrededores no tiene competencia para el servicio del molino nixtamal, él se encuentra acompañado, su pareja es empleada y sus hijos estudian, él es único que atiende el negocio, todos comparten una misma vivienda.
Ha solicitado un crédito para poder surtir la tienda comprando granos básicos, aceite, bebidas, golosinas, etc., tendrá mercadería nueva para atender a más clientes, espera que las ventas e ingresos sea mayor para así cumplir con sus obligaciones y tener otro rubro.
Sus aspiraciones son finalizar la construcción de su vivienda propia que ya ha iniciado, con la ayuda de créditos y los nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
Rudy owns a store that sells basic household products and also offers his community the services of a nixtamal mill. He learned this small trade when he was helping his parents with a similar business they owned. His advantage is that around that area he does not have competition for the nixtamal mill. He is in a relationship and his partner is employed, his children are in school. He is the only one that tends to the business and they all share the same home. 

He has requested a loan to stock his store by buying basic grains, oil, drinks, candies, etc., he will have new merchandise to serve more customers. He hopes that his sales and earnings will increase so that he can meet his obligations and have another business. His aspirations are to complete the construction of his own home, which he has begun, with the help of loans and his new income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, drinks, candies, etc.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 36-year-old father of two boys, aged 3 and 6 years. He lives with his wife and her younger sister. The children attend school. 

Micheal owns a grocery shop where he sells various grocery items, the main ones being bread, milk, sugar and cooking oils. He utilizes the profit generated by the business to provide for his family. His wife helps out at the shop.

Micheal’s neighborhood lacks a fruit and vegetable shop and also a butchery where people can buy meat, fruits and vegetables. Micheal wants to expand his business and stock meat, fruits and vegetables. He is therefore looking for a loan to buy a cold room, a refrigerated display counter, a cutting saw and a wrapping machine. 

There is a good demand in this market for the products, and therefore, Micheal will easily be able to pay the loan.

The expanded business will also enable Micheal to move his family to a better house.

loans.use: to buy a cold room, refrigerated display counter, cutting saw and a wrapping machine

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María, de 29 años de edad, creció con sus padres y gracias al apoyo que le brindaron logro estudiar hasta bachillerato, su pareja hace un mes se ha ido a trabajar a otra ciudad, pero siempre está pendiente de la familia.- María, creció junto con sus padres trabajando en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos.

, se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, entre otras, también tiene venta de pupusas los fines de semana por la tarde, aprendió gracias a un familiar donde ella trabajo y fue así como se motivó.- También los días de semana venden antojitos y frescos en la escuela.

María, está solicitando el crédito para comprar gaseosas, jugos, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y una plancha para hacer pupusas, pues la que tiene es alquilada y si tiene su propia plancha podrá vender todos los días de la semana. 

El sueño de María, es construir su vivienda de adobe o de bloque, pues la que tiene actualmente es de bahareque y en el invierno se moja.- Además, espera un día poder tener un cafetín cerca de la escuela, para tener un lugar más apropiado donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old. She grew up with her parents and thanks to the support they gave her she was able to finish high school. Her partner went to work in another city a month ago, but he is always watching out for the family.

Maria grew up working on the farm planting basic grains with her parents. She earns a living selling drinks such as sodas, juices, and others, and she also sells pupusas on the weekends in the afternoons. She learned this thanks to a relative where she used to work, and this encouraged her. On the weekdays she sells snack foods and drinks in the school.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy sodas, juices, corn, beans, sugar, oil, and an iron to make pupusas. Right now the iron she has is leased, and if she had her own iron she would be able to sell every day of the week. Maria's dream is to build her house out of adobe or brick since the one she currently has is made of mud, and in the winter it gets wet. She also hopes that one day she can have a cafeteria close to the school in order to have a more appropriate place to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, corn, beans, sugar, oil and an iron to make pupusas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 100 chickens, food to fatten them, fencing to enclose them, and a bed for her daughter.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
A wonderful day lenders! 

This is Rosalina. She is already 57 years old now and has three children. One of them was a special child, and she's praying for a longer life for this kid. She loves her children so much, and she really wishes for their success. 

Currently, she has been managing her sari-sari (variety) store business at Pasay City. She started this trade five years ago and in 2010, she was introduced to CCT. Being a new member, she was highly motivated to improve her business more through the word of God that they study every week. As of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

A sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but sort of smaller than the usual and offers only limited products that are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at a low cost and in a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers. At some points, customers can also have credits. But this sometimes becomes a difficulty for Rosalina, especially when debts are not paid. 

Making headway to improve her sales, Rosalina would like to ask for help from you. She likes to borrow a loan worth PHP 20,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for her family’s daily living conditions. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conchita is 65 years old now.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a 6,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Soklun's Group

texts.en:
A farmer who lives in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Soklun is 42 years old. She is a mother of five dependent children, only two of whom are in school. The others are working for a co-villager’s farm for a fee. 

In order to support her family’s living, she is working hard on her rice farm to earn income. She has been involved in her business for 20 years. 

Unfortunately, her crops have been destroyed by insects, which are an obstacle in her business. For Soklun, this is her first time to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) because of a lack of funds to do farming. She is the group leader of five members and will manage her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and pay for labor fees to support her farmland. 

She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to have the ability to send her children to school to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and pay for labor fees to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 47 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marlyn has a manicure business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure business.

Marlyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure business.

loans.name: Luz Idania

texts.es: Luz de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol para la venta y consumo propio se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 13 años experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de tener una buena cosecha, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, Luz esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para la cosecha como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografia para recoger una buena cosecha y tener mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en: Luz is 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She works growing corn and beans to sell and for her own consumption. She has worked in this activity for the past 13 years, which has given her the opportunity to have a good crop. She sells her products around the area where he lives. Luz is asking for a loan to purchase inputs for her crop such as manure, fertilizers, seeds, etc, as she is showing on the picture, to have a good harvest and earn greater profits.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Divina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Divina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Enma Elisa

texts.es: Enma es una señora de 41 años de edad, ella esta casada y tiene 2 hijas y un hijo. Su hijo tiene 18 años y sus hijas tienen 10 y 21 años. Enma y su esposo  trabajan cosechando en una plantación florícola, Enma junto a su familia vive en el campo y allí existen lotes donde criar animales menores, Enma solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos para aumentar su negocio, Enma espera poder comprar más chanchos y continuar en su negocio para que se haga mas  productivo y asi tener los ingresos económicos para cubrir las necesidades diarias y sobre todo de educación de su hijo e hijas.
texts.en:
Enma, 41, is married and has 2 daughters and a son.  Her son is 18 years old and her daughters are 10 and 21.  Enma and her husband work cultivating  flowers.  She lives with her family in the countryside where they have plots of land to raise small animals.  

Enma is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs to expand her business.  She hopes to buy more pigs and continue with her business so that it can become more productive.  This way she can have more income to cover the daily needs, and most importantly the education, of her son and daughters.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Veun's Group

texts.en:
A farmer who lives in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Veun is 45 years old. She is a mother of two dependent children; one is in school while the other is too young to attend. She is also the leader of this group of three members.

In order to help support the family, Veun works hard on their rice farm while her husband is a paid laborer. She has farmed for twelve years now and earns approximately 35,000 KHR a day, but it is a problem for the family when the yearly harvest is meager.

Veun took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia, a loan that helped improve the family’s life. Now she is applying for a 3,400,000 KHR loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share of the loan to pay for laborers to plow her fields and use the rest of the money to start raising piglets and chickens and buy their feed. She feels that this loan will help her to increase her income and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to plow her fields and start raising piglets and chickens

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando utilizo el crédito anterior para mejorar su negocio de granja de pollos de engorde, tuvo dificultades con el negocio, ya que la mortalidad de pollos fue muy grande en dicho momento, pero no ha sido impedimento para continuar trabajando y cubriendo las necesidades de su núcleo familiar, su situación económica es la misma debido a que los ingresos son de subsistencia.
Ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en la granja y lograr estabilizar la economía familiar, comprara pollos de un día de nacido, concentrado para alimentarlos y materiales de construcción para reparar las galeras en que alberga los pollos, espera tener resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Fernando used his previous loan to improve his chicken farm.  He had some difficulties with the business, because he had a high mortality rate with his chickens for a time.  However, this did not prevent him to keep on working and paying for the needs of his nuclear family.  His financial situation is the same, as his income is at subsistence level.

Fernando has requested a new loan so that he can continue with his work in his chicken farm and stabilize his finances.  He will buy one day-old chicks, chicken feed, and construction materials to repair the pens where he houses the chickens.  He expects to have positive results from this investment.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed and to repair his pens

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old and she supports three children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to supply more litres of milk daily to clients.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to supply more litres of milk daily to clients.

loans.name: Kunja Bihari Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Praphul is a 49-year-old widow from the village of Behera Street in the Koraput district and is the featured borrower of Kunja Bihari SHG-D. She is the one standing on the extreme right. She lost her husband 10 years back in a road accident and has faced crucial times in order to raise her three children single-handedly. She is currently engaged in selling vegetables in the nearby village market. She cultivates different types of vegetable on her own land and sells them in the market. After seeing how life keeps improving for herself and her children, Praphul does not have a bit of doubt about continuing to invest in her home. For this reason, she along with her other two group members has requested a loan amount of 54,000 INR. Praphul will use her portion of the loan to construct her bathroom. She will buy a sink, toilet, shower, and tiles in order to improve her family’s hygiene and quality of life.

She has future plans to purchase livestock in order to start her milk business and gain financial stability through her secured source of income.

loans.use: to buy a sink, toilet, shower, and tiles, in order to improve her family’s hygiene and quality of life.

loans.name: Harapan Kita Group

texts.en:
“Harapan Kita” means Our Hope. It is one of TLM Sesama group loans, which consists of five women who live near one another. Nuraini, a 38-year-old woman, was chosen to lead this group. (She is standing in the second position from the right side). She is married to Wilhem, 38 years old, and they have two kids who are attending school.

In order to support her husband, Nuraini runs a kiosk business. Her kiosk provides daily needs such as shampoo, soap, detergent, instant noodles, snacks, and soft drinks. In addition to that, she also sells yellow rice and some cakes for the elementary school students, as her house is close to an elementary school and the pupils always love to buy meals from her. Nuraini realizes that to increase her business income, she needs extra capital to add various stocks to her kiosk and food stall. Unfortunately, she does not have cash to do so. Some of her neighbors are also facing the same problem as her, so when they heard about the Sesama program offered by TLM they agreed to form the “Harapan Kita” group and apply for a loan of IDR 15,000,000. That loan has helped Nuraini to renew her kiosk stocks such as shampoo, soaps, detergents, conditioner, instant noodles, snacks, soft drinks, and some cake ingredients such as eggs, wheat flour, sugar, margarine, etc. Her other friends who are running a selling-of-cakes business and food stall business have spent that money to buy their business needs.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soaps, detergents, conditioner, instant noodles, snacks, soft drinks, and some cake ingredients such as eggs, wheat flour, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 41 years old, married and supports a family of two children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell for the last 10 years. 

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell, make more income and educate his children. He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family and pay school fees for his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and dairy feeds so as to get milk to sell, make more income and be able to provide for his family, as well as educate his children.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a mother of two kids, both boys. She is 46 years old and she is widowed. She has been a tailor and selling clothes for 20 years now and is able to make a good profit each month. She starts working at 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily. 

This is her fourth credit from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy materials for making clothes. She dreams to own a big business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 28 years old and married with one child in school. Dominga works very hard to provide for them.

Dominga runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Dominga has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Dominga would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy avocados, chiles, onions, papayas, pineapples, grapes, etc. to offer her customers fresh produce and affordable prices

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Esmeralda is 60 years old now.

Esmeralda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Esmeralda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una señora de 50 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, dedicada a la cría y posteriormente la venta de ganado, con esto ha logrado salir adelante ante la ausencia de su esposo quien la dejo hace poco.
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas diarias.

Esta mujer se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales necesarios para arreglar las cocheras, ya que estas con el tiempo se han deteriorado y su estado no es el mejor.

Su sueño es ver su casa bonita, quiere seguir trabajando para ahorrar parte de sus ingresos y cumplir este sueño.

Se siente segura porque sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores de Kiva todos sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 50 year old woman, hard working and humble. She works raising and then selling cattle. She has managed to move forward in the absence of her husband, who recently left her. She works for 5 hours everyday. 

She is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying the materials necessary to fix some pens since they have deteriorated over time and are not in the best shape.

Her dream is to see her house beautiful. She wants to continue working, save part of her income and fulfill this dream.

She feels confident because she knows that with a hand from Interactuar and the Kiva collaborators that all of her dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy the materials necessary to fix some pens.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a kind woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in small town with her family. She is married and has one child. She is a tailor. She sews traditional women's dresses and has regular clients. Her husband is a seller at a store. 

She found her child sick. Medical analysis of her child showed bad results – that she is sick. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to pay for her child’s treatment at a hospital. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s treatment at a hospital

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 35 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dionesia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dionesia has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 36 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Romela has a general store business in the Philippines. Romela requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Romela has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Romela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 1 C

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Win (pictured in the middle), is 38 years old and married with three children. He farms on his two acres while his wife raises ducks and pigs. This loan will help the family rent cropping machines and pay for hired labor. Since farming is covering most of the family's living cost, Win is proud of his work with his cropping business. Win aims to buy a boat to look after the ducks, as well as expand his farm by a few acres. Since tailoring is very profitable in the village and town, Win wants his children to finish school quickly so they can begin to learn tailoring.

Pictured above are the group members from Kyon Paing Village Group 1 C named: Win, San, Sein, Soe and Tin. This loan will help the group to purchase fertilizers and gas for their cropping machines.

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village, and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has children. At this time of the year, when the crops are maturing, Charles keeps himself occupied by venturing into side-businesses such as offering transportation services to generate a regular income.

Charles is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as herbicides and pesticides that will protect the health of his crops and guarantee a safe harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 1 D

texts.en:
Myint (pictured in the middle) is 56 years old and married with one child. His child is a secondary school student. He farms on his 10 acres of crop farm and raises ducks and pigs for his savings. This loan will help the family to invest in their farm and purchase fertilizer. By the end of the year, he aims to expand his farm with more acres and open a small grocery store. Myint values education and wants his child to graduate, even though many parents in the village don’t support their children's education.

Pictured above are the group members for Kyon Paing Village Group 1 D: Myint, Thein and San. This loan will help the group to purchase fertilizer and gas for their cropping machines.

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village, and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Lister, who is in his early 30s, is married with one daughter who is still at school. He has been selling meat for four years now. He works from 5am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Lister's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing his meat stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan and cover household expenses. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He will use this loan to buy meat for his butcher shop. He dreams of opening another butcher shop in a different area.

Lister will share this loan with his loan group, Limousine, which consists of five people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply in the area using his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy is a 43-year-old mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province. For her living, she has been doing rice farming to support her family for 25 years. Her business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expenses. Her rice was sold at a low price because of the drought, and it is the main challenge for her business. Now, she is applying for her first loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her farmland and boost her crop yields. She hopes her rice will grow well and she is able to sell it at a high price to update her lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for supporting her farmland and boosting her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has children. Besides crop farming, Simon also runs a grain mill (pictured) to generate regular income. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of being in crop farming is to anticipate customer wants and fulfill them: This is why he started a grain mill so that customers can not only buy maize/corn in grain form but also as flour, which they can use to make white porridge for the young ones.

Simon is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his maize/corn farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Simon’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 59 years old. She is married with one child who is 19 years old and in university. She owns a pharmacy and has been in a business for the past 30 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more medicines to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Thanks for your kindness and willingness to help lenders. Because of your support previously to Emelinda, she was able to improve sales from her small operating business: a sari-sari store. The income she got from this business well aided the family's needs at that time.

To resume the enterprise, she humbly asks for financial assistance through a loan of PHP 12,000. She would like to use this loan as additional capital for buying more merchandise like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. It will be a great response for her if you'll be affirmative regarding the matter since this business is the only means for the family to earn a living.

She hopes that you will not get tired of helping other people like her, because through this scheme of helping, many lives are being changed and transformed for the better.

She prays that her business will someday expand to help her family. As of now, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for buying more merchandise like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Philippines is known for rich biodiversity. Foreign communities know that Philippines is rich in natural resources. Because of that, it is undoubtedly presumed that the country is also abundant in varieties of fruits, a good favor for entrepreneurs like Genara, 56, who lives in Pasay City.

She buys seasonal native fruits such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells mangoes, apples, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples. Through this, her family is able to earn a living.

Genara is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and part of it will be used to support the general daily living condition of the family.

In the future, Genara hopes for more customers and increased sales. She also dreams of business expansion and prays for job opportunities for her children. Genara meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза купила компьютерную швейную машинку и очень рада своей покупке. Её машинка работает безупречно и время, проведенное за швейной машинкой доставляет ей одно удовольствие. Качество её работы улучшилось и клиенток стало больше. Она увеличила доход от деятельности и улучшила финансовые условия семьи. Хафиза очень благодарна Вам за поддержку. На сей раз она снова хочет, взят кредит для бизнеса. Так как клиенток у неё стало много, она сшила все ткани, которые у неё были. Сейчас ей заказали сшить новые платья, но у неё нет денег на покупку новых тканей. Все свои средства она потратила на семью. Поэтому Хафиза снова хотела обратиться за кредитом. Она очень надеется, что Вы снова её поддержите, и она не потеряет своих клиенток.
texts.en:
Hafiza bought an electronic sewing machine and she is very happy with her purchase. Her new machine works beautifully, and the time that Hafiza spends sewing gives her great pleasure. The quality of her work has improved and she now has more customers. Hafiza's income and activity have also increased, and her family's financial situation has improved. Hafiza is very thankful for your support.

Hafiza is once again taking a loan to improve her business. Since she now has more customers, she has used all the fabrics that she had. However, she has recently received some new orders, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the fabrics needed to sew these additional dresses. All her financial resources have been spent to support her family. For this reason, Hafiza has requested a loan. She hopes that you will be in a position to support her again and that she will not lose any customer.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena sells fruits in Pasay City. At 59 years of age, Nena still works for her children to help Elenito, her husband, to generate income. Elenito, 55, only works as a painter and his work is definitely not a very reliable source of income. There are times when they really see no hope at all.

It was really up and down before for the couple. Yet, a paradigm shift came when she started being involved in CCT in 2007. This membership has opened lots of opportunities for her to improve her family's condition and learn more about business handling. It really improved her idea about entrepreneurship and widen what she experienced for 20 years in this field of selling. It also gave her inspiration to be a fellow co-borrower studying the word of God in a regular weekly fellowship.

Now, she has been introduced to Kiva.

With faith, she would like to access a PHP 10,000 loan from here, which she will use to buy additional stocks of fruits to sell. With this, she is hoping that she can have the chance to increase her monthly income of PHP 19,000.

Her dream is simple. It is always for the success of her children. With that in mind, she really devotes herself to perseverance knowing that her hard work will someday help her children reach their successes.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Maa Mariyam Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Dayamani, 41, is a very hardworking, charismatic, obliging, honourable, and respectful woman who started a grocery store business out of necessity. She is from the village of Malidom Guda in Koraput district and is the featured borrower of Maa Mariyam SHG-A. The lady standing to the left is Dayamani. She lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her daughter who helps her in her grocery shop. This is the second loan for Dayamani from Kiva’s partner Peoples Forum. After successful repayment of her previous loan, she wants to avail another loan.

Dayamani, along with her group member Samani, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Dayamani will use her portion of the loan to renovate the roof of her bathroom, which has deteriorated due to heavy rain and storms and another part of the loan will be used to purchase a hand pump and install it in her home as she has to travel a long distance in order to bring water due to the unavailability of water sources near her house.

loans.use: to renovate the roof of her bathroom and to purchase a hand pump

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya, where he lives with his wife and children. Besides crop farming, Samwel uses his motorcycle to offer transportation services to members of his community to generate extra income. He enjoys his job as a father and is determined to provide a better life for his family.

Samwel is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Samwel’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Fidelina tiene 29 años y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 14 y 5 años de edad son menores de edad y ella les apoya con sus estudios igual el esposo aporta para los gastos del hogar. Fidelina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace 4 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y su amabilidad cada día son más las personas que gustan de sus productos pues demuestra que es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Fidelina desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas y pupusas para vender más en su negocio y hacer un pequeño cuarto donde puedan entrar a comer los clientes ya que por el momento solo atiende para llevar para sus casas y así podrá dar un mejor servicio y contar con una mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, harina de arroz, manteca, tomates, repollo, quesillo, consomé, frijoles, chicharrón, ayote, mora, lorocos y lamina, clavos, madera y de esta manera  tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer y un lugar donde recibir a su clientela, ademas esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidelina, 29, lives in her own house with her husband and children, ages 14 and 5.  She helps them in their studies and her husband contributes to the household economy.

Fidelina makes and sells tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and has been in business for four years.  Thanks to her experience and kindness, every day more and more people enjoy her products which shows that she is a hard-working, responsible woman.

Fidelina wants to buy more raw materials for her business and build on a small room where customers can dine since now she only makes take-away food.  This will allow her to attract more customers and provide better service.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy corn, rice flour, lard, tomatoes, cabbage, cheese, consome, beans, pork cracklings, pumpkin, blackberries and loroco flower.  She also will buy metal sheeting, nails and wood.  By offering more products and a place for customers to eat she will be able to improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice flour, lard, tomatoes, cabbage, cheese, consome, beans, pork cracklings, pumpkin, blackberries, loroco (plant flower), and metal sheeting, nails and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz para la venta y para consumo propio, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, gracias a su trabajo es como el puede salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos así como muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos económicos.
texts.en: This young man's face is blurred because he is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He grows beans and corn, both to sell and for his own consumption and has been in this trade for eight years.  thanks to his work is able to get ahead.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manures, as seen in the photograph.  This is so he can continue his work which is his only source of income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and manures.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, se dedica a sembrar una manzana de café y de manera asociada cultiva plátano, cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, es una actividad que aprendió a desarrollarla con ayuda de su padre, no tiene un horario establecido. José es casado, su esposa y él tienen 45 años de edad, han procreado 4 hijos con edades de 22, 18, 12 y 4 años.
En busca de tener mejor productividad en su negocio solicita un crédito que utilizara para comprar 2, 000 árboles de café y fertilizantes de esta manera ampliara el área de trabajo y cuidara mejor de sus cultivos, espera así tener acceso a mejores ingresos para cancelar la deuda.
Las aspiraciones que tiene el sr. José son seguir produciendo café y enseñar a sus hijos todo lo relacionado con el negocio para que ellos tengan mejores conocimientos.
texts.en:
Jose has a small coffee plantation and also grows bananas.  He has 20 years' experience and learned the trade from his father. His work day has no fixed schedule.

Jose is married and he and his wife are both 45 years old.  They have four children ages 22, 18, 12 and 4.

In an effort to increase production he is requesting a loan to buy 2,000 coffee trees and fertilizer to expand his plantation and care for his crops better.  He hopes to increase his income to pay off debt.

Jose's goal is to continue producing coffee and teach his children everything related to the business so they can acquire more knowledge.

loans.use: To buy 2,000 coffee trees and fertilizer to expand his plantation and care for his crops.

loans.name: Allan Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 54 años, que junto a su esposa se dedican a la cría y venta de ganado, este ha sido un medio por el cual esta pareja ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos.
Trabajan 4 días a la semana durante 5 horas diarias.

Antonio se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de tres terneros y abonos para el pasto. Espera hacer un buen provecho de esto y lograr cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones en que se encuentra su casa, ya que con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.

Anímese y aporte a la vida de este hombre con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonio, 54, and his wife raise and sell cattle for a living.  This is how they have supported themselves and their two children.  They work four days a week, five hours a day.

Antonio is requesting a loan to buy three calves and fertilizer for the pasture.  He hopes to take advantage of the loan and improve the conditions of his house which has been deteriorating over time.

Please help this man's life through your loan.

loans.use: To buy three calves and fertilizer for the pasture.

loans.name: Amanda Maricruz

texts.es:
Amanda, convive con sus hijos, ella es la jefa de su hogar y no posee ayuda económica del extranjero, para cumplir con sus responsabilidades fundo su negocio propio de venta de fruta picada y lo hace con la ayuda de tres empleados, tiene 15 años de desarrollar dicha actividad.
Con el capital que está solicitando comprara sandías, naranjas, papayas, zapotes, etc., abastecerá el negocio con todo lo necesario para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que su negocio crezca y que los ingresos sean estables para salir adelante con su familia.
Los objetivos de Amanda son darle a su familia un estilo de vida digno y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Amanda lives with her children and is head-of-household, with no economic support from overseas.  To meet her responsibilities she established her own business selling mashed fruit which she produces with the help of three employees.  She has been active in the business for 15 years.

With the loan she is requesting she will buy watermelons, oranges, papayas, sapotes, etc. to stock her business and be able to attend to customers better.

Amanda's goal is to give her family a dignified lifestyle so her children can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, oranges, papayas, sapotes, etc. to stock her business and attend to customers better.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su hermana y su cuñado, trabaja en el área agrícola dedicándose a la producción de yuca en su terreno propio el cual lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo después de muchos años de trabajo, al año cultiva 1 hectárea y media de yuca, de donde comercializa 600 quintales a comerciantes que van a comprarle al lugar de su actividad, esta producción es su fuente de sustento económico, el señor es una persona responsable que tiene el deseo de salir adelante, actualmente necesita un préstamo para pagar los gastos médicos del tratamiento de su cuñado quien tuvo un accidente (jugando futbol), se golpeó la región occipital y perdió la conciencia durante dos horas aproximadamente por lo cual fue internado y debido a ello surgieron muchos gastos, ahora el se encuentra un poco mejor pero no tiene como pagar todo lo que adeuda a la clinica.
texts.en:
The borrower is single and has no children. He lives with his sister and brother-in-law. 

The borrower works in farming, growing yucca on land that he bought after many years of hard work. Every year the borrower grows yucca on 1.5 hectares of land, and sells 600 hundredweights of the crop to traders who come to buy the product from him. This work allows the borrower to take home an income.

The borrower is responsible and wants to move forward in life. He currently needs a loan in order to cover medical costs for his brother-in-law, who had a an accident when playing football: he was hit in the back of the skull and lost consciousness for around two hours. He was, as a result, admitted to hospital, which has resulted in many expenses. The brother-in-law is now a little better but does not have the money to pay the clinic.

loans.use: to cover his medical costs for his brother-in-law, who has suffered an accident and is in hospital.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 6 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 32 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her family. She has had a beauty salon in her home for six years. Ana has many customers as she does a very good job. With profits, Ana is able to move forward with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hairpins and other things that she needs. With these items, Ana can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, scissors, hairpins and other things that she needs.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a 45-year-old married woman with three children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose Marie has a beauty products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other beauty products.

Rose Marie has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other beauty products.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 49 years old, married and supports a family of 6 children. He supplies construction materials and has been in this business for 16 years now. 

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more construction supplies such as building stones and blocks. He hopes this will enable him to supply more construction materials and make more income to support his family. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family as well as to buy dairy cattle and start dairy farming. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies, such as building stones and blocks, for supply to construction sites.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
Once a man quoted, "The cave you fear to enter hides the treasure you seek." 

That's why Arcadio is not afraid to face risks in operating his business. Thus, he works hard in his current business. Ever since, he dreams to have his own place for his business but he also believes that dreaming alone is not enough - works are required.

He's only 37 now and married to Leny. He sells fruits and vegetables on a sidewalk near their place in Pasay City. He wakes up early to assemble his space every day, then diligently waits for customers that he serves by hand. 

He typically earns just enough every day. But of course he wants to earn a higher income. So he asks you for a loan that would help him improve his business. He would like to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables plus other needed materials for establishing his stand. A loan of PHP 10,000 would be sufficient enough.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur from Fatima, General Santos City, Philippines. She is 40 years old and has three children. She is married to Constancio, who is a machinist. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Gemma buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day. Aside from fish, she also sells grocery items patronized by her customers.

Gemma is taking out a loan of 30,000 PHP to continue her business operations. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish and groceries which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and she desires for her children to finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries and fish which she will add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Petraq

texts.en: Petraq is 50 and a married father of two:a 20-year-old and an 8-year-old who was born with some problems in his limbs and for this, he receives a disability income of $174 per month. In addition to this, they live in a village known for the best black mulberry alcohol drink, yet they own no land like the majority of villagers. However, they found a way to make an income about five years ago by starting to operate a little cafe as seen in the photograph. Recently, he became short on money because he had paid a lump sum amount for some medications, thus he could not afford buying inventory items for his cafe and this is why he is requesting this loan. His wife works in a pastry shop where she makes approximately $250 per month.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for the bar-cafe.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María desea que se le otorgue un nuevo crédito que piensa invertirlo en insumos agrícolas para proteger sus cultivos de granos básicos y obtener cosechas abundantes.
Con la ayuda de créditos se ha mantenido trabajando en la agricultura, su familia se mantiene y las condiciones de vida estan mejorando, manifiesta que por el momento se ha mantenido trabajando sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Maria wishes to receive a loan which she is thinking about investing in agricultural supplies to protect her basic grains and obtain a plentiful harvest. 

With the help of loans she has continued to work in agriculture, she continues to maintain her family and their living conditions are improving. At the moment she shows that she has continued to work without difficulties.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies to protect her basic grains and to obtain plentiful harvests

loans.name: Gisela Aldonia

texts.es:
Gisela tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada junto a su menor hijo de 6 años de edad, en el distrito de Pucará, que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

Gisela se dedica la de venta de ceviche y refrescos,esta actividad la realiza en el distrito de Pucara esta labor le permite solventar el crédito sin ningún problema, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, el destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio de venta de ceviche y otros que realiza y así mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Gisela is 24 years old, she is a single mother and lives in a rented house together with her young child who is 6 years old. They live in the Pucara district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Gisela earns a living selling ceviche (fresh raw fish dish cured in juices with peppers) and peppers. SHe does this in the Pucara region, this work allows her to settle the debt without any problems. With good personal and working references, the loan will be used to invest in her business selling ceviche and other things that she makes in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to increase the productivity of her business

loans.name: Bacilio
