texts.es: El señor Bacilio tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio de Monteagudo en su domicilio Propio, su actividad es el servicio de peluquería exclusivamente para varones realizando todo tipo de cortes de los cuales genera sus ingresos para sustentar los gastos de su familia, tiene  su esposa y ella se dedica exclusivamente a la atención de su familia, ambos tienen cuatro hijos que dependen de ellos, el señor necesita un préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas de trabajo como  tijeras, maquinas eléctricas y un kiosco para no seguir pagando alquileres mensuales, el señor tiene la esperanza de obtener el préstamo con lo cual el podrá generar mayores ingresos de su actividad y así podrá tener mejores condiciones de vida, además de financiar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 41 years old, his lives in the Chuquisaca department, Monteagudo municipality en his own home. He works as a hairdresser for men, carrying out all types of haircuts which generate his income in order to cover the costs of the family home. 

He has a wife who spends her time caring for the family, they both have 4 children that depend upon them. 

He needs a loan in order to buy new work tools such as scissors, electrical machines and a kiosks so he no longer has to pay monthly rent. 

He hopes to obtain a loan which will allow him to generate more income from this activity, and therefore be able to have a better quality of life, and to finance the studies of his children.

loans.use: to buy new work tools such as scissors, electrical tools and a kiosk in order to start his own business.

loans.name: Wenkame

texts.fr: Wenkame est une femme au foyer âgée de 46 ans qui habite à Agoè.  Mère de trois enfants, Wenkame prépare du  fromage de soja et le revend au marché. Wenkame fait l’achat de son nécessaire au marché deux fois par mois. Wenkame souhaite acheter des sacs de soja avec l’octroi de ce prêt. Grâce l’épargne qui  résultera, Wenkame prendra bien soin de ses enfants.
texts.en: Wenkame is a 46-year-old housewife who lives in à Agoe. She is also a mother to three children. Wenkame makes soya cheese then sells it at market. She purchases the necessary ingredients twice per month from market. With this loan, Wenkame hopes to purchase seven sacks of soya. She will use the profits to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of soya

loans.name: Adjo Djigbodi

texts.fr: Divorcé  et mère de quatre enfants, Djigbodi est une femme âgée de 39 ans résidant à Agoè. Djigbodi est une revendeuse d’oignons à domicile et ambulante  qui s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois dans le mois. Djigbodi désire ce prêt pour acheter un sac d’oignons afin de bénéficier d’un gain pour favoriser la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Djigbodi is a 39-year-old divorced mother to four children who lives in Agoe. She earns a living by selling onions out of her home and as a street vendor. She gets her supplies four times per month from market. Djigbodi is requesting this loan to purchase a sack of onions so she can earn enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase smoked and dried fish in order to resell it during the winter period

loans.name: Bricelda Esmeralda

texts.es: Bricelda de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda familiar junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que a diario lucha para salir adelante a lado de su esposo que le ayuda con su negocio y aporta para la economía del hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y pupusas desde hace un año y es así como se gana la vida gracias a su negocio que posee en su vivienda, pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos a empezado a vender panes con aguacate, queso, mortadela y otros ingredientes mas, por lo que necesita comprar materia prima para poder movilizarse de un lugar a otro ya que quiere comercializar por otros lados a parte de su comunidad. Bricelda ha observado que cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, papas, cebollas, repollo, güisquil, chiles, pipianes, berenjena, ejotes y maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, y poder comprar un carretón  de panes para transportar su venta de productos en forma ambulantes.
texts.en: Bricelda is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She is a very hard-working woman that fights every day to get ahead along with her husband who helps her with her business and provides to the household economy. She has worked selling vegetables and stuffed tortillas for the past year and that is how she makes a living thanks to her business that she has in her home. She is also looking for a way to get a better economic income by beginning to sell breads with avocado, cheese, bologna and other ingredients. For this, she needs to buy raw materials to be able to move from one place to another since she wants to commercialize in other places in her community. Bricelda has observed that each day there are more people who ask for her products, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in tomatoes, potatoes, onions, cabbage, chayote, chilies, squash, eggplant, green beans and corn, beans, pork rind, fresh cheese, and to be able to buy a bread cart to transport her sales to the streets.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, potatoes, onions, cabbage, chayote, chilies, squash, eggplant, green beans and corn, beans, pork rind, fresh cheese, and to be able to buy a bread cart.

loans.name: Adela Isabel

texts.es:
Adela, comenta haber tenido un impacto positivo en su negocio al haber utilizado el crédito anterior para fortalecerlo, con los nuevos ingresos cancelo su deuda, su familia tiene mejor alimentación y ella está embarazada, es por ello que se siente motivada para continuar trabajando. 
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, asi mismo productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, con lo que diversificara la mercadería y tendrá oportunidad de atraer a nuevos clientes.
texts.en: Adela says that using the previous loan to strengthen her business has had a positive impact. With the new income, she could pay off her debt, her family has better food and she is pregnant. For this reason, she feels motivated to keep working. She needs a new loan to buy agricultural supplies to grow basic grains, as well as beauty products and items of clothing to diversify her merchandise which will give her the opportunity to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow basic grains, and also beauty products and items of clothing to diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Merlima

texts.en:
Merlima is a hardworking rural smallholder crop farmer in Kitale area of Kenya. He owns a farmland where he works and lives with his wife and children. He enjoys growing vegetables for it provides food for his family and a network of clients as well. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of being in crop farming is the importance of using quality farm inputs to prepare for abundant harvests.

Merlima is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer in preparation for growing of more vegetables. These inputs are very expensive and most farmers can only afford them after harvest, when they no longer need them. 

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Merlima’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Maa Mariyam Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Gyanmani, age 39, is an enterprising woman and is the featured borrower of Maa Mariyam SHG-B from the village Malidom Guda of Koraput district. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter and her elderly parents, standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She devotes herself to agriculture as her parents did. However, she sometimes makes traditional clothing when her neighbours ask her to do so. She earns extra money by making the clothes.She is currently the only financial support in her family, given that her parents are now elderly. 

Gyanmani, along with her other group members, is requesting the loan of 54,000 INR. Gyanmani will use her portion of the loan amount to build a bathroom for her family in order to prevent them from diseases that are caused by open defecation and urination. She will incorporate steel pipes to facilitate water supply.

In the future, she hopes to be able to improve her house in order to give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and incorporate steel pipes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is age 29 years, married to Bernard and she supports four children.

She has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns her KES 25,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.  

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her to supply more litres of milk daily to clients. Her hope is to expand her agricultural business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salvador Alfredo

texts.es: Salvador de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia en compañía de su hijo de 20 años de edad quien es un hombre muy trabajador y que gracias a su padres que le a brindo todo su apoyo en sus estudios pues el hoy agradece y sabe defenderse en la vida. Salvador se dedica a la crianza de pollo los que luego  vende  vivos o muertos, son muchas personas que prefieren su producto por ser fresco y de buena calidad  y gracias a este negocio obtiene sus ingresos económicos, por lo que desea ampliar  mas su granuja y al mismo tiempo invertir en la compra de mas pollos  ya que se ha dado cuenta que son muchas la personas que lo solicitan. Por lo anterior por lo Salvador solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrando, vitaminas, lámina, madera y malla de alambre, todo con el objetivo de construir una granja más grande y aumentar sus ventas para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Salvador is 61 years old and lives in his own home with his 20-year-old son. His son is a very hard-working man who knows how to fend for himself, thanks to his parents' support in his studies, for which he is grateful. Salvador makes a living raising chickens, which he then sells live or dead. Many people prefer his product as it is good quality and fresh and, thanks to this business, he has a source of income.

He wants to expand his farm and, at the same time, invest in buying more chickens as he has realised that there is a lot of demand. Salvador is therefore requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in chickens, chicken feed, vitamins, metal sheet, wood and wire mesh, with the aim of building a bigger farm and increasing his sales so as to raise profits.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, chicken feed, vitamins, metal sheet, wood and wire mesh, to build a bigger farm and increase his sales.

loans.name: Ushirikiano Kiburugwa Group

texts.en:
Amini is a businessman. He is 27 years old. He has been running a book store and studio business for six years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Amini’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in his business. He dreams of expanding his business so that the income will grow and improve his living standards. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, “Ushirikiano Kiburugwa," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his business.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: La señora Eduarda siempre mantuvo la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida con trabajo y esfuerzo junto a su conyugue quien viajo al extranjero en busca de un trabajo mejor para mantener a su familia y apoyar a su esposa con la apertura de un negocio, su esposo regreso del exterior y pudieron cumplir parte del sueño de tener su negocio propio que es una tienda de barrio que abrió desde hace dos años,  el mismo va mejorando poco a poco, actualmente con la alta demanda que tiene, solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, de forma que su negocio continué creciendo.
texts.en: Eduarda always had hopes of improving her quality of life with work and effort, alongside her husband who traveled abroad in search of better work to provide for his family and to support his wife with the opening of a business. Her husband returned and they could complete part of the dream of having their own business, which is a neighborhood store that opened two years ago. The business is improving little by little. Now, with the high demand of the store, Eduarda is asking for a loan to buy products for her business and thus satisfy her customer's demands and increase her sales so that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy products for her business and thus satisfy her customer's demands and increase her sales so that her business continues to grow.

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Patricia, nuevamente solicita un crédito por la motivación de seguir progresando junto a los suyos, comprara arroz, leche, plátano,  azúcar, aceite y otros materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de empanadas.
Con el crédito anterior ha podido mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, le brinda un estilo de vida más confortable a su familia y tienen nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: Patricia is asking for another loan because of the motivation to keep progressing alongside her loved ones. She will buy rice, milk, bananas, sugar, oil and other needed materials to prepare empanadas for sale. With the previous loan, she was able to keep her customers satisfied. It gives her and her family a more comfortable lifestyle and they have a new income.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, bananas, sugar, oil and other needed materials to prepare empanadas for sale.

loans.name: Prisikira

texts.en:
Prisikira is 36 years old, married and supports a family of four children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 10 years, earning KES 30,000 per month.

Prisikira has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production in order to supply to various customers for more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply to various customers for more income.

loans.name: Kimratvannak

texts.en:
Kimratvannak is 21 years old, single, and lives with his family at Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

Nowadays, Kimratvannak is a student at NTTI Institute in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He studies the field of electricity and is in year 3, semester 1.
 
He would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fee.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, también cuida de su padre quien es persona bastante mayor de edad, su actividad económica es cultivar granos básicos para alimentar a su familia y comercializarlo entre sus clientes, oficio que heredó de su padre y actualmente lo hace durante todo el año.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros para llevar a cabo sus actividades agrícolas, dará un mejor trato a sus cultivos para obtener cosechas abundantes, tiene la fe en Dios de saber administrar el capital y así cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Tiene la visión de aprender a trabajar con créditos para mantener su negocio con vida, disminuir sus deudas y dar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en: Oscar lives with his wife and two children. He also takes care of his father who is very elderly. His job is to grow basic grains to feed his family and to sell among his customers. He inherited the job from his father and now he does it all year long. He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the workers to carry out their agricultural jobs. He will give his crops better treatment to get abundant harvests. He has faith in God to know how to manage the money and pay off the acquired debt. He has a vision of learning to work with loans to keep his business alive, lessen his debts and give his family a more dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay the workers to carry out their agricultural jobs. He will give his crops better treatment to get abundant harvests.

loans.name: Kim Chheng

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Kim Chheng is 27 years old. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school; the other one is too young to attend school. 

The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and her husband's labor as a paid worker. She has been involved in both businesses for nine years. Drought causes her crops to produce very low output. 

Kim Chheng has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid her past loan. Through that loan, she was able to support her child’s education and she has enough to support her family’s living. 

Now, she is taking a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to increase her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and have the ability to keep her children in school until their graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old, married and supports a family of four children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 10 years, earning KES 40,000 per month.
 
Lucy has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: La señora Marta es originaria de Chuquisaca migro hacia el trópico con la finalidad de buscar un mejor futuro, tiene su casa propia que la adquirió con mucho sacrificio, trabaja en un terreno alquilado ya que aún no se pudo comprar su propio lote agrícola, cuando llego al trópico empezó a trabajar como ayudante en los lotes agrícolas de sus conocidos quienes le acogieron con mucho cariño, después de muchos años de sacrificio logro adquirir y construir su casa propia, ahora solicita un crédito para la ampliar su producción de yuca, para comprar con  los ingresos su propio lote agrícola, ya que ahora está pagando alquiler de 4 has. de terreno.
texts.en: Marta is originally from Chuquisaca. She migrated to the tropics to look for a better future. She owns her own house, which she bought through a lot of sacrifice. She works on rented land since she is not yet able to buy her own plot of land. When she arrived in the tropics, she started to work as a laborer on the agricultural plots of acquaintances, who took her in with great affection. After many years of sacrifice, Marta managed to save enough to build her own house. Now she requests a loan in order to increase her production of cassava so that with the income she can buy her own agricultural plot. Currently she is paying rent on four hectares of land.

loans.use: to increase her production of cassava so that with her income she can buy her own plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vicenta Dolores

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Manos Que Dan Reciben se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo turístico es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 14, 13 y 12 años  de edad, todos estudian en colegio, el marido es controlador en un bus de transporte. 
Doña Vicenta con la finalidad de ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y al ver que su marido no gana mucho se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces y queso, ella  todas las mañanas compra el queso a  comerciantes que le entregan al por mayor, ella en su casa instalar un pequeño local en el cual vende el queso por libras a las personas que pasan por el lugar, allí mismo ella también vende los dulces que ella prepara ya sea en las mañanas o el día anterior, de esta forma ella logra ganar sus propios recursos para el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, leche y futas para la fabricación de los dulces y queso para la venta. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante.  Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Manos Que Dan Reciben loan group meets every two weeks in Pajan canton, a canton known as being very strong in animal husbandry in the province, one of the tourist attractions is the Montubio rodeo which is held in some seasons of the year. 

Vicenta lives in this place. She is 36 years old, married, and in this relationship has three children, ages 14, 13 and 12. All of them go to secondary school. Her husband is a driver in a transport bus. 

Vincenta, with the end of helping her husband with the expenses that the household generates, and seeing that her husband doesn't earn a lot, works making and selling sweets and cheese. Every morning she purchases the cheese from salespeople who sell it to her in bulk; in her house she has installed a small stand where she sells the cheese by the pound to people who pass by the place. She also sells sweets that she makes that morning or the previous day. In this way, she manages to earn her own income for the good of her family. 

This loan is to purchase sugar, milk, and fruit to make the sweets and cheese to sell. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she gets ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, fruit and cheese.

loans.name: Genny Marlene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 24, 22, 18 y 15 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en  colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Genny es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su labor, el tiene un taxi en el cual realiza fletes  en la ciudad de Manta, el también si sus clientes lo desean también realiza transporte de alumnos a escuelas por lo que cobra por este servicio una tarifa mensual. Él necesita del crédito pues el carro necesita de varios arreglos para así brindar un mejor servicio.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas y repuestos para el taxi. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le Gusta porque los créditos siempre le son de mucha ayuda para los gastos urgentes. Sus sueños son tener otro taxi.
texts.en:
The Montecristi loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats. 

Genny lives in this place. She is 43 years old, married, and in this relationship they have four children, ages 24, 22, 18, and 15. The three older ones are university students and the youngest is in secondary school. Her husband is a driver.

Genny is a very good wife who takes out the loan for her husband to use in his work. He has a taxi in which he does transportation in the city of Manta. And also, if his customers want, he transports students to school, a service for which he charges a monthly fee. He needs the loan since the car needs some repairs to offer a better service.

This loan is to purchase tires and spare parts for the taxi. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it because the loans are always a great help for the urgent expenses. Their dream is to have another taxi.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Nanny Soledad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nanny, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es mayor de edad, estudia en universidad y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer profesional.
Doña Nanny es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites,  legumbres además de ciertas cosas de basar, papelería, helados, entre otros productos,  ella siempre con la ayuda de los créditos aumenta su mercadería para ganar más clientela ya que al brindar más productos su clientela aumenta razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos ya que así sus ganancias son mejores para bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar toda clase de víveres para surtir más su tienda y brindar más variedad de productos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 7 años  y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños es tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Montecristi loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats. 

Nanny lives in this place. She is 46 years old, married, and from this relationship, they have a child who is an adult and studies at the university and still lives in her house. Her husband is a professional driver.

Nanny is a woman who likes to work to get ahead with her family. She has a grocery store in her house, there she sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, oils, vegetables, in addition to some small items, paper good, ice creams, and more products. She always, with the help of the loans, increases her merchandise to earn more customers since by offering more products, her customer base increases, the reason for which she is very grateful to the foundation and to the people who help her with the loans since her earnings are greater for the good of her family.

This loan is to purchase all sorts of groceries to stock her store more and offer a wider variety of products. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it for the services that the institution offers. Her dreams are to have good health and continue onward.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Katerin Zuleyma

texts.es:
Katerin es un joven de 23 años de edad, dedicada a la cría, cuidado y venta de aves, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, de  allí se generen los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia conformada por tres hijos menores y su actual pareja.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de engorde y cuido de levante, con esto espera que aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera la mejora de sus ingresos.

Para esta mujer no hay nada imposible, a pesar de las circunstancias por las que ha pasado, quiere seguir trabajando para pagarle la educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues su estado no es el mejor.
texts.en:
Katerin is a young woman of 23 years old who makes a living breeding, rearing and selling chickens. She has made a great deal of progress and this generates enough income to support her family of three minor children and her current partner.

She is now requesting a loan to invest in buying chickens for fattening and chicken feed; with this she hopes to increase her sales and therefore improve her income.

For this woman nothing is impossible, despite the circumstances she has faced. She wants to continue working to pay for her children's education and to improve their housing conditions, as her home isn't in the best condition.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and chicken feed

loans.name: Leyli Elizabeth

texts.es: Leyli tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su hijo mayor el cual ya no depende de ella,  el ya trabaja y el ayuda a su madre económicamente por lo que Leyli se siente muy orgullosa de su hijo por ser el que ayuda para los gastos del hogar. Leyli posee una pequeña tienda desde hace cinco años donde vende lo más necesario como son productos básicos, son muchas las personas que solicitan de sus productos por ser una mujer muy amable con sus clientes lo que le permite cada día tener mejores ingresos económicos, debido a que cada día son más los clientes Leyli quiere invertir más en la tienda por lo  que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: azúcar, arroz, huevos, leche, pastas, pan dulce, café, jabón, detergentes, aceite, margarina, etc., para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leyli, 46, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her eldest son who is no longer dependent on her. He works and helps his mother financially, which makes Leyli incredibly proud of her son for taking care of the household expenses. 

Leyli has had a small shop for the past five years where she sells basic commodities. Since she is very kind to her customers, many people request her products which has helped her to gradually increase her income. Due to her growing customer base, Leyli wants to invest more in her shop which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: sugar, rice, eggs, milk, sweet bread, coffee, soap, detergent, oil and margarine etc. to meet the product demand of her customers.

loans.use: to meet the demand of her customers by investing in sugar, rice, eggs, milk, sweet bread, coffee, soap, detergent, oil and margarine etc.

loans.name: Elsa Cleotilde

texts.es: Elsa de 48 años de edad se dedica desde hace 22 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, elotes, frijoles y arroz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Elsa, 48 years old, has worked for 22 years in agriculture, planting different types of corn, beans, and rice, and sells her products in the different markets that are near her house. She lives with her family in their own house. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. to be able to continue with her work and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Natividad

texts.es: Carlos de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 9 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner. He has worked for 9 years in agriculture, planting corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his house. The client is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc., as shown in the photograph, to be able to continue with his work and have better income. 
 de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 9 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, metal and gravel to build the cement pillars for the water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beams, metal sheeting and screws to build a new enclosure in her house.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Germán de 59 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 25 años y su nieta de 11 años de edad que es su mayor alegría. Germán se dedica a prestar sus servicios como agente de seguridad de rancho en la playa de su comunidad lo que le ha permitido salir adelante y sostener la economía de su hogar. Germán desea continuar con las mejoras en su vivienda, ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual utilizo para hacer el cambio de techo del corredor de la vivienda, por lo que actualmente desea seguir con la mejora de su casa y es por ello que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc. y de esta manera ofrecer una casa más digna a su familia.
texts.en: Germán, 59 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and 25-year-old son and 11-year-old granddaughter who is his greatest joy. Germán works as a security guard on a farm on the beach of his community, which has allowed him to get ahead and sustain the household economy. Germán wants to continue with the improvements on the house, since he previously asked for a loan which he used to replace the roof on the outdoor hall of his house, and he wants to continue with the home improvements and for this he is asking for another loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, etc. and in this way offer his family a more dignified house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and in this way to offer his family a more dignified house.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos una niña de 9 años de edad y dos niños de 13 y 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre  responsable que ha luchado por llevarle a diario lo necesario a su familia, su esposa también le ayuda con el aporte económico del hogar. Gilberto presta sus servicios a una pequeña empresa que se encuentra cercana a su vivienda, ha esforzado por mantener una vivienda digna para su familia pero aún no ha logrado construir un muro perimetral y a una parte colocarle techo y tener más espacio en su casa para sus hijos. Por eso él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, lámina y grava para construir el muro perimetral en su vivienda, espera una respuesta favorable para comenzar con la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Gilberto, 53 years old, lives with his wife and their three children, a 9-year-old girl and two boys, ages 13 and 11. He is a responsible man who has struggled to bring his family what they need daily. His wife also helps him by contributing to the household economy. Gilberto works in a small business that is near his home. He has worked hard to maintain a dignified house for his family but has still not been able to build a perimeter wall and put a roof on one part and have more space in the house for his children. For this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, bricks, sand, metal, metal sheeting, and gravel to build a perimeter wall for his house. He hopes for a favorable response to begin the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand, metal, metal sheeting, and gravel to build a perimeter wall for his house.

loans.name: David Enoc

texts.es: David vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por sus padres y su hermano, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol, desde hace 6 años sus ventas son durante los meses de diciembre a mayo y lo hace en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y seguir con sus cultivos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: David lives in his own house with his family, made up of his parents and his brother. He has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans, for the past 6 years. He makes his sales during the months of December to May and he does it in the nearby areas to where he lives. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and to continue with his crops to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Sarahi Nohemí

texts.es:
La principal fuente de ingresos de Sarahí es la venta ropa y perfumes, sin embargo, hace alguno años comenzó en el mundo de los negocios con la distribución de artículos del hogar y gracias a los financiamiento que MiCrédito ofrece, pudo invertir y ampliar sus ventas, al reabastecer su negocio; por lo cual se siente muy agradecida.  

En esta ocasión, solicita un crédito para comprar perfumenes, cremas, desodorantes, pantalones, camisas, blusas, shorts,   y demás productos de la temporada; porque quiere aprovechar la temporada de fiestas patronales para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sarahí's primary source of income is the sale of clothing and perfumes, however, some years ago she entered into the world of business with distributing household products and, thanks to the loans that MuCrédito offers, was able to invest and expand her sales, to restock her business, for which she is very grateful.

At this time, she asks for a loan to purchase perfumes, creams, deodorants, pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, and other seasonal products because she wants to take advantage of the season of patron saint celebrations to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, deodorants, pants, shirts, blouses, and shorts.

loans.name: Flor Natividad

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad,  una  de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado
Doña Flor es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo y bisuterías, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres  o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes, no tiene horarios fijos si no cuando pueda, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y  bisuterías. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee for the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Flor lives in this place. She is 69 years old, married, and from this relationship they have six adult children, one of them still lives with her. Her husband is retired.

Flor is a woman who likes to work to get her household ahead. She works in sales, she sells all sorts of clothing and costume jewelry. She sells from door to door, she goes out three or four days per week, in the morning or afternoon. She doesn't have a set schedule but goes out when she can. She also sells from her house where her customers come when they want some clothing. clohtingShe leaves the products on credit with her customers and collects weekly or every two weeks. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, with which she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan will be used to purchase clothing and costume jewelry. She has been in the loan group for more than 10 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad,  dos de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado
Doña Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora por el bien de su familia, ella en sociedad con una de sus hijas tienen un local en su casa donde venden telas, hilos, cierres, botones, encajes y muchos otros materiales de costura así como también fomix y materiales para manualidades, ellas allí también elaboran decoraciones y manualidades en muchos diseños bajo pedido. Trabajan todos los días y tienen mucha clientela la misma que han conseguido a lo largo de los 10 años que llevan con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones y materiales para manualidades. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus seños son seguir gozando de salud y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee for the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Luz lives in this place. She is 66 years old, married, and from this relationship has 4 adult children, two of them still live with her. Her husband is retired. 

Luz is a very hard-working woman for the good of her family. Along with one of her daughters, she has a retail space in her house where they sell fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, lace and many other materials for sewing and also Fomix and materials for crafts. They also make decorations and crafts in many designs to order. They work every day and have many customers, which they have earned over the 10 years that they have had this business, which allows them to get ahead.

This loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and materials for crafts. She has been in the loan group for more than 15 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dreams are to continue enjoying health and improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Jacinta Emperatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 38 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  21, 17 y 12  años de edad,  dos de ellos estudian en universidad y colegio. 
Doña Jacinta es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella es maestra y trabaja en un colegio de la localidad, pero además de esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos de catalogo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella en sus ratos libres vende los zapatos a sus compañeras y madres de familia que llegan hasta el colegio, también en las noches y fines de semana sale a vender por la localidad  a personas de la localidad que le compran desde hace dos años que lleva con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de varios modelos ya que tiene bastantes pedidos. Lleva más de 16 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee for the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Jacinta lives in this place. She is 38 years old, separated, and from this relationship they have three children, ages 21, 17, and 12. Two of them are university and secondary school students.

Jacinta is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She is a teacher and works in a local secondary school. But, in addition to this, she also works in commerce, selling shoes from catalogs and her sales method is from door to door. In her free time, she sells shoes to her coworkers and mothers of families who come to the school. Also, at night and on weekends, she goes out to sell in the area to people who live in the area who have purchased what she carries in her business for the past two years.

This loan will be used to purchase various models of shoes since she has a lot of orders. She has been in the loan group for more than 16 years and she likes it because the loans improve her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Elsa Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  24, 22 y 10  años de edad,  dos de ellos  estudian en universidad y uno en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de soldadura y pintura de carros.
Doña Elsa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos como ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella trabaja todos los días ya que le encanta salir a vender, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante, ella también parte del crédito le da a su marido para que él lo utilice en comprar materiales que el emplea en sus trabajos. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, pinturas y soldaduras para el marido. Lleva más de 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas loan group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name of the Sultana of Coffee for the extensive coffee crops which have an incomparable taste, for its cuisine, and for the warmth of the people. 

Elsa lives in this place. She is 41 years old, married, and from this relationship they have three children, ages 24, 22, and 10, two of them are university students and one is in primary school. Her husband has a soldering and car painting shop.

Elsa, with the end of having her own income, works selling products from catalogs such as clothing, shoes, Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells from door to door and to order. She works every day since she loves to go out to sell. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for more than 4 years, which helps her to get ahead. She also will give part of the loan to her husband so that he can use it to purchase materials that he uses in his work.

This loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, paint and soldering for her husband. She has been in the loan group for more than 5 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she began her business. Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, paints and solder.

loans.name: Banco Mujer A Superarse Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer A Superarse es un grupo nuevo conformado por siete señoras de la comunidad rural llamada Shiroles. Se organizan para buscar fines en común, debido a que les es más fácil accesar al crédito de ésta forma grupal que de la forma individual, debido a que carecen de garantia para accesar a dicho crédito. Todas las socias tiene la experiencia en las actividades que desarrollan o que van a iniciar. Emprenden sus tareas sin descuidar a sus familias. La mayoria de socias trabajan sus negocios junto con su compañero o esposo, ya que en esa zona las fuentes de empleo son mínimas, entonces sus negocios es la principal entrada de dinero para sus hogares. Edelmira es la lidereza de éste grupo, es una mujer con 45 años de edad, casada y madre de varios hijos, los cuales actualmente dependen de ella solamente dos menores de edad y cursan la primaria. Su esposo trabaja y el salario que percibe es poco para la manutención de su hogar. Ésta es una oportunidad de financiamiento para ella, asi reforzar su pulpería y obtener mejores ingresos, asi ayudar en su hogar y cubrir algunos gastos personales. Algunos propósitos de ellas es la superación y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Junto con Edelmira van a trabajar seis socias más, las cuales invertirán en actividades comerciales y pecuarias como es la cria de pollos y cerdos para luego venderlos.
texts.en: "Banco Mujer A Superarse" is a new group comprised by seven women from the rural community called Shiroles. They organized to look for common objectives, since it is easier to access a loan as a group instead of individually, because they lack the warranties to access such loan. All members have experience in the activities they carry out or the ones they want to start. They work without neglecting their families. Most of them work their businesses with their life partners or husbands, since employment sources in this area are minimal. Therefore, their businesses are their main income source of their households. Edelmira is the group leader. She is a 45 year old woman, married and mother of many children. Currently, only the two young ones who attend elementary school depend of her. Her husband works, and the salary he earns is little to support their household. This is a financing opportunity for her to strengthen her grocery store and to obtain better income, and help in this way in her household to pay for some personal expenses. Some of these women's objectives are to progress and improve their life conditions and those of their families. Six more members will work with Edelmira. They will invest the loan in commercial and small livestock activities such as raising chickens and pigs for future sale.

loans.use: to buy a basic food basket for the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Busca Del Exito Group

texts.es: Doña Yaide es la presidenta de Banco Mujer En Busca Del Éxito, tiene 47 años, es casada por segunda vez y tiene una hija mayor de edad y cursa la universidad. Doña Yaide es una mujer muy trabajadora, y comerciante con mucha experiencia, vende de forma ambulante por su comunidad y otras aledañas, ropa de mujer, ropa interior, sandalias, cosméticos, perfumes y otros productos de diferentes catálogos. Inició su actividad para generar ingresos, debido a que su hija ingresaba a la universidad y tenia la necesidad de ayudarle a pagar sus estudios. Éste fue su principal motivo para emprender su negocio. Este es el sexto préstamo que solicita para reforzar sus ventas y asi aumentar sus ingresos, porque su mayor deseo es ver a su hija graduarse de enfermería, lo que que piensa es lo único que le puede heredar en la vida el estudio y así en un futuro sea ella quien esté pendiente del bienestar de sus padres, y los cuide en su vejez, debido a que es hija única. Otra meta es ayudar a su esposo en el futuro a reparar su casa, ya que está en mal estado. Junto a Doña Yaide hay 5 socias más que van a invertir en actividades de comercio y avicultura. Se han caracterizado por su excelente moral de pago y en ésta operación se van a financiar solamente a tres socias. Todas buscan bienes en común para el crecimiento y la superación personal y familiar.
texts.en: Yaide is the president of the Banco Mujer En Busca Del Éxito. She is 47 years old, married for the second time, and has a grown daughter in college. Yaide is a very hardworking woman who is a very experienced merchant. She sells door to door in hers and nearby communities. She sells women's clothing, underwear, sandals, cosmetics, perfume and other products from different catalogs. She started her activity to generate income because her daughter was entering college and she needed to help her pay for her education. This was her main motivation to start her business. This is the sixth loan she has asked for to strengthen her sales and thus increase her income, because her biggest wish is to see her daughter graduate from nursing. What she thinks is the only thing she can leave her with in this life is an education and in the future it will be her who cares for her parents' well being in their old age, because she is an only child. Another goal she has is to help her husband in the future to repair their home, because it is in poor condition. With Yaide there are 5 members who are going to invest in commercial and poultry raising activities. They have been described as having excellent payment habits, and this time, only three members are going to be financed. They are all seeking the common good fto get ahead and grow personally and in their families.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, underwear, sandals, make-up, perfume, and other products.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Faby es de una familia trabajadora honesta, sus padres le enseñaron muchos valores, está trabajando como vendedora para así poder pagar sus estudios  de ese modo poder culminar la carrera de administración y ser una profesional exitosa.
Es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y seguir con sus estudios de esa forma.
texts.en:
Faby is from an honest, hardworking family. Her parents taught many values. She is working as a saleswoman to pay for her education so that she can finish has business administration major and be a successful professional.  

She is a very hardworking person and she wants to be someone in life. She is asking for this loan to pay for her college and continue with her education in this way.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago vive en la ciudad de Itá con su señora y sus dos hijos. Tiene una ferretería y su señora es Docente.
Él estudia Derecho y tiene como objetivos terminar su carrera y crecer como profesional, y así ayudar a su familia con los gastos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo está haciendo.
texts.en:
Santiago lives in the city of Itá with his wife and their two children.  He has a hardware store, and his wife is a teacher.

He is studying law, and his objectives are to finish his degree and to become a professional.  This way he will help his family with the expenses.

He is requesting a loan to be able to pay his university fees.  This way he will be able to continue with his studies as he is doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen vive en una zona rural de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, con mucho esfuerzo está estudiando la carrera de Agronomía, es casada y tiene una hija, por quien está luchando.
Su meta es ser una profesional exitosa y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Carmen lives in a rural area of the city of Coronel Oviedo With a lot of hard work, she is studying agronomy. She is married and has a daughter, for whom she is fighting to get ahead. Her goal is to be successful in her profession and offer her family a better quality of life. She is asking for this loan to pay for her college tuition, and in this way continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Emili

texts.es:
Emili es la única mujer de la casa, estudia derecho, le gustaría ser abogada el día de mañana, seguir estudiando y tener un cargo importante, para lograr todos sus objetivos y metas en la vida.
Ella es una persona que se esmera y esfuerza para poder salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Emili is the only woman of the house.  She is studying law.  She would like to be an attorney in the future, to continue studying, and to have an important job in order to achieve all of her objectives and goals.

She is a person who works and puts forth great effort in order to be able to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees.  This way she will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es de la ciudad de Pilar, a  la vez que estudia, también está trabajando para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos de ser una profesional exitosa.
Su meta es culminar sus estudios y después seguir estudiando para poder crecer en conocimiento. 
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder pagar ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Pilar.  She is going to school, and she is also working in order to meet her goal and her wish of being a successful professional.

Her goal is to complete her studies and to later continue studying in order to be able to grow in her knowledge.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover her degree expenses.  This way she will be able to cover this expense that she has.

loans.use: to pay degree expenses.

loans.name: Ngeno

texts.en:
Ngeno is 24 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and 4 children in Bomet, Kenya.  To make a living, Ngeno practices dairy, poultry, crop, and tree farming.  

Ngeno is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming.  With the loan, he intends to turn the current poultry activity that he carries out for subsistence into a commercial activity that generates income for his family.  The borrowed amount will buy traditional breeds of chicken that are productive and adapted to local conditions.  Through this investment, Ngeno will take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market to become a bigger farmer.  Income generated from the poultry farm will help him pay for basic household expenses and for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry and crop farming on his compound to make a living.  

Geoffrey is seeking a loan to buy poultry. His intention is to turn the current subsistence poultry farm into a commercial activity that will generate income to take his children to school. He will use the borrowed money to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are productive, in demand, and well-adapted to local conditions. 

Geoffrey will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise a breeding cow

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Zubeda, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children. She has been running two businesses, selling from a retail shop and a genge (fruits and vegetables) at same place. She has been in the business for three years now. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Zubeda’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will be very happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for your support. She will use the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy drinks, rice, flours, fruits and vegetables for her business. She dreams of buying a car. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mshikamano," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, rice, flours, fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 40 kg of wheat flour, 20 kg of sugar, yeast, rice, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her genge duka stock (fruit & vegetable stand stock).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed for feeding her chickens which are destined for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and retail supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is aged 62 years old and the mother of nine children, living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. Rice and soy bean farming and selling grocery items are the sources of her family’s income for more than ten years. Through these businesses, she is able to earn about 37,000KHR per day and save about 18,000KHR each day for the emergency needs. Rice drought and destruction by insects are the main challenges for her to earn income to support her family. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more kinds of grocery items in order to attract more customers. This is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and her family’s living conditions improved through those previous loans. For this new loan portion, she expects to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of grocery items in order to attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk,etc. Gina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, a 55 years-old-man living with 2 children, earns a living by farming in Serei Sokha village. Beside farming, Phan crafts boat to earn extra money for his family. Spending day and time rising 2 children, he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently crafting and farming are still his everyday activities. 

Phan has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. He needs to recharge the battery every week. Moreover, a car battery is not reliable. Most of the time, a car battery suddenly runs out without alert and when he is crafting, which reducing his working hours and is disrupting his living life style. 

Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, Phan decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home energy system. He believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle for a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar electricity home system

location.town: Serei Sokkha Village, Thma Andeurk Commune,Chetr B

loans.name: Tamta

texts.en:
Tamta is a 22-year-old married woman from Gori district. She lives with her husband and two children. Tamta works at private company as office manager and gets a monthly income. Her husband is unemployed and Tamta wants to purchase an used car for her husband to start taxi business.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 1600 USD. Tamta will purchase a second-hand car and her husband will start providing taxi service. He will transfer people through the town and also in other regions. He will generate income and family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase an used car for her husband to serve locals as a taxi driver and generate income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for children for resale.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is clever woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in a small city with her family. She is a widow and has one child. For more than two years, she has worked at sewing fabric as a tailor. She is a sewer and also gets orders at home. 

She earns enough money to ensure her family. She lives with her parents. In order to live better and have a good standard of living, she tries her best to work hard. 

Her teeth hurt and she can’t wait to treat them at a dental doctor. She asks for a loan to treat her teeth. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her teeth at a dental doctor

loans.name: Teckla

texts.en:
Meet Teckla, a diligent rural dairy farmer from Tagaruto village in Bomet area of Kenya. Teckla owns a 2.5 acre farm in Tagaruto where she farms and lives with her husband and 7 children. Feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Tuition fee is one of her single biggest annual expense. She has been able to rely on farming for the last 30 years as a source of income. 

Teckla is seeking a KES 60,000 loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. She already has 3 dairy cows along with 3 heads of poultry. Tecla also grows different varieties of products. She transports all of her produce on a motorcycle to the local market. 

With your loan investment, the additional cow is estimated to create a 40% increase in the volume of milk production on her farm. Additional income from this investment will enable her to repay the loan and invest more in her business.
Teckla will be able to satisfy the demand of milk in her village if you make a loan to her!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase the size of her herd for more milk production

loans.name: Reylen

texts.en:
Reylen is 50 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Reylen has a soft-drinks retailing business in the Philippines. Reylen requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more case of soft-drinks to resell.

Reylen has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Reylen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft-drinks to resell.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 34-year-old, married woman of Dhupguri with three school-going children (one son and two daughters). Her daughters are in grade 12 and grade 9, while her son is pursuing a graduation level education. Namita is a housewife who is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband runs a small carpentry business. 

Namita is an example of the women who work hard to give their children a better education. The income of her husband is not sufficient, which is a hindrance for their children's education. His inconsistent income makes them unable to go ahead with their education. But Namita wants to educate their children at any cost. 

Her only son, Sudeb, 20 years old, is a student of B.A. in his first year in Sukanta Mahabidyalay. He is a boy with average merit but is attentive and interested in studies. He wants to enroll in a Business Management course after his graduation to get a good job. But he cannot get the necessary educational supplies and private tuition because of his parent's poor financial resources.

Namita heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them. She plans to invest the entire loan to purchase study materials, pay tuition fees and college fees for her son. She hopes it will help her son to get an uninterrupted education and reach his goal.

Namita and Sudeb (in the picture) are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to cover the education costs of her son for his graduation degree.

loans.name: Kukataa Unyonge Group

texts.en:
Luhanga's (far left) last loan was $250 from Wezesha Project in the town of Uvira, Democratic Republic Of Congo. She used this loan to buy clothes to sell, and now that loan has been fully repaid and the profit was helpful for her family and increased her capital. She is from Kukataa Unyonge Group, a group of five mamas from Uvira. 

This time she is applying for a loan of $300 and she will be using her loan to buy more clothes to sell and increase her income further. In the future Luhanga would like to save money to expand her business and buy a home.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Leam

texts.en:
A residing living in Kampong Cham province, Leam is 44 years old and a mother of three dependent children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family condition via pig raising and cassava growing. Moreover, she sells desserts to get extra income for her family. The problem in her business, her cassava grows not well and her pigs were ill. She has been involved in her business for ages and she can save her an income about 19,700KHR per day. 

For Leam, this is her fifth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. With her past loan, it helps her to update her family’s living as well. She will use her entire loan portion to buy more land to update her cassava farm to get more yields. She hopes that her cassava farm can earn her a good income to improve her living condition to become better than before.

loans.use: to buy more land to update her cassava farm to get more yields.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is so grateful that she has continually received support to sustain and grow her general store business. With her positive outlook and faith in God she was able to surpass all the difficulties and challenges she faced as a single parent. 

Her ornamental and general store businesses was a great help in raising all her children who are now all happily married. She trusts that she can again avail of a 50000 Php loan to buy more grocery items like instant noodles, canned good, bread, beverages, toiletries and some school supplies such as pad papers, notebook and photo copy papers. Her earnings are a great help to support her daily personal and household needs and assist some of her children who are lacking in life.

Simeona's simple dream is to build a big grocery store someday. She prays for good health and abundance in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business and some school supplies as well to sell..

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 45 years old. She lives in Kobuleti with her husband, 2 daughters and pensioner mother-in-law. Marine owns a cow, a calf and a plot of agricultural land, where she grows nut trees and mandarin trees. Marine is very hardworking woman, she produces dairy products every day and sells at local shops milk and cheese. 

Marine and her husband decided to start to sell fruits and vegetables.
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a used car. As the car is purchased, her husband will drive it and they will trade fruits and vegetables from village to village to sell and to generate stable income.
Marine hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to begin selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Almost Three quarters of people living in Kenya are young people who are below 40 years of age. Most of them struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This is true for Paulina, 29, who is based in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She has now been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Paulina is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as cream. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy an additional quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Parissin Group

texts.fr: Simon est un cultivateur âgé de 40 ans. Il vit au Mali avec sa femme et ses quatre enfants âgés de  15 à 7 ans. C’est lui qui tient la charrue en bas de la photo. Etant analphabète il s’est lancé dans  l’agriculture depuis qu’il s’est marié il y’ a 17 ans de cela.  Simon rêve avoir plus d’argent pour cultiver beaucoup d’arachides et de sésames pour augmenter sa récolte. Il espère pouvoir survenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et aussi les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de sa zone et vend ses céréales dans les mêmes marchés où peut faire un bénéfice prévisionnel mensuel de 60000F. Simon aime l’agriculture car ça lui permet de gagner sa vie. Les obstacles auxquels il se heurte sont très souvent l’insuffisance de pluie et le manque de kits Agricole.
texts.en:
Simon is a 40 year old farmer. He lives in Mali with his wife and four children aged between 15 and seven years old. He is holding the plough in the photo. As he is illiterate he took up farming after he married 17 years ago. Simon dreams of having more money to grow large quantities of peanuts and sesame to increase his production. He hopes to be able to provide for his family's daily needs and also to pay for his children's school fees. He buys his supplies at the local markets in his region and sells his cereals at the same markets where he can make a projected monthly profit of 60000F.
Simon likes farming because it enables him to earn a living. The main difficulties that he has to cope with frequently are insufficient rains and the lack of farming kits.

loans.use: to buy seeds to farm his land.

loans.name: Carmen Cecibel

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Nueva Vida se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo turístico es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
Aquí vive la señora Cecibel, tiene 29 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años de edad, la cual estudia en una escuela en la localidad. Ellas viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Cecibel es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sacarle adelante a su pequeña, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones y artículos para el hogar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella  también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean algún productom, lleva más de 3 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo y darle una buena educación y crianza a su pequeña.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas, edredones, cortinas, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Nueva Vida loan group meets every fifteen days in the Paján canton, known to be an area strong in cattle ranching in the province. One of the tourists attractions is the rodeo montubio, a traditional rodeo organized at times during the year.

This is where Cecibel lives. She is 29 and the single mother of a six-year-old girl, they both live with Cecibel's parents and the child attends school in the community.

Cecibel works selling all kinds of clothing, bed sheets, quilts and household goods. She sells door-to-door, going out nearly every day to make her sales and collect her money. She extends credit and receives payments weekly. She also sells from home when her clients arrive asking for a product. 

She's been doing this work for over three years now and she enjoys it, it brings her some income of her own, and it allows her to support her child and give her a good education. This loan is to buy clothing,  bed sheets, quilts and curtains among other items that she sells.
