Cecibel has been a member of the loan group for over six years, and she likes it because of the help provided by the loans. Her dream is to give her young daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bed sheets, quilts, curtains and more.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. She enjoys farming because it generates income that she combines with her husband's to push her family forward. 

Elizabeth's biggest challenge is transportation. The road network in Kitale is terrible and as a result, farmers who want to participate in formal markets incur high costs to transporting their produce to the market. 

Elizabeth is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Elizabeth will be able to have convenient access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better.  
Increase in income from this intervention will help Elizabeth to grow her business and generate more income to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport her farming products to market

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is aged 42 years, married to Geoffrey and she supports three children.She has been a shop keeper for the last 12 years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase products such as sugar, cooking oil and cooking fat for sale to customers and meet both family and  client needs.  

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to enable her to supply milk daily to clients and also farm inputs.Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, cooking oil and cooking fat for sale to and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong is 50 years old, married and has two children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard but she has a lack of capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan from her husband and working as hired labour.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Xoliswa

texts.en:
Xoliswa is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:

1.What do you study at Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy most?
I study Bachelor of Arts in management. I enjoy statistics and business communication classes.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After graduation I hope to work in the finance department. My goals are to open my own business in consulting and catering field. I would love to work in the Johannesburg for now, but for future I would love to travel and venture to other cities.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married? Do you have children?
I’m the last daughter born from my mother side; I was born and raised in Soweto. My mom delivered me at home where we live now. I had one brother who passed in 2000, and three older sisters whom I love very much. I do not know who my father is and never asked where he was.  My mother is a self-employed pensioner who sells vegetables to support us. I’m not married and I do not have children.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I love singing, reciting poetry with my friends, reading and playing sports at school.

5.	How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
The Kiva loan will change my life for the good. It will help me be able to come to school daily. I will decrease the burden on my mother’s shoulders of helping my sister and I. I will be able to buy food and clothes to come to school with the money I get. There will be an improvement in how life is right now.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Samai's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Samai is a 36-year-old mother of two small children. She struggles for a living via growing cassava, growing sesame and rice farming as the main source of income while her husband is a paid worker to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in these businesses for eleven years. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for new Kiva loan, which is the fourth cycle of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loans have helped her to have a better house to live in. For this new loan, she will use to buy cassava seeds and pay for plowing fees in order to increase the productivity of her crop. She hopes that this loan will help to get good outputs from her healthy crop so that she can earn more income as well.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and pay for plowing fees in order to increase the productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 200 liters of kerosene

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne was born in a village called Jerusalem in Limpopo in South Africa. She has five younger siblings and a niece that stay in Limpopo with her mom, who is unemployed. Her dad started working not long ago as a driver in Centurion, Pretoria. Yvonne is unmarried and has no children. The money that the family gets from her father’s salary is not enough for all the children because they are all in school and they need food and clothes.

Yvonne is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. She is currently studying towards a BBA degree. She enjoys classes such as Marketing, Managerial Accounting, Management and Sustainability, Business Statistics, Entrepreneurship, Project Management and Finance. Yvonne wants to work at JP Morgan in Sandton, Johannesburg. She wants to work in the investment sector because she enjoys working with numbers and traveling. In her spare time, she looks for weekend jobs like cleaning other people's homes, doing their laundry and looking after their children.

This loan will help Yvonne pay her school fees because the money that her dad gets from his salary is not enough to pay for her tuition. The loan will also help with her transport expense to and from school so she will not be absent at school.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 50 years old and married. He lives with his wife and four children in Kenya. Edwin has been able to make quite a name for himself as a serious poultry farmer with over 60 high-breed hens on his 0.7 acre farm. Besides poultry farming, Edwin also does dairy farming for the love of it and for food and income. Edwin is seeking a loan to buy poultry. With this loan, he intends to buy more traditional breeds of chicken that are very productive and well-adapted to local conditions. He will use the money generated form sales of poultry products to repay his loan and grow his business. Also, he plans to spend it on his family's basic needs and children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan is 28 years old, married and has a baby and she works hard to support her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, but lacks capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from selling chickens, ducks, pork and vegetables.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Marina Del Transito

texts.es: Marina de 26 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 8 años de edad. Marina es una mujer trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su trabajo en el cual se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, hamacas, flotadores, etc. desde hace diez años en una playa cercana a su vivienda por lo que se siente feliz de contar con una fuente de ingresos tan sólido. Ella desea mejorar la infraestructura de su propiedad y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en los materiales para hacer un afinado a un muro de la casa. Marina espera contar con este apoyo ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en  la  reparación del techo de su vivienda por lo que se siente feliz y agradecida, y espera poder contar nuevamente con este apoyo ya que con el monto ella comprara: cemento y arena además pagara la mano de obra para poder de esta forma reparar el muro de su vivienda el cual se encuentra bastante deteriorado.
texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking 26-year-old woman who lives in her own house along with her life partner and 8-year-old daughter. Marina is a hardworking woman who always makes an effort to get her family ahead. She has been working for ten years renting out rooms, hammocks, inner tubes, etc. at a beach near her home. She is happy that she can rely on such a steady source of income.

Marina wishes to improve her property's infrastructure, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in materials to fix up a wall of her house. She used the previous loan to repair the roof of her house, for which she is happy and grateful. She hopes to be able to depend on new support, and with this sum she will buy cement and sand, and will also pay labor costs. With this she will repair the wall of her house, which is currently very dilapidated.

loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to fix up a wall of her house

loans.name: Fazli

texts.en:
Fazli is a skillful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1959 and is living in small town with her family. She is a widow and has three children. She is a challenged and hardworking person, as she raised her children alone and ensured them with necessary things. 

Her life was hard and she got sick. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to have herself treated at a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to have herself treated at a medical clinic

loans.name: Xhevrije

texts.en:
Xhevrije is back wanting your valuable help again, but this time for something else. She is in the photograph with her own son, Alfred who had an accident about a year ago that resulted in loosing his hand and also his 6-month-old child who was born with two genitals for whom a surgery has been scheduled soon. 

Kindly note that they are very poor and they are ethnic Egyptian Albanians. To make a living they have been doing agriculture/livestock. In the previous loan she was photographed with two granddaughters born with disabilities. Sadly, many members of the vulnerable ethnics in Albania lack nutrition and other basic needs, and this reflects on their health.

loans.use: to pay for the surgery of her grandchild who was born with two genitals

loans.name: Julio Javier

texts.es:
Julio Javier es un joven estudiante de Informatica, él solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Julio Javier, tengo 22 años de edad, resido en Santo Domingo Este. Soy ingresado en la universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo UASD, actualmente cursando el 5 semestre de la carrera de informática en dicha casa de estudio. A pesar de estar en activo, el tiempo perdido ha sido una trabaja para la conclusión de mis estudios, al grado de perder más de 3 semestres por falta de proyección de materias. 
Solicito su ayuda para poder cambiarme de esta universidad, ya que mis limitaciones económicas no me permiten costear una universidad privada, que me permita recuperar algo del tiempo que he perdido.  Me gustaría continuar en esta carrera, la cual considero primordial para mi vida y para el futuro de mi familia. Este préstamo daría un giro de 180 grados a mi situación, tanto en el ámbito monetario con en el educacional. 
Necesito cambiarme a uno universidad que me prepare para el creciente mercado laboral y que me enseñe con las herramientas adecuadas al maravilloso mundo de la informática, por eso si obtengo este préstamo ingresaré a la Universidad Apec que es un buen centro de estudio para mí el desarrollo de mi carrera. 
Le solicito su ayuda de manera ferviente y sin dudas de que esta será una oportunidad dorada para mí. Espero poder convencerles de financiar mi proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Julio Javier is a young man studying computer science.  He is requesting a loan in order to be able to cover his educational expenses.  Here is his story.

My name is Julio Javier, and I am 22 years old.  I live in Santo Domingo.  I am enrolled in the Autónoma de Santo Domingo UASD University.  I am currently in the fifth semester of my studies for a degree in computer science.  

In spite of working, I lost time that has made it a chore to complete my studies.  I missed over three semesters for the lack of resources.

I am requesting your help to be able to change universities.  My financial limitations do not allow me to pay for a private university.  This will allow me to recover some of the time I have lost.

I would like to continue in my career studies.  I consider it to be vital to my life and the future of my family.  This loan will make a 180 degree turn in my situation, both monetarily as educationally.

I need to change to a university that will prepare me for the growing work market and that will use adequate tools to teach me about the marvelous work of computer science.  

Therefore, if I get this loan I will enroll in the Universidad Apec, which is a good educational center for me to undertake my studies.

I am fervently requesting your help.  Without a doubt, this will be a golden opportunity for me.  I hope to be able to convince you to finance my life project.

loans.use: to cover educational expenses.

loans.name: Sach

texts.en:
Mrs. Sach, 45 years old and is a hardworking woman. She is married and has one child. Husbandry is main income source of her family. Additional, she is also a hired labourer and earn about 120000VND/ day.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Kyon Paing Group 2 A

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Pyon (pictured third from the right) is 51 years old, married, and supports a family of seven (five children). He works on his five acres of crop farm. His wife manages the house chores and sometimes helps him in the farm. Pyon and his wife are glad that most of their children are working on their own and helping them in the farm. Pyon has 30 years of experience in farming.  

He hopes to make improvements in his farming, and hopes the weather will be more stable than it has in the past few years. This loan from Proxmity will help the family to invest in their crop farm, and to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyon Paing Village Group 2 A named Pyon, Tin H, Tin S, Myo, Moe, Cho and Myint. The fund will help the group purchase fertilizers and crop seeds that will help them boost their income. 

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village, and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds that will help them boost their income.

loans.name: Sironko High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Yunusu. He is the Bursar of Sironko High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Sironko with 800 students. Sironko School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sironko School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Yunusu ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kyon Paing Group 2 B

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Win (pictured left) is 39-years-old, married, and supports a family of four (two children). He farms on his five acres of crop farm while his wife works at their grocery store. Since farming covers most of their family's living cost, he is proud of his business. He plans to expand his crop farm by a few acres with the help of Proximity's loan. Even though schools are very far from the village, Win's son is at the University and the youngest daughter is at secondary. Win values his children's education, and is therefore is willing to spend much of his income on their education. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyon Paing Village Group 2 B, Win and Mya. The fund will help the group purchase fertilizers and crop seeds that will help them boost their income. 

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village, and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds that will help them boost their income.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mariya is an entrepreneur from Nikopol. She is 65, married with two grown kids. Mariya owns a vending kiosk selling women’s clothing in the central city marketplace. Mariya doesn’t have any hired employees, she works by herself. Mariya used to work at a factory. However, then the factory got closed, people were downsized or resigned themselves and Mariya ended up with no means for living. This is how she decided to get self-employed and launch her own start up. 

She started selling jeans clothing imported from Poland. Within a few years she realized there were very few market vendors offering quality women’s clothing merchandise which is why she decided to fill the niche and it was quite successful. 

This time Mariya is requesting 18 000 Grivnyas to purchase women’s clothing inventory for further sale in her kiosk. At her age most women in Ukraine prefer to stop working and just stay home working in their gardens or watching TV. However, Mariya is very active and energetic, she believes she should work and help her family while she still can do it. She is planning to reinvest generated income in her business and meet some of the current needs of her family as well.

loans.use: to purchase women’s clothing inventory for further sale in her kiosk

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is in the photograph with her husband, Artur and their youngest son; they are parents of two children, 15 and 12 years old and they are ethnic Egyptian Albanians. For long time they have been in the activity of buying/selling used clothes and other items such as kids toys, mainly the stock coming from Greece and Macedonia. 

The clothes are donated in the churches in those countries and from churches are donated to the people who sell them, who only pay for the taxes on customs.  They have set up two booths, one for clothes and one for toys, at the Roma market in their city.
 
The loan that they are requesting from you will be used to pay taxes and other charges including the rental booths on those inventory items they want to sell.

loans.use: to pay for taxes on inventory of used clothes and kids' toys which they sell

loans.name: Omar Elizardo

texts.es:
Omar, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado desde hace 7 años, su esposa se dedica a ayudarle a hacer pan, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos inicio a estudiar parvularia.

Omar, se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace 6 años, aprendió cuando trabajó en una panadería hace tres años; luego decidió poner su propia panadería en su casa y actualmente solo a eso se dedica; Omar, se levanta todos los días a las tres de la mañana para preparar todo para hacer el pan, luego durante la mañana sus hermanos salen a vender el pan por todo el cantón.

Omar, necesita el crédito para comprar tres bolsas de harina para hacer el pan y para comprar un repuesto de la motocicleta en donde sale a repartir el pan, porque está fallando y como no tienen ese repuesto no han salido a vender y las ventas han bajado. 

Los sueños de Omar, es ampliar su panadería y poco a poco ir empleando a más personas para cubrir toda la zona del municipio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Omar is 24 yeas old. He studied up to 4th grade. He has been married for 7 years and his wife helps him make bread. He has five children of which one has begun kinder garden.

Omar has earned a living making bread for 6 years. He learned how to do this when he worked in a bakery three years ago. Then he decided to start his own bakery in his home and currently he only earns a living doing this. Omar gets up every day at three in the morning to prepare everything for making the bread, then, in the morning his brothers go out to sell the bread throughout the area.

Omar needs a loan to buy three bags of flour to make the bread and to buy a spare part for his motorcycle which he uses to go out selling the bread. It is breaking down and as he doesn't have this spare part, they haven't gone out selling and his sales have gone down.

The dreams of Omar include expanding his bakery and, little by little, employing more people in order to cover the whole area of the municipality and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy three bags of flour to make bread and to buy a spare part for his motorcycle which he uses to go out selling the bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feeds to get more milk to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Miss. Phuong is a single woman, 27-years-old. There are six people in her family. She has also daily income from gardening such as chicken, duck and vegetables. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is able to repay the loan monthly with support from her parents.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh is 30 years old, married and has two children. She lives in a rural area.  Raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 8 years. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standards, especially for her children.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Mrs.Nhan is 52 years old, married and has two children. Her business is running a restaurant.  She is earning a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant, so she is very happy with her business. 

Now she is applying for a loan to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more materials such as rice, cooking oils, chicken, beef, salt, fish and other things to be used. She hopes with this loan, her business will be improving in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials such as rice, cooking oils, chicken, beef, salt, fish and other things to open a bigger restaurant in the future

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 26-year-old single man from Nablus city, an ancient city located in the West Bank . He has operates a small restaurant, where he sells light sandwiches and sweets for day laborers and children after school. The community enjoys his sweets and It is a very good business, which provides the family with a good income.

Because he wanted to buy some supplies for his restaurant, Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, can buy a machine for making sweets  and other supplies to improve for his restaurant. Ibrahim wants to improve his business by making fresh fruit cocktails and so he needs to store perishable items in the refrigerator. Ibrahim appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy a machine for making sweets and other supplies to improve for his restaurant

loans.name: Vicenta Del Carmen

texts.es: Vicenta de 49 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 14 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre se ha esforzado por ayudarle a su esposo por llevar lo necesario a su hogar. Vicenta presta sus servicios domésticos trabajando  todos los días en una residencial cercana, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, además su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Vicenta está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: una puerta, ventanas, balcones, y mano de obra para su vivienda y un cuarto que están reparando y ver más bonita su casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en: Vicenta is 49 years old and lives with her husband and her 14 year old daughter. She is a determined mother who has always pushed herself to help her husband to meet their household needs. Vicenta offers her services doing domestic work every day in a nearby residential complex which allows her to get her family ahead in life. Her husband also helps with the household costs. Vicenta is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy a door, windows, balconies and labour for her home and a room that they are repairing and to see her home looking nicer and to give her daughter better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a door, windows, balconies and labour to repair her home.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Mrs.Luyen is a 53-year-old mother with three children and is a hardworking woman . She has been able to support her family thanks to the fact that she works in various occupations. 

She is requesting a loan to restart her own business, a small chicken farm; she will raise the chickens, feed them and subsequently sell them. She essentially took the initiative because of her family, as she wants to enjoy a better life with them; she wants her children to study and have a reason to smile everyday.

loans.use: To restart her own business, a small chicken farm; she will raise the chickens, feed them and subsequently sell them

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She runs a business selling groceries and goods to her villagers. As the source of income for her family, she sells everyday necessities like oil, sugar, wheat flour, salt, biscuits, etc.

She is keen on growing her business with the infusion of a little loan capital. This will help her to purchase additional quantities of items she already stocks. The loan amount will be helpful because she has little savings to reinvest in her business at present, and she cannot purchase items on credit from the wholesalers.  The loan will help her business to grow and fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy stock of grocery items for the store in order to meet all the demand from her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase handbags for sale on her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old, married, and supports a family of five children. She has been practicing farming for the last two years earning KES 18,000 per month. 

Esther has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to sell in her area for more income gain.   She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a small holder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is an agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He owns a small inherited piece of land. On the land, he has kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for seven years. His main income sources are milk and crops. He recently ventured into a small side business to supplement the meager income he earns from mixed farming. 

From Kiva lenders, Edwin is seeking a loan worth 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy seeds and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. It is to support horticulture farmers that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to help Edwin access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With the loan, Edwin’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

Edwin, like many entrepreneurs, hopes with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the lenders of KIVA he will achieve his dreams.

loans.use: buy seeds

loans.name: Belita

texts.en:
Belita is 31 years old, married to Zablon, and supports two children.  She has been a shopkeeper for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 8,000 per month. 

Belita has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stock of sugar, soap, and washing detergent for sale to clients and meet both family and client needs. 

Belita plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients, and to educate her children. Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector, eradicate poverty in her family, and improve sanitation.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 21 years old, married, and supports a family of 3 children.   She has been practicing farming for the last 2 years, earning KES 4,500 per month. 

Jackline has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy buy chickens for eggs production.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land for tree farming for more income gain.   Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 65 years old, married, and supports a family of 5 children. He is a farmer and has been growing crops to sell for 14 years now. The income generated has enabled him to provide for his family's needs.

Jason will be using this loan to buy a dairy cow and dairy feeds so as to get more milk to sell and make more income to educate his children. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan, educate his children, and buy farm inputs.   His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business, make more income, and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Priskillah

texts.en:
Priskillah is 36 years old, married, and supports a family of six children. She has been practicing farming for the last four years, earning KES 11,000 per month. 

Priskillah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is his story:

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
Maharishi Institute, I am persuading a BBA degree through distance learning system, with Maharishi University of Management situated in US. The classes that I enjoy most of the time are principle of economics, marketing, elementary Algebra and higher states of consciousness.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After graduation I hope to work in Marketing or Finance department in any company. I have desire to own my own company and try to make changes on the life of poor communities. Travelling will be an advance ,especially on my processes of learning new things ,working in the city of Sydney, will be my dream come true, because more and most business are attracted to Sydney these days.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born on the 15th October 1990, in the city of Bujumbura Burundi’s capital city, located in the eastern African countries currently staying in the city of Johannesburg, trying to persuade a BBA degree with Maharishi Invincibility Institute, through distance learning system with Maharishi University of Management. I am the last born from a family of 6 children. I lost my father in the civil war, whereby the rest of the family ran the country and find ourselves in South Africa, apparently in the city of Cape Town. As a young one in the family I believed that education is the key to development and success of my community and country as a whole. I finished secondary school in 2011 right here in South Africa, being a foreigner student, graduate with Renesys Business School in 2015 for a higher certificate in business management and currently busy with BBA degree with MI.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time, most of things that I usually do are reading, do some researches in different topics such as business opportunities, watching news and attend the gym sessions.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
With this loan, this will help me in case of my tuition fees, basic needs such as transport fees, and many more. The significant changes are that I won’t probably be late at school, and I won’t have any excuses of not attending class programs. I will benefit more as my academics performance will be up to the standard and excellence.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Masaba School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Iisat. He is the Head Teacher of  Masaba Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Sironko with 1400 students.  Masaba School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750-litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Masaba School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Iisat ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: buy a water filtration system

loans.name: Jijukamubyeyi Group

texts.en:
Cecile is group leader, and she is 48 years old. She is married with nine children between the ages of 7 and 28 years. 

The group is called Jijukamubyeyi, which means “mothers fight against illiteracy” in English. The group members sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. 

Cecile has a shop and has been running the business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen is 45 years old, is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, she and her husband have been working hard to manage their brick laying business, which makes bricks. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of  20,640,00 VNĐ from QB WDF. The loan will be used to buy materials for more bricks, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy materials for more bricks and will help her to generate greater profits and improve business

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen, age 31, has three children under her care. She lives in a rural area where she raises and sells small animals like chickens, hens, ducks, among others. Her business is located at her house. She has years of experience in the business, and she has very good personal and work references in the area. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals like hens, ducks and chickens, among others. She will also buy balanced feed for them. By doing so she  hopes to offer her customers a better product. This will allow her to generate greater income that will improve her quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy more animals like hens, ducks and chickens, among others to expand her business activities

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 40 years old, married and has two children. She has been practicing farming and animal husbandry for the last 15 years, earning 3,000,000 VNĐ per month. She wants to apply for a loan to buy certified seeds, more animals like ducks and chickens, and farm input to enable high production and supply for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand to a retail business in the area. Her future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: buy farm inputs & poultry

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.en:
Umidjon was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is living in a small town rich with ancient history, with his parents. He is third year student at university studying dentistry. His parents are workers and their standard of living is normal. 

He wishes to graduate his studies with excellence. He appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs in dentistry

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 47 years old, married and supports a family of 4 children. She has been practicing farming for the last 3 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Faith has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to improve her farming.   Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Zulma Beatriz

texts.es: Zulma de 21 años de edad vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 3 meses de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos desde hace ya hace un buen tiempo y adicional a eso también recibe el apoyo de su compañero de vida que junto con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Zulma está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra  de pollos, cerdos, vitaminas y concentrados para los pollos y cerdos para poder seguir con la crianza de ellos y  para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zulma is 21 years old and lives with her husband and her small 3-month-old daughter. She has been raising chickens and pigs for quite a while now and, in addition, she also is helped by her life's companion who, together with the earnings he obtains from his work, assists with some of the household expenses.

Zulma is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase chickens, pigs, vitamins and feed for her chickens and pigs in order to continue raising them and obtain better earnings and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, vitamins and feed for her chickens and pigs, in order to continue breeding and raising them and obtain better earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, beams and screws to change the roof and bring more comfort to his mother.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai is 41 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She has been practicing agro-forestry for the last eight years. 

She wants to apply for her loan to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hope is to improve family living standards. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
This is Naomi, who is currently unemployed, but a student at the university. She lives with her parents who are self employed with erratic jobs. 

Naomi is studying Business Administration, majoring in Management. She dreams of being a future leader for this nation by being an entrepreneur one day. She has been having challenges raising her tuition fees. With a KIVA Loan Naomi will be able to finish school, and assist her parents in raising her siblings.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old, married and supports a family of 5 children.  He has been practicing farming for the last 5 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

James has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and to expand his business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David and his family live in a rural home in the North Rift Valley area of Kenya. He, his wife and four children all enjoy dairy farming, for it is their livelihood and source of income. David started farming a decade ago, and now he has one acre of farmland with three cows, four heads of poultry and maize crops. 

Through hard work and sacrifice, he has been able to grow his farm business over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business by buying an additional dairy cow. From this asset investment, David expects to get calves and more milk. 

Your loan investment will help David to grow his business and the income his family earns.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 21 years old. He lives in Gori with his sister and mother. Gocha works as a distributor and earns a monthly income. His mother works as a saleswoman locally. 

Gocha decided to open his own shop where he will sell fruits and vegetables. His mother will share her experience with Gocha, as she has been working in this field for years. Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyen, 34 years old, is a very hard-working farmer and also an entrepreneur. She is married and has two children. 

In addition to farming, she works raising fish. She asks for this loan to improve the ponds where she has the fish and to purchase feed for them. Her greatest dream is to expand the tilapia production, sell it in larger numbers, and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To improve the ponds where she keeps fish and to purchase feed for them

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio de 23 años de edad, vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y de 10 meses de edad. El es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo en el cual se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés el cual distribuye por medio de una motocicleta en los alrededores de su comunidad, además posee una tienda de productos básicos en su casa de habitación la cual es atendida por su esposa y así juntos han podido mantener la economía del hogar. Mauricio con el deseo de fortalecer su negocio y superarse cada vez mas económicamente quiere realizar una inversión en su negocio pero debido a que no cuenta con el capital necesario solicita u crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en  la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos con motivo de aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. Por lo anterior con el monto el comprara mayor de cantidad de: pan dulce y francés, además también granos básicos, sopas, golosinas, huevos, etc., y así poder cumplir con la demanda de sus productos solicitada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 23 years old. He lives with his family which is made up of his life companion and his two children, one is 5 years and the other 10 months old. He is a man dedicated to his work where he sells pastries and french bread which he distributes on a motorcycle around his community. He also has a store with basic products in his house which his wife takes care of, thus together they can maintain the household finances.

Mauricio with the desire to consolidate his business and to better his finances wants to make an investment in his business. But he does not have the needed capital so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of products with the goal of increasing his sales and in this way make more profit. For those reasons he will buy pastries and french bread and also basic grains, soups, sweets, eggs, etc. with the money. In this way he can cover the demand for his products requested by his clients.

loans.use: to buy pastries and french bread and also basic grains, soups, sweets, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Claveles De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Claveles, representado por doña Rosa casada, con dos niños a su cargo quienes aun estudian, doña Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de Piñatas y venta de artículos para fiestas infantiles, en su negocio familiar y ha venido de generación en generación, su sueño y meta es apoyar a sus hijos a cumplir sus metas,ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas, espera que la puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en: The Dúo Los Claveles group is represented by Rosa who is married with two children who still study. She earns a living making piñatas and selling items for childrens' parties in her family business which has gone from generation to generation. Her dream and aim is to support her children in fulfilling their aims. She is asking for this loan to buy the materials for making piñatas. She hopes that she can be helped with the loan she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a hardworking smallholder farmer from the Githu location in the Nkubu region of Kenya. He is married with 3 children. Being a father has brought joy to Patrick's life and a sense of great responsibility ahead.

 Patrick is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to construct a zero-grazing unit on his farm. Zero-grazing leads to increased production of milk because the animal does less walking and the feed requirement for healthy living and milk production is factored in the feed ration. Income from this investment will supplement the income he is already making from poultry, trees and different varieties of food crop. His family will benefit a great deal from this loan. His mission in life is to provide for and protect his family in the best way he can.

Patrick has great hopes for his business and believes that his future could improve considerably thanks to the support of organizations such as Kiva that make it possible for people to dream of having better and more stable lives.

loans.use: to construct a  zero-grazing unit on his farm

loans.name: Royale School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Stephen. He is the Head teacher of Royale Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mbale with 207 students. Royale School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Royale School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Stephen ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Dúo Amanecer de Santo Tomas: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Francisca de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y como actividad secundaria también hace y vende refacciones, se ha dedicado a estas actividades desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosméticos e insumos para la elaboración de refacciones, espera que la puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en: The Dúo Amanecer de Santo Tomas group includes Maria Francisca who is 34 years old and earns a living selling cosmetics and as a second activity she also makes and sells snacks. She has earned a living with these activities for several years. On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and supplies to make snacks. She hopes that she can be helped with the loan she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and supplies to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Matilde Elizabeth

texts.es: Matilde tiene 47 años es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive Culiacán Sinaloa, tiene la carrera trunca de informática, ella tiene un negocio de compra, venta y distribución de dulces a cadenas comerciales, ella ya lleva dos años con este negocio. Solicita un préstamo por MXN 30000, con ello quiere comprar un mayor volumen de dulces para hacer crecer su negocio aún más, ella además trabaja en una empresa que vende software a empresas. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia, ir al cine y disfrutar de sus cuatro hijos, su sueño más grande es ver a sus hijos felices y disfrutando de la vida, se siente muy orgullosa de ser una persona tenaz y perseverante que ha cumplido lo que se ha propuesto a pesar de los grandes obstáculos que ha tenido.
texts.en:
Matilde is 47 years old, married, has four children, and lives in Culiacan, Sinaloa. Her career  in information science was cut short. Now, she has a business buying, selling, and distributing sweets to commercial chains. Matilde has had this business for two years.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Mexican pesos to purchase a larger volume of sweets in order to expand her business even more. Matilde also works for a business that sells software to enterprises.

In her free time, she likes to be with her family, attend movies, and enjoy her four children.

Matilde's greatest dream is to see her children happy and enjoying life. She is very proud to be a tenacious and persevering person who has achieved what she intended, despite the great obstacles she has confronted.

loans.use: to make her business grow by purchasing a larger volume of sweets.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William and his wife have worked on their current farm, situated in the outskirts of Bomet town, Kenya, since 2002. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. 

Today, they are making money from the poultry and dairy animals they raise, and also the maize and vegetables they grow. William has further invested in a side business. 

William loves to dairy farm, it was always his goal to be a farmer. His wife understands this, and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm's success to date happen. 

William is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya, however, very few are good producers of milk. The tastes and preferences for milk in the market are really growing in diversity in Kenya. Drinking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass. We now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. Today, milk consumers have many choices. In the market we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice, and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like William to pick up on these shifts in the market, and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product quality adapts to the changes in consumer preference. 

His desire to purchase a pedigree cow shows that William is keen on controlling the quality level in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average, and his milk quality is second to none in the market. 

William anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This is acceptable to him because in order to get his cows to milk well and remain healthy, they must be fed properly. 

Your loan will make a significant difference to William's farm profitability. He and his wife will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, and to pay for their children’s education. The rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. They hope their kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 29 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. He is a farmer, and has been growing cash crops to sell. The income has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family. 

Duncan has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and dairy feed, in order to get more milk to sell. This will enable him to make more income and support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children, and to improve the living standards of his family. 

Duncan's future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business by adding more dairy cows and growing more cash crops. He hopes to make more income, and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feed, in order to get more milk to sell. This will enable him to make more income, and be able to support his family.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew and his family live in a rural home in Cherengany village in Kenya.

He, his wife and five children enjoy dairy farming, for it is their livelihood and source of income. Andrew started farming 10 years ago, and now he has one cow, two poultry and several goats. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home. Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years.

Andrew is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used to buy an additional dairy cow, from which he expects calves and additional liters of milk per day.

Your loan investment will help Andrew grow his business, and income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmen Anneli

texts.es: Carmen de 32 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, a la que apoya en sus estudios y siempre trata de dar lo mejor. Ella es una mujer muy amable y cariñosa que se gana la vida en un centro de bienestar infantil, en el cual presta sus servicios de educadora. Carmen anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual le permitió realizar la conexión del servicio de agua potable dado que no contaba con el vital líquido. Ahora ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para construir un servicio sanitario ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno y de esta manera evitar que su hija se enferme, para ello invertirá en: lámina, madera, ladrillos, cemento, hierro y un inodoro espera la aprobación del crédito para comenzar con la construcción de inmediato.
texts.en: Carmen is 32 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her daughter who is 7 years old who she supports in her studies and she always tries to give her the best. She is a kind and caring woman who earns a living in a centre for child wellbeing where she gives her services as a teacher. Carmen previously asked for a loan which allowed her to connect drinking water to her house and she did not have this vital liquid. Now she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to build a toilet facility as she currently does not have one. She is doing this so as to avoid her daughter getting ill. For this she will buy metal sheeting, wood, bricks, cement, iron and a toilet. She hopes to get this loan so as to start the construction immediately.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, bricks, cement, iron and a toilet to build a toilet facility in her home.

loans.name: Jediel

texts.en:
Jediel and his family live in a rural home in Igoki village found in central Kenya. He, his wife and child enjoy dairy farming, for it is their livelihood and source of income.

Jediel started farming in general 10 years ago, and now he has one cow, ten poultry, two goats and a small farm of maize/corn. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his home. Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his agri-business over the years.

Jediel is seeking a loan to further grow his business by purchasing a heifer. From this new asset, he expects to have calves and produce more milk in the future. Income generated from this investment will be used to make loan repayments, fuel business growth and elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Dúo Rosario De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosario de San Mateo: este dúo está conformado por la señora Maria Priscila, de 52 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de desinfectantes desde hace 9 años, se dedico a esta actividad ya que es la forma de poder ayudar a su familia económicamente, en está oportunidad ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería (desinfectantes) para vender, el sueño de ella es agrandar un poco mas su negocio esto para generar mas ganancias y estar mejor económicamente con su familia.
texts.en: This communal bank, named "Duo Rosario de San Mateo," includes Maria Priscila, 52.  She's had a business selling disinfectants for 9 years.  She works in this business so that she can help her family financially.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise (disinfectants) to sell.  Maria's dream is to expand her business a bit more so that she can generate more earnings and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 22 years old and married and she supports a family of two children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last two years, earning KES 14,000 per month. 

Christine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply her area for more income gain.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and married. She supports a family of five children. She has been practicing farming for the last five years, earning KES 18,000 per month.

Martha has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Bardhyl

texts.en:
Bardhyl wants to buy a milk cow and your loan will help him achieve this goal.

Bardhyl is a rural married father of two whose focus has been on agricultural/livestock for the past 25 years and this has been the only source of income for the family of five.  Overall, he plants peppers, onions, tomatoes, wheat, red beets and fodder and lucerne for the animals. 

Bardhyl owns about 10 dynym agricultural lands and also rents from others 7 more dynym.  Both, Bardhyl and his wife and their three children, who are now in the early 20s, practice rural activity.

 "What we do is very difficult and a total exhaustion and hard for all of us. But that's the only choice we have,we know nothing better," said Bardhyl when he was interviewed by the assistant in our branch.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to expand his farming activity

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge sin hijos a su cargo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rosaura se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Rosaura espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 66, lives with her husband and has no children in her care.  They live in their own home, made of rudimentary materials, in the Pomahuaca district.  This is located in Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  Life in this area is tranquil; the residents work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.

Rosaura is a farmer who cultivates rice.  She has 30 years of experience in this line of work, and has good personal and work references from the area.  She will use this loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to maintain her rice crops, and she will also pay for labor at harvest time.  With this investment, Rosaura hopes to have better quality rice to offer to her customers.  This will have a positive impact on her income, allowing her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Selim

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Selim. She is 35 years old. She comes from Kericho, which is a town in the Rift valley region of Kenya.

Selim is a smallholder farmer who keeps dairy cattle and poultry. She is also an entrepreneur engaged in other small personal businesses. For the five years that Selim has been doing farming, she finds milking to be the most enjoyable activity. However, she doesn't enjoy cleaning the dairy unit as much. There is no doubting her deep connection to farm animals, as she names and occasionally talks to her animals.

Selim is seeking a loan to purchase farm supplies like seeds, which she would use in planting crops so as to increase her farm output. Seeds are very crucial to all farmers regardless of the nature of the agribusiness they are involved in.

With your loan, Selim will acquire good quality seeds that will produce more and are of good grade. These benefits will translate to efficiency, improved quality and profits. Additional income as a result will help Selim to foot the high farming costs that keep rising by the day.

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?," Selim replied, "More income will help me buy more assets and be able to pay school fees for my school-going children.”

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lacio, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por satisfacer los requerimientos de sus hijos, la llevó a solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza de res, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros, “mi pareja cocina y yo administro en negocio, comenzamos con unas pocas mesas y la demanda nos exige ampliar el comedor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la demanda crece, la desventaja es la falta de mobiliario como mesas y sillas para atender a todos los clientes. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a todos sus clientes y abrir un restaurante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su comedor y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Adela is a 32 year old woman who lives with her partner and has three children aged 5, 10 and 12 years old. Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, consistent, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business takes place in the ‘Plan 3000’ neighborhood known for the origin of it's inhabitants, Ayorea tribes, native to the area and miners relocated from the West who settled in the area and started manufacturing and commerce. It has a hot sub-tropical climate that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees.

Adela is dark skinned, has brown eyes, long straight black hair and she is short and thin. Her mother language is Guaraní which she speaks in her home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business and her children who study in school. They live in a house that belongs to the family built of bricks and cement with a metal roof and cement floor. It has running water, electricity and sewage.

The necessity to satisfy the needs of her children led her to request a loan. Her business is selling traditional meals such as peanut soup, stuffed peppers (peppers, ground meat, onions). rice with cheese (rice, milk, cheese), "ají de panza" (beef stomach, onion, tomatoes on rice) and others. "My partner cooks and I mange the business. We started with a few tables and demand forced us to expand the cafe", she commented. The advantage of her business is that demand is growing and the disadvantage is the lack of furniture like tables and chairs to accommodate all their clients.

Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to buy tables and chairs to be able to accommodate all her clients and open a restaurant. This is her first loan with the institution in the 10 years she has run her business.

For these reasons Adela is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her eatery and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her eatery and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius and his family live in a rural home in Central Kenya. He has made a living doing mixed-farming for 6 years. Farm products from his farm are sold at a local market near his home. He uses the income generated to pay for household and business related expenses. 
 
Julius is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cow, and to buy a chaff-cutter and fertilizer for planting vegetables. The borrowed money will be used to buy chaff-cutting machine and construction tools and materials for building a cowshed. The fertilizer will be stored for a few days as he awaits planting season. 
The impact of this loan investment would be: improved animal husbandry, improved feed management and improved productivity of his farm.  
Income generated from this investment will be used by Julius to repay the loan, invest more in the business and elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed and buy a chaff cutter and fertilizer

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 58 years old and married with seven children. He is a resident of Bundibugyo-Uganda.

Paul's business is farming and selling cocoa. He works six days a week and eight hours a day. He ventured into business in 1997 to raise income for the family and to serve the available market from cocoa companies.

Paul possesses a vision of educating his children and building his family a fully-furnished permanent residential house, only he is challenged by seasonality changes just like other cocoa dealers. Paul intends to use the loan to buy building materials to complete construction of his residential house.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, timber and iron sheeting to construct his house.

loans.name: Nosethu

texts.en: "I am very grateful for my Kiva loan as it has helped me a lot with paying school fees. After the first loan, I was worry-free and concentrated more on my studies, and that helped me pass most of my subjects. Before the loan it was very hard for me to get money for groceries, but with the Kiva stipend I cannot worry. It helped me even to cover emergencies, and also transport for other months."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
This is Kelvin who is 22 years old who lives with his uncle as a guardian  His mother is a single mother and not able to provide for him and his other 5 siblings. She cannot financially assist him in any way. 

He is in his fourth year and the final semester studying for a Bachelor's degree in Economics and Finance. The Kiva loan will assist him pay his tuition costs and enable him to finish school in order to assist his family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition costs for a B.Sc. in Economics and Finance

loans.name: Kigunga Twetungure Women's Group

texts.en:
Irene is a 37-year-old hardworking married woman with four children, ages 6, 11, 13 and 15. They do not all attend school. The family lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. Irene deals in cattle fattening and farming to earn a living. Irene’s dream is to expand her business to a modern farm, but she is challenged by bad weather that has created prolonged droughts, which leave no pasture for her cows. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening at her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening at her farm.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Gladys, an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk. Through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. 

Gladys is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy seeds that she will use in planting. With these quality seeds, she will be able to harvest more. Also, the seeds will not be affected by harsh weather patterns, assuring her of profits. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

Help out this Kenyan farmer with great dreams and ambitions!

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Kitagwenda Head Teachers Association Group

texts.en:
Paros is a hardworking married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. All his children attend school.

Paros is a member of Kitagwenda Head Teachers Association. He is a coffee farmer, which he supplements with salary by working as a head teacher. He is determined to educate all his children, but he is limited by stiff competition, bad weather and price fluctuations.

Paros has requested a loan to buy manure and mulch for his coffee garden.

loans.use: to buy manure and mulch for his coffee garden.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin and his family live in a rural home in Nandi Hills, Kenya. He, his wife, and their three children enjoy dairy farming, for it is their livelihood and source of income. Benjamin has been doing dairy farming for three decades straight. He sells raw milk at a local market near his farm. 

Benjamin is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cow. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done. 

He projects that the animal's health and welfare will be improved as a result of the loan investment. This will further lead to improved milk production and income. 

Your loan investment will help Benjamin and his family elevate their livelihoods and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer, soda, Waragi, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Norma Adriana

texts.en: Norma Adriana (pictured with a group of her students) is 42 years old and has been an educator for the last 22 years, She started a school for young children and she says that she loves children and loves her job. She is asking for a loan to invest in her school. She works with kids from one month to 3 1/2 years old. She provides them with breakfast and does some motor training.

loans.use: to provide working capital for her school.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is a 34-year-old married father of two daughters. Luis drives a taxi cab to earn income and his wife works at a shoe store. Luis needs a loan to fix his car. He hopes you can help him because he has to support his daughters and the family's income is low. Luis is healthy and works hard and he is doing everything possible to move his family to a better neighborhood from the poor neighborhood where he currently lives.

loans.use: to fix his taxi cab.

loans.name: Jose Odilio

texts.es: José tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 20 años y 14 años de edad. José trabaja como transportista y al mismo tiempo elabora trabajos de  albañil desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicito anteriormente un crédito para poder construir el servicio sanitario y gracias a ello ahora su familia goza de mejor salubridad en el hogar, por lo que con miras de continuar con las mejoras de su vivienda José solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para  invertir en la  construcción de un cuarto dormitorio el cual lo inicio hace poco pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava etc.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children aged 20 and 14 years old. José works as a driver and at the same time does bricklayer work. He has done this for a long time and it allows him to gain his daily sustenance and provide for his household.

With the desire to improve his housing conditions he requested a previous loan to construct a bathroom and thanks to this his family now enjoy better sanitation in the house. So looking at continuing with the improvements in his house José is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bedroom. He started it a while ago but does not have the economic resources to complete it. With the requested amount he will buy cement, sand, brick and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete, sand, windows and doors, to be able to improve her house and provide her family with better protection.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
