Moris is 35 years old. He lives with his wife, his three-year-old daughter, and his mother in Kareli district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. 

Moris wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan for purchasing a minibus. 

He will start trading fruits and vegetables from village to village and will generate stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 26 years old and single. He is a motorcycle driver and has been in business for two years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy another motorcycle for transportation services. The profits from the business will be used for savings and to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Jambulati

texts.en:
Jambulati, 48 years old and married with one daughter, is from Rustavi city. Jambulati has his own car and works as a driver. His income is hardly enough to meet all the daily expenses of his family. Therefore, Jambulati wants to start trading fruits and vegetables using his mini-bus to transport the produce. He had applied for credit from local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poverty. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Jambulati's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $700 (USD) which he will use to buy fruits and vegetables and sell for profit locally.
Jambulati and his family members are very grateful for the financial support, as the family's living conditions will significantly improve thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Santos Daniel tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la caficultura, cuenta con 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad con la cual ha adquirido buena experiencia de acuerdo a su excelente desempeño.
Don Santos Daniel es una persona muy conocida en su aldea por ser muy responsable y muy dedicado al trabajo, esta solictando el prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos, espera que esta inverison le ayude  a generar  mayores ingresos en el hogar, y asi hacerle frente a los compromisos contraidos.
Don Santos Daniel uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su finca y en las proximas cosecha obtener mejores resultados.


Trojes, Honduras - Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Santos Daniel is 50 years old and lives with his wife and 5 children in the community of Trojes, East of Honduras.  He makes a living in coffee production, and has been engaging in this activity for 15 years.  He has gained good experience because of his excellent performance.

Daniel Santos is a well-known person in his village because he is very responsible and very dedicated to his work.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers for his crops. He hopes that this investment will help him generate more revenue at home, and so cope with the contracted commitments.

Santos Daniel's dream is to improve his farm and to have better results in the next harvest.

Trojes, Honduras - June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Step By Step Group

texts.en:
Despite all the mosquito bites at the Beitbridge border, Patricia still travels to South Africa four times a month to procure groceries and clothes to resell. 

In 2012, life was hectic for her family, hence she decided to help her husband in taking care of the family financially by starting a cross-border business where she could procure groceries to sell to mini-supermarkets and also clothes to sell to people in her community. Since then, business has not been usual for her; she now has so many orders that she needs to boost her capital.

Patricia and three other hardworking ladies decided to join THRIVE Microfinance. They got training and benefited, mostly on savings, budgeting, and keeping financial records. 

With the loan she hopes to boost her business and meet all the orders that she has now. Her family hopes to own a house of their own.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she can stock for resale.

loans.name: Final Decision Group

texts.en:
It is just about 4 am and a woman named Serize is already awake and working at her sewing machine. She needs a few more hours of darkness, not to sleep but to sew and pack her things into one huge bale weighing over 90 kg. Serize sews mostly baby clothing and then goes to sell these in Lusaka, Zambia. Her husband is also a cross-border trader and they travel together. They sell at the Kamwala market where it is always busy with buyers and sellers.

Their family depends on this business for their livelihood. Serize’s husband also sells hardware in Zambia. He is a carpenter by profession, so he makes household furniture such as cupboards and bookshelves. 

Serize is part of a group called Final Decision. They need a $1,000 loan from THRIVE Microfinance. Serize will use her potion of the loan to buy sewing materials and repair her sewing machine. She plans to buy an alternative power source to help her continue with her work whenever power is cut off for long hours. She hopes that a Kiva loan of $1,000 will help her buy a diesel generator and help their group grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy cloth and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La socia Maura se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Maura continues her business raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs, and with the income from this business she would like to start a grocery store to fulfill her dream of having her own business. She also wants to have a larger space in which to sell her animals.

Maura is asking for a loan so she can buy guinea pigs and feed for them. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.en:
Rosa Patricia a 40-year-old woman who has four sons. Only one of her sons depends on her economically. 

Rosa Patricia would like to borrow 20,000 MXN (Mexican Pesos) to fix a car that she uses to transport her merchandise. Currently, she works making clothes (since 2000) and selling catalog shoes. In the past, she has taken loans from other companies and always paid them on time.

loans.use: to fix a car that she uses to transport her merchandise.

loans.name: Lorena Concepción

texts.es: Lorena tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la Ciudad de México. Ella estudió una licenciatura en Contaduría Pública y actualmente tiene un trabajo estable en esa área. Es una mujer muy persistente, que siempre se pone nuevos objetivos y siempre busca crecimiento, también es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace cuatro años gracias a su afición por los zapatos y a su interés por obtener más ingresos, inició un negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo, ha sido un negocio que le ha sido muy gratificante, su principal dificultad son las personas morosas y sobretodo la falta de oferta por capital. Con un préstamo de MXN 12,000 Lorena podrá comprar un gran volumen de zapatos y podrá dejar satisfechos a todos sus clientes, su meta principal con este negocio es establecerse en un local comercial para poder generar mayores ventas. Su principal motivación son sus hijos y su familia, está orgullosa de luchar por sus sueños y siempre perseguirlos. Ella estará muy agradecida con todas las personas que la ayuden a conseguir un sueño más.
texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old, married, has two children and lives in Mexico City.  She went to school for a degree in Public Accounting and currently has stable employment in this field. She is a very persevering woman who is constantly setting new goals for herself and is always looking to grow. 

She is also an enterprising woman. Thanks to her fondness for shoes and her interest in increasing her income, four years ago she started a business selling shoes from a catalog. It has been a very gratifying business. Her main difficulties are the people who don't pay or are slow payers and especially the inaccessibility to capital. With a loan of  12,000 Pesos Lorena will be able to buy a large quantity of shoes and make all of her customers satisfied. Her main goal with this business is to establish a store so she can generate more sales. 

Her main motivations are her children and her family and she is proud to be fighting to achieve her dreams and to always pursue them. She is very grateful to all the people who are helping her to achieve one more dream.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes.

loans.name: El Porvenir Rancho Chico Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida (sentada en la silla). El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mesas y sillas, que utilizó para independizarse y abrir su propio negocio. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo mayores inconvenientes. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento, las ocupaciones de sus integrantes son; carnicería, taller de llaves, llantería, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de ropa. Su negocio es la cocina, ella se ocupa de preparar platos como; Chicharrón (Chanchito frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa y plátano),  majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros, actividad que realiza en la puerta de su domicilio utilizando unas sombrillas para cubrir el sol, y sobre unas mesas y sillas que adquirió con el préstamo anterior, “gracias a la ayuda obtenida he podido independizarme, ahora me falta estabilizar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es nuevo por el lugar y existe demanda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como, aceita, arroz, fideo, papa, etc. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para continuar con su negocio diario. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estabilizar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31 year old woman who lives with her partner and has 2 children, aged 1 and 8. Her business is selling food. In the photo, she is the person sitting in the chair.

She used a prior loan to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs, which she used to gain independence and open her own business. Her payments were on time because she did not have any major problems. This time, she is leading the communal bank. The occupations of the communal bank members are: butcher, key making, tire selling, making plaster handicrafts, selling refreshments, running a bookstore, and selling clothing. 

Maria's business is in her kitchen, which she uses to create plates such as "Chicharrón" (fried pork), "Cogote Relleno" (free-range chicken necks, stuffed with potato and plantain), "majao" (ground jerkey, boiled plantains, and rice), peanut soup (soup with a peanut base), and others. She works in the door of her property, using some umbrellas to block the sun. She also uses the tables and chairs that she acquired with her previous loan. 

"Thanks to the the help that I have received, I have been able to become independent. Now, I need to stabilize my business", she comments. The advantage of her business is that is new in the area, and there is demand. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase supplies such as cooking oil, rice, pasta, potatoes, etc. 

Maria's dream is to have a stable business. She wishes to buy cooking supplies to continue her daily business. This is the third sequence of loans with the institution, in the 2 years that she has been working in this business.

It is for this reason that Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of cooking supplies to stabilize her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: for the purchase of cooking supplies to stabilize her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a wider range of materials for her crocheting business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy storybooks and more toys for her preschool.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She makes cakes and scones and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years.

Maria requested a loan to buy cement, a drum, cooking ingredients such as flour, sugar, and oil, and also baking utensils like dishes and trays to improve her bakery business. She plans to use her profits to help cover her family's daily expenses and also to pay her children's school fees.

She joined SPBD this year to again access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, a drum, baking ingredients, and utensils for her bakery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock for sale.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Marlyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Marlyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 38 years old and married with six children. She lives in a rural community on the outskirts of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She buys cocoa beans and sells them to the cocoa agents to earn a living, and has been doing this for three years.

Teresia requested a loan to buy new materials such as a scale, net, shovel, nails and drum to improve her cocoa drying shed. She hopes to cover her family's weekly expenses with the profit that she makes with her business.

She recently joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a scale, net, nails, shovel, and drum for her cocoa drying business.

loans.name: Chido Chedu Group

texts.en:
Just before twilight melts away, a woman named Grace wakes up to bake buns and pies. She runs a small bakery. 

After that, she wakes her three children and prepares them for school. When the children leave for school, Grace walks to a nearby market to supply retailers, vendors, and local tuck-shops. She sells her pies and buns until they are sold out. Since she supplies tuck-shops, she does not get paid on delivery, she collects her payment in the evening. 

After a hard day’s work, Grace goes back home to cook for her children. Due to power cuts, Grace has to cook using the fire. Although she is exhausted, she wakes up in a few hours, when electricity is restored, to bake more buns and pies for the following day’s supplies.

Grace is married to a carpenter. He works hard and does other activities to earn extra income, but this is not sufficient to cover all their family’s expenses. Grace’s business helps to meet some of the family’s needs and keep the children in school. She is one of the many vendors who supply fresh baked buns and pies to low-income consumers. 

Grace is part of a group called Chido Chedu Group (meaning “our wish”). She needs a loan, so that she can buy a bigger oven to bake more buns and pies. She wishes to move away from her kitchen and rent a bigger space. Grace and her group members hope that a loan, backed by Kiva, will help their growing businesses to generate more revenue for their work.

loans.use: to buy a larger oven to increase her output of cakes and pies.

loans.name: Fast Track Group

texts.en:
With her wide beaming smile, you cannot help but be captivated by the energy and passion for her business portrayed by Eugenia. Small in stature but big in actions and vision, she epitomises the old adage “dynamite comes in small packages”. This 35-year-old married mother sells secondhand clothing and also sells vegetables, including potatoes, tomatoes, rape, etc. and fruits. For 10 years she has been joining the early morning hub to get the freshest produce for her customers. Secondhand clothing she gets from the local Mbare wholesalers.

Fast Track Group is a group based in Mufakose, a high density area. The group consists of four like-minded women, Eugenia being one, who stay near each other and enjoy a shared history both personally and in business. She and her group members attended training sessions at Thrive and were empowered by the business knowledge and advice that they gained. With her Kiva loan she is planning on growing both her businesses by procuring more stock thereby increasing her income levels. In the future Eugenia is planning to write her own poetry book as she loves writing poetry and rewrite her O levels.

loans.use: To increase her stock to meet growing demand.

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actual mente tienen dos hijos y solo su esposa y sus dos hijas viven en casa. 

Edgar, tiene un apiario desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la producción de miel lo aprendió gracias a un tío que le enseño, pero desde hace cinco años decidió independizarse, le gusta mucho este trabajo, las colmenas las tiene a una hora de su casa y viaja en una motocicleta, por el momento solo un primo le ayuda al mantenimiento de dichas colmenas.

Edgar, necesita el crédito para comprar 60 cajones de colmenas que le están vendiendo, esto le vendrá a favorecer en gran manera, porque incrementara las ganancias cuando saque la miel y así cubrirá las necesidades de su familia. 

Edgar, sueña con ser un apicultor exitoso y poder exportar mucha miel a las afueras del país, para que los ingresos que tengan como familia sean muy buenos; también quiere que sus hijos se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Edgar, 25 years old, studied until high school. He is in a relationship. His partner makes a living from domestic service. Currently, they have two children, and only his wife and his two children live at home.

Edgar has had an apiary for 5 years. He makes a living from producing honey. He learned it thanks to an uncle who taught him, but five years ago he decided to become independent. He likes this job a lot. He has the beehives an hour from home and he travels by motorcycle. For the moment, just one cousin helps him to maintain these hives.

Edgar needs the loan to purchase 60 crates of beehives that they are selling him. This will come to benefit him greatly, because he will increase his profits when he takes out the honey and thus will cover his family’s necessities.

Edgar dreams of being a successful bee keeper and to be able to export a lot of honey to the outskirts of the country so that the income that his family makes is very good. Also, he wants that his children prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase 60 crates of beehives that they are selling him.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 30 years old and all three of her children attend school.

Mary Jane has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell like blouses, pants, school uniforms, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like blouses, pants, school uniforms, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia Virginia se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion y venta de muebles,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar madera para hacer los muebles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Virginia continues making a living from her business producing and selling furniture. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She already has had many years in this business and it is going very well for her. 

Her dream is to grow her business selling furniture. She is requesting the loan to purchase wood to make the furniture.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Eddy Pablo

texts.es:
El socio Eddy se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de muebles,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles.El socio solicita el credito para comprar madera para hacer los muebles.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eddy continues making a living from his business producing and selling furniture. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He already has had many years in this business and it is going very well for him. 

His dream is to grow her business selling furniture. He is requesting the loan to purchase wood to make the furniture.

He is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Maa Mariyam Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Phulamani, aged 46 years, is the featured borrower of Maa Mariyam SHG-C (Self-Help Group C) from the village Mali Dom Guda of Koraput district.She is the one standing to the right in the photo. She lives with her husband who is a truck driver and her two sons who are illiterate and unemployed.

Working in the fields is one of the most difficult jobs today, due to the great effort needed to make progress, but Phulamani is a woman who has never given up, despite the weather or other circumstances that may arise. She is always prepared to seek resources for her family.

The only thing that she lacks is proper source of water. The area where she lives does not have access to proper water resources.They have to depend upon the river water, which is highly polluted, and most of the people in that area are affected by water borne diseases. So in order to protect herself and her family, Phulamani, along with her group member Pramala, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. With the loan amount she will purchase water pipes in order to facilitate water supply and install a hand pump so that she will not have to depend upon the dirty river water anymore.

She aspires to renovate the roof of her house in the near future.

loans.use: to install a water pump and purchase water pipes in order to facilitate the supply of clean water

loans.name: Karla Yesenia

texts.es: Karla, Tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo, y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  Ella trabajó por un tiempo en una maquila y hace 3 años tiene su propia pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, churros, refrescos, carnes, verduras, azúcar, manteca, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio con abarrotes y poder aumentar las ventas e ingresos, va comprar carnes, verduras, pan, refrescos, churros, condimentos, embutidos y otros. Su meta es ampliar el local del negocio y hacerlo crecer mas.
texts.en:
Karla is 34 years old. She lives in a common law marriage with her husband with whom she has a child. They live in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Barbara. She worked for a time in a factory and for three years she has had her own grocery store to sell staple goods such as rice, beans, churros, soft drinks, meat, vegetables, sugar, butter, cleaning products, and other groceries.

She has decided to request a loan for 10,000 Lempiras to supply the business with groceries and to be able to increase the sales and income. She is going to purchase meat, vegetables, bread, soft drinks, churros, condiments, lunch meat, and others. Her goal is to expand her business space and make it grow more.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, bread, soft drinks, churros, condiments, lunch meat, and others.

loans.name: Tikariy Quillahuata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TIKARY QUILLAHUATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de       Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                       
La socia es la Sra. Yuliana continua con su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva buen tiempo  con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día   su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  cuyes a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes entre otros.
La socia que está pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo después la foto porque pidió permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de crianza de animales y negocio de servicio de taxi.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
These people are members of the Tikary Quillahuata Community Bank located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province and department of Cusco. Sra. Yuliana is a member of the group. She continues to raise animals and has had her business for a long time now. All is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. Yuliana raises guinea pigs and sells to her customers. She wishes to continue with her work so she can support her family.

Yuliana is seeking a loan so she can buy guinea pigs and other supplies. She can be seen in the separate photo; she wasn't in the group photo as she had permission to work when it was taken.

The other members have a variety of businesses: restaurant, grocery store, animal raising and sales, taxi service.

Yuliana thanks those donors who support her dream and promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy guinea pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Philace

texts.en:
Philace is a 28-year-old married woman who supports a family with 3 children. 

She has dairy farmed for 10 years and earns 30,000 KES per month. 

Philace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and supply. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 22-year-old married woman who supports a family with 2 children. 

She has  farmed for 17 years and earns 25,000 KES per month. 

Josephine has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and supply.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 57-year-old married woman with eight school-aged children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Perla has a fruit and vegetable retail business and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell to customers.

Perla has been in this business for ten years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es:
La socia Fransisca pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ISABEL DE JAJAHUANA, la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose al negocio el cual le va bien gracias a al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono entre otros.
La socia se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Fransisca belongs to the "SANTA ISABEL DE JAJAHUANA" communal bank. She continues to farm and raise livestock. She has worked in this business for years and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She is a responsible and persevering person, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

Fransisca is requesting the loan to buy manure amongst others.

She feels content with the loan and promises to pay her installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy manure amongst others.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio Claudio , continua dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que  el socio saca adelante a su familia.
En esta oportunidad Claudio requiere otro crédito para comprar madera entre otros.

Claudio continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudio continues to make wooden furniture such as tables, chairs, doors, beds etc. He's had his business for a long time now, and all is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. This is how he helps his family get ahead.

Now Claudio is seeking another loan to buy wood and other supplies. He continues to be a member of the Mamacha Rosario Community Bank which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy wood and other supplies

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 52-year-old married woman and hard working entrepreneur with six children, two attend school.

Linda has had a fish vending business for 20 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy seafood to sell to customers.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: Don Victoriano, tiene 62 años de edad, esta casado, reside con su esposa y una hija en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura realizando trabajos de jornal y hace 5 años que ha cultivado su propia finca de café, el cual vende en húmedo y seco en la misma zona. Esta solicitando  5,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento en limpieza y fertilización al cultivo de café, para mejorar la producción y poder mejorar cada día sus ingresos. Tiene como meta seguir sembrando café para obtener mas ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Victoriano, 62, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has always made a living in agriculture,  by doing day labor. For the past five years he has been growing his own coffee farm, which is sold dry or moist in the same area.

He is requesting 5,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and to do maintenance on his coffee crop, such as cleaning and fertilizing. This is to improve production and to increase his income each day. 

His goal is to continue planting coffee so he can make more money and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clean up his coffee farm.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina continua dedicándose a la venta comida y con la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alexandria continues to sell food and work as a farmer. She's had her businesses for a long time now, and all is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She wishes to carry on with her jobs so she can continue to support her family.

Now Alexandria needs a loan to buy rice, oil etc. She continues to be a member of the Mamacha Rosario Community Bank which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 47-year-old married mother of seven children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Virginia has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Virginia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married mother of eight children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Pinky has a general store business in the Philippines. Pinky requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pinky has been in this business for four years. In the future, Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 56 years old and married with six children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Anecita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Anecita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Enalyn

texts.en:
Enalyn is 25 years old and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Enalyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Enalyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice business for four years and also earns an income from a general store.

Enalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, 43 years old, is an  illiterate rural woman who can sign her name only.  She lives at Dakshin Altagram, a remote village in Dhupguri. Her family is comprised of her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter). Her husband is a mason and the nature of his work is very irregular. The small income Jamila's husband earns is mostly spent on their household expenses.  Yet Jamila and her husband try their utmost to give their children an education. Her elder son who studied up to grade nine now works as a daily wage laborer; the other son studies in grade 8.

Jamila's only daughter, 15-year-old Nargis is attending Patkidaha Islamia High Madrasah. She has been promoted into grade 10 but got very poor marks because  she didn't have the help of a private tutor nor was she provided with enough study materials.  But Nargis wants to continue her studies to do well in the forthcoming Secondary Board exam. For this, she has to take good private tuition, and she needs books and other study materials which are not affordable by her parents from their present income. The education of Jamila's daughter is now a financial burden. Hence Jamila applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. 

With the loan Jamila will pay the tuition fees, school fees, and will purchase textbooks for her daughter. This financial help will save the girl from dropping out of school and let her continue her studies.

Jamila and Nargis convey their heartiest thanks to their lenders.

loans.use: To meet the cost of her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: galvanized sheets, beams, pins, etc., to build a new galley and rearrange the kitchen area.

loans.name: Dora Esperanza

texts.es: Dora de 53 años de edad vive con su mamá su compañero de vida y su sobrino en casa familiar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que demuestra su espíritu de superación y desde hace dieciocho años  presta sus servicios domésticos en casa particular en la cual se ha sabido ganar la confianza mostrando su honestidad y lealtad. Dora desea construir un muro a las afuera de su vivienda ya que les servirá de protección para su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, grava etc., para construir el muro que tanto ha deseado tener en su vivienda y así poder tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is 53 years old and lives with her mother, her partner and her nephew in their family home.  She is a very hard working woman with a spirit of self improvement.  For eighteen years she has worked as a housekeeper in a private home, a job in which she gained trust through demonstrating her honesty and loyalty. 

Dora wants to construct a wall outside her home, to serve as protection for her family.  For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, etc., to construct the wall she has to wanted for her home, in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, etc. to construct the wall she has so wanted for her home, in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 58 years old with six children. Julita works very hard to provide for them.

Julita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Julita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, vinegar, soy sauce, and toothpaste. 

In the future, Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more herbal products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a charcoal retailing business. 

Analiza dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old with three children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nenita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Parissin N°2 Group

texts.fr:
Marc est un cultivateur âgé de 48 ans. C’est lui qui tient les deux moutons.
Il  vit au Mali avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 27 à 11 ans.
Le souhait de Marc est d’avoir plus d’argent pour acheter beaucoup de moutons et augmenter son revenu. Son rêve est de rénover sa maison et payer aussi les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Marc se réjouit dans l’élevage des moutons car il gagne sa vie avec. Il exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village et les villages voisins de son village et vend ses moutons dans marchés locaux de sa zone où il peut faire un bénéfice prévisionnel mensuel de 70000F.
Les difficultés auxquelles il se heurte sont les maladies et pertes de moutons
texts.en:
Marc is a 48 year old farmer. He is holding the two sheep in the photo. He lives in Mali with his wife and five children aged between 27 and 11 years old who all attend school. Marc hopes to have more money to purchase a lot of sheep and to increase his income. His dream is to renovate his house and pay the school fees for his children.
Marc is happy working as a sheep farmer as this profession enables him to earn his living. He has been doing this activity for seven years. He buys his stock in his village and in the neighbouring villages and sells his sheep at the local regional markets where he can make a monthly projected profit of 70000F.
The difficulties he meets in his activity are diseases and loss of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Abla Sika

texts.fr: Abla Sika est revendeuse de boissons,des pagnes et d'autres produits dans sa boutique depuis 2004, Abla pour renforcer son activité sollicite un quatriéme crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère assurer l'épanouissement de la famille tout gardant pérenne son activité. Abla âgée de 42ans est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en: Abla Sika has been selling drinks, pagne cloth and other products in her shop since 2004. To reinforce her activity Abla requests a fourth loan to buy merchandise in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. She hopes to ensure that her family flourishes at the same time as rendering her business durable. Abla is 42 and married with three children.

loans.use: To buy drinks and pagne cloth.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 51 years old and married and she is blessed with three children. 

She has a retail shop, and the business has been profitable for the past 20 years she has been in this business. 

She will be using the loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil, and soap detergents to sell, and she hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to expand her retail shop and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil, and soap detergents to sell and she hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Willliam

texts.en:
Most Kenyans' dream is to finish college and get a white-collar job. But William, who is a small farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya, opted to become a full-time farmer. He decided that he would be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. 

William is blessed with five lovely children whom he refers to as his "heartbeats.” His primary sources of income are dairy and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income. 

Deciding to practice poultry farming for William was not difficult. He saw his parents raise poultry since he was young. For the past 30 years, William has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry. However, the biggest challenge is a lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. The demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, William will make more income, which will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, William is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Noellie Group

texts.fr:
Mme NOELIE est responsable du groupe NOELIE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 22ans. Personne ne va  à l’école. Mme a 06personnes en charge.
Mme fait l’élevage et le jardinage depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 bœuf pour élever, 02boites de graines de semence et 04sacs d’engrais pour son jardinage.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noelie is the leader of the Noelie group. She is married with three children  of whom the oldest is 30 and the youngest 22. None of the children goes to school. Mrs. Noelie has six people who are dependent on her.
Mrs. Noelie has been a livestock farmer and a gardener for nine years. She buys her stock in local markets.
She wants to buy one bullock for breeding, two boxes of seeds, and four sacks of fertiliser for her gardening.
This lady would like to expand her business with the profits. She aims to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy one bullock for breeding, two boxes of seeds, and four sacks of fertiliser for her gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feed.

loans.name: Stephenson

texts.en:
Stephenson is a hardworking crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya who loves his job. He is married and has two school-going children. Aside from crop farming, Stephenson also farms cattle, poultry, sheep and trees. 

The key lesson he has taken away from 10 years of being in crop farming is the importance of using quality farm inputs and being able to predict the weather. 

Stephenson is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizers to enhance his farm’s productivity.

Thanks to your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Stephenson’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a rural smallholder crop farmer in the Nkubu region of Kenya. He is married and has four children. Besides crop farming, Justus also does dairy and poultry farming for extra food and income. The most important ability he has developed from 35 years of farming is predicting weather patterns.

Justus is seeking an 80,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy quality agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With these, Justus’s chances for a successful harvest are greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en:
Jessy is a rural small-holder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya who is known for crop farming. He is married and has 2 children. Jessy and his family live and work on a 2-acre farmland where they keep 2 cows, 10 heads of poultry, and 3 donkeys, and also grow food crops. 

Jessy is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Jessy’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nabudatkhon

texts.ru: Ее зовут Набуватхон. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Набуватхон дома занимается шитьем одежды. В этой сфере деятельности она работает уже 8 лет. Набуватхон набралась большого опыта за все эти годы. Она обратилась за помощью, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Ее нынешняя швейная машинка скоро выйдет из строя. Она не хочет останавливать работу и надеется, с помощью заемных средств она купить новую компьютерную швейную машинку. Набуватхон верит, что ее обязательно поддержать и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: This is Nabudatkhon. She is married and has three children. Nabudatkhon sews clothing from home. She has been working in this field for eight years. Nabudatkhon has acquired great experience through all these years. She has applied for help in order to buy a new sewing machine. Her current sewing machine will soon fail. She does not want to stop work and hopes that, with the help of the borrowed funds, she will buy a new computerized sewing machine. Nabudatkhon believes that she will definitely be supported and thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort that one must put forth to progress. 

Hello Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Josephine, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Mukuuni in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with four lovely angelic-looking children. 

For the last twenty years, Josephine has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet. Josephine finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels. 

Josephine is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and increase her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds

loans.name: Safiya

texts.ru: Сафия родилась в семье дехканина. Её отец и мать занимались  сельским хозяйством. Сафия с детства была трудолюбивая. Особенно она любила выращивать помидоры. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Сафия имеет медицинское  образование. Работала в центральной поликлиники Спитаменского района в качестве  лаборантки. Она очень честная, ответственная и добрая женщина.  Воспитала четверых детей с любовью и терпением. Из за трудностей в семье в 2006 году ей пришлось уехать  в Россию. Она более восьми лет проработала там. Два года назад ее муж умер из за болезни. Два сына уехали на заработки в Россию. Но их заработок хватает   только на содержание семьи. А ей надо достроить дом построенного год назад . Из за жаркой погоды для содержания  продуктов питания в свежем виде  ей необходимо купить холодильник и пластиковые окна и двери для нового дома. На полученную сумму она купит все необходимое. В будущем София не смотря на свой возраст мечтает стать бизнес леди. А в данный момент она работает в столовой в качестве повара, что приносит  ей дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Safiya was born in a farming family. Her father and mother were engaged in agriculture. Safiya was hard-working from childhood. She particularly liked growing tomatoes. She is married and has four children.

Safiya has a medical education. She has worked in the Spitamen Region Central Polyclinic as a laboratory assistant. She is a very honest, responsible and kind woman. She has raised four children with love and patience. She had to move away to Russia in 2006 due to family problems. She worked there for over eight years. Two years ago her husband died due to illness. Two sons have gone to earn money in Russia, but their earnings are only just enough to support the family, and she needs to finish the house that was built a year ago. Due to the hot weather, she must buy a refrigerator and vinyl windows and doors for the new house in order to keep produce fresh. She will buy all the essentials with the money she receives. In future, Safiya dreams of becoming a businesswoman despite her age. At the present time she works in a canteen as a cook, which gives her additional income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install vinyl windows and doors.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 30 years old, married to Alfred, and she supports four children. She has been a salonist for the last 11 years and the business earns her KES 7,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of manufactured hair pieces, hair neutralizer and a hair blower, so as to enable her to offer better and faster services to clients. 

She plans to use her gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children. Her hopes are to eradicate poverty in her home and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more manufactured hair pieces, hair neutralizer and a hair blower.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old, married and supports a family of 4 children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sale. 

Julius has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production, so as to sell and supply milk in the area.  He hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family, educate his children and also expand his farming business. His future hopes and dreams are to improve his farming methods, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Jasmira

texts.en:
Jasmira, a 31-year-old rural housewife, is from the remote village of Mukuldanga in Falakata. She is married to Aminur who is a 37-year-old vegetable vendor. Both husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. They are blessed with two children (a son and a daughter). They are students in grade eight and grade five, respectively.

Jasmira’s husband is the only earning member of the family of four and his business does not provide them with sufficient income to run the family well.

Jasmira's only 13-year-old daughter Mamani, is in grade eight in Singjani High School. She is a smart and brilliant girl and is very attentive to her studies. Every year, Jasmira always worries about the problem she faces in making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenditures that are needed to cover school fees, uniforms and books for her daughter.

This is why Jasmira has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner’s BJS to pay for her daughter's tuition fees, school expenses and necessary articles like books, pens, pencils, geometry box, uniforms etc. She dreams of seeing her daughter receive a higher secondary grade education.

In this picture, Jasmira and her daughter Mamani are grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase educational materials and pay schooling fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru: Тути хозяйственная женщина. Она родилась и росла в селе Куруш, поселок Хаштяк. Она замужем и мать единственного сына. Тути работала учительницей в средней школе. И преподавала детям по истории. Но она не смогла продолжать работу в школе, так как не позволило здоровье. Она очень энергичная женщина. Поэтому не сможет сидеть сложа руки. Её муж Мирза работает плотником. А сын занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. С целью помочь мужу и сыну она начала дома содержать крупно рогатый скот и ухаживать за ней. Она откармливает скот. А муж и сын перепродают. И за полученную выручку она удвоит поголовье скота. В этом году ее сын начал выращивать корм для скота. Этим у Тути будет сэкономлены деньги на корм. Так как они с сыном живут на одном месте и у них общие доходы и расходы. По этому Тути хотела увеличит объем поголовье скота. Но сэкономленные ими деньги не хватило на покупку новых голов скота. А деньги заработанные мужем хватить только на содержание семьи. С этой целью она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. На полученный кредит она купит КРС и этим увеличить объем своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tuti is a house-proud woman. She was born and raised in the village of Kurush in the Khashtyak settlement. She is married and the mother to one son. Tuti used to work as a secondary school teacher and taught children history, but she was not able to continue working in the school because her health did not allow it. She is a very energetic woman and so she cannot sit with idle hands. Her husband Mirza works as a carpenter and her son grows crops.

She started keeping cattle at home and looking after them in order to help her husband and son. She fattens the cattle, and her husband and son resell them. Using these funds, she will double her herd of livestock. This year her son began growing livestock feed. Tuti will save money on feed because of this since she and her son live in the same place and they have shared income and expenses. This is why Tuti would like to increase the size of her herd of livestock. But the money they have saved is not enough to buy new heads of cattle, and the money that her husband earns is only enough to support the family. With this aim she has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. She will buy some cattle with the loan she receives and will increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Alpana is a 38-year-old rural woman from a small village called Kalirhat in Dhupguri. She lives there with her husband and three children (two daughters and a son). All three of them are studying in different grades. Her husband is a farmer by profession and his monthly income is very limited and has to cover the education costs of his children after managing the household needs.

Alpana’s eldest son Debashish, a 14-year-old boy, studies at Kalirhat D.C High School in grade nine. He is a serious and meritorious boy who has been promoted to grade nine with good marks. Debashish’s ambition is to be an honest and responsible police officer in the future. Now he wants some good private tutoring to groom him so that he will score better in his coming board examination. His parents try their level best to make their children well-educated. Alpana decided to provide good tutors to her eldest son and it will be possible only if she can get financial assistance. That is why she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase Debashish’s educational equipment, pay his school fees and engage private tuition for him (Debashish). She hopes that this loan will provide good support to continue her son’s education further and that Debashish will be one step closer to his dream.

Alpana and Debashish (as in the picture) thank their generous lenders.

loans.use: to cover the educational the costs of her son’s education.

loans.name: Holdorali

texts.ru:
Холдорали мужчина 55 лет, женат, счастливый отец 4 детей и дедушка 10 внуков. Он с раннего возраста был приучен к труду. Окончив 9 классов школы, Холдорали устроился на работу на ферму, чтобы помогать родителям. Холдорали трудолюбивый мужчина, он никогда не жаловался на свою работу, никогда не просил у родителей денег. Он наоборот всегда помогал им и растил свои младших братьев и сестер. Сейчас уже в пожилом возрасте он до сих пор трудится. Он занимается животноводством. У него в стаде 5 коров и 10 баранов. Его жена доит коров и относит молоко на рынок. Также Холдорали занимается купле-продажей скота.
Холдорали обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой, он хочет расширить свой бизнес, купить 1 корову и барана. Но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому Холдорали надеется, что ему выделят нужную сумму. Он благодарит за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Holdorali is a 55-year-old man. He is married and the proud father of four children and grandfather to ten grandchildren. He is used to hard work from an early age. After completing nine years of schooling, Holdorali found work on a farm in order to help his parents. Holdorali is a hard-working man, and has never complained about his work and never asked his parents for money. Indeed he has always instead helped them and raised his younger brothers and sisters. Now he is already old but he still keeps working hard. He rears animals. He has five cows and ten sheep in his herd. His wife milks the cows and takes the milk to market. Holdorali also buys and sells livestock.

Holdorali has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. He wants to expand his business and to buy a cow and a sheep, but he does not have all the money needed. For this reason Holdorali hopes that he will be given the necessary sum. He is grateful for the support and help.

loans.use: to increase the size of his herd of livestock.

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu is 41 years old. She lives in the small village of Harinathpur in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her family consists of her husband and four children (three daughters and a son). Two of her daughters are married, one is still studying and her only son works as a driver after completing his education up to grade 12.

Renu is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer. But the family income is barely enough to cover the household expenses because he contributes the lion’s share of the family expenses.

Renu’s 16-year-old daughter Priyanka is a student in grade 12 in Khirerkote High School. She is studying in the Arts stream and is an average student. Now she needs good private coaching for her education in grade 12 because she is going to appear for her Higher Secondary board examination next year. As it is difficult for Renu to manage all the school fees, private tuition fees, examination fees and the cost of books for her daughter, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to continue her daughter’s education further.

She will pay Priyanka’s school fees and tuition fees and purchase books, and other necessary study materials for her with the loan money. The loan will help Renu to support her daughter for her further education without any financial constraints.

Renu and Priyanka (as in the photo) convey their gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and pay all the fees for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 38 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Zenaida has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, sugar, bread, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a married rural woman who lives in Falakata with her family of five. Being 31 years old, a housewife and a mother of three children, Kalpana struggles hard to look after her children and give them a proper education. Her husband Naltu is a worker in a mill factory. Kalpana's son is reading in grade six. One of her daughters is in grade three and the other is a preschooler.

Her only son, 13-year-old Monoranjan, is a student in grade six at Bhutanerghat High School. Just like any other boy, he wishes to do a Master's Degree in Arts. He is a very studious boy who works hard, finishes his homework and scores way ahead. His father, having a scanty income, is struggling to make ends meet. His monthly income is not sufficient to bear the household costs as well as the educational expenses of their children. Kalpana knows and recognizes Monoranjan's potential and does not want to deprive him of any opportunity to excel.

So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will purchase her son’s educational materials and books and pay his school fees with the help of the loan, and ensure Monoranjan will fulfill his dream.

Kalpana and Monoranjan are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade six.

loans.name: Nuifa

texts.en:
Nuifa is a 40-year-old rural woman who lives in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her family consists of her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter). Her two sons are engaged in small masonry work and her husband is associated with farming. The monthly income is irregular and scanty, so to afford her daughter’s education cost with the household expense is quite difficult for Nuifa.

Nuifa’s 16-year-old daughter Reshmi is a student in grade 12 in Mairardanga Goppu Memorial (H.S) in the Arts stream. She is an average student and needs good private coaching to continue her education in grade 12 because next year she is going to appear for her Higher Secondary board examination. Due to their unsatisfactory income, Nuifa fails to manage all her school fees, examination fees, private tuition fees and the cost of books for her daughter Reshmi and thus she is requesting for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to continue her daughter’s education further.

She will pay her daughter’s school fees, examination fees, and tuition fees and purchase books, and other necessary study materials with the loan. The loan will help Nuifa to support her daughter in passing out of the Higher Secondary level education without any financial constraints.

Nuifa and Reshmi (as in the photo) convey their gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To bear the costs of her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a hard working woman.  She is married with 5 children and only 4 attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She sells second hand clothes where by she has been able to generate income to support her family alongside owning rental houses.

Harriet has always aspired to expand and develop her business, however high rental fees and bad debtors pose a threat to her business. She will use the loan facility to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 26 years old, single and a barangay official from Matugnao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is one of the  members of good standing status of Paglaum MPC and has enjoyed various programs and services offered by the cooperative to its members. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase bags of cement, paint, and plywood for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, paint, and plywood for house renovation

loans.name: Althea

texts.en:
Althea is 38 years old and married with three children.

Althea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

Althea has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Althea aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is 51 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Anacorita works very hard to provide for them.

Anacorita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Anacorita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, canned goods, shampoo, soap, juices, biscuits, vinegar and other groceries. 

In the future, Anacorita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 55 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Barbara has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Barbara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi une femme de 27ans revend des produits de quincaillerie depuis 2012. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux désirs des clients. Ses achats se font au Grand Marché de Lomé. A l'avenir, elle souhaite subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rendre son activité durable.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 27-year old woman who has been selling hardware goods since 2012. She is seeking a loan to restock on merchandise and meet her customers’ needs. She buys at the main market in Lomé. Her future goals are to be able to provide for her family  and stabilize her business.
.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is an enthusiastic businesswoman from Garang, Tangub City. 

She operates a canteen at their nearby school. Through this business activity, she earns an income of PHP 750 per day. According to Melba, this is made possible because Paglaum MPC is on her side whenever she needs financial assistance for her business. 

Currently, she requests a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business, such as milk, sugar, buko (young coconut), flour, oil, cheese, butter, and others.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business like milk, sugar, buko, flour, oil, cheese, butter, and others

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Aajima

texts.en:
Aajima is a 29-year-old lady who lives in Dhupguri in West Bengal. She is a mother of two daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying in different grades in a local village school and her son is a preschooler. Aajima has a primary level education. But she is willing to provide her children with a good education so that her children do not face any obstacles in receiving their education.

Aajima’s husband is a daily wage laborer by profession. His earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their daughters after meeting the household costs of their family.

Aajima’s elder daughter, 14-year-old Lajma, is now studying in grade nine at Gossairhat R.M.H.S. (XII) School. She is a good and hardworking student. Her aim is to become a nurse in the future. Now she needs the help of private tuition to score good marks in her examination; otherwise she cannot proceed further.

Aajima learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount, she will pay the private tuition fees and school fees and buy school uniforms, books and other educational articles for her daughter Lajma.

Aajima and her daughter Lajma are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To bear the costs of her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en:
Annielyn is 46 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Annielyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Annielyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, canned goods, vinegar, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Annielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 34 years old and married with five children.

Bebelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, snack foods, and other groceries.

Bebelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Bebelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, snack foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Evelyn Edith

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera y es una joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación, actualmente habita con su grupo familiar conformado por su madre, su hermano y sus dos pequeños hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, su madre y su hermano cuida de sus hijos durante sus horas de trabajo. Evelyn desde un año presta sus servicios en casa particular realizando oficios varios para poder llevar el sustento al hogar. Evelyn desea construir un servicio sanitario por lo cual sus gastos no son suficientes para poder construirlo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillos, grava y servicio lavable ya que el que tiene ya está en mal estado lo que le genera insalubridad a su hogar y quiere dar una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 21 years old, a single mother and is a young woman who always shows her spirit of excellence. 

Currently, she lives with her family group composed of her mother, brother and her two young children aged 7 and 3.  Her mother and her brother take care of her children during her work hours. 

For a year now, Evelyn has been offering her services to private homes doing various jobs to be able to bring home sustenance. 

Evelyn wants to install a flushable toilet for which her earnings are not enough to build.  

She is requesting  a loan through FUSAI to invest in: sand, cement, bricks, gravel and a flushable toilet as the one she has is already in poor condition and it generates unhealthy home conditions and she would like to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement, bricks, gravel and a flushable toilet since the one she has is already in poor condition and she wants to provide a better quality of life.

loans.name: Idilia Celestina

texts.es: Idilia tiene 46 años edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable  y junto a su esposo que aporta al gasto de su hogar mantienen la economía de la misma, ella trabaja como cocinera y en atención al cliente en un comedor muy cercano de su localidad y es así como ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos. Idilia desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que el techo con el que cuenta ahorita es de tejas y ya algunas las tiene en mal estado por eso quiere cambiarlo por lamina porque cuando llueve le presenta filtraciones de agua, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, madera, clavos etc., para terminar de construir el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Idilia is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She and her husband, who contributes to household costs, take care of household expenses. She works as a cook and in customer service in a diner very near their town and it is in this way that she obtains income. Idilia wishes to change the roof of her house, since the roof it has right now is made of tiles, some of which are now in poor condition. For that reason she wants to change it to metal sheeting because when it rains there are leaks. For that reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: metal sheeting, wood, nails etc, to finish building the roof of her house.

loans.use: To invest in: metal sheeting, wood, nails etc, to finish building the roof of her house.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old, a widow from Silanga, Tangub City. 

She is a fish vendor and at the same time a hog raiser at their place. She has been involved in this type of business for 20 years and it gives her sufficient income for her family. Through the assistance of Paglaum MPC, Conchita was able to start up her hog raising business. 

Just recently, she requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase bags of animal feed for her hog raising business.
