loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed for hog raising business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 54 years old and married and she has three adult-age children and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

She has a sari-sari store (convenience store) that is financed by Paglaum MPC. Through this business, she has been able to send her children to school and provide other family needs. 

This time, she requests a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock the store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Berlina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  

Berlina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell, such as hot dogs, ham, etc. for her frozen foods business.

Berlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell like hot dogs, ham, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 49 years old and married with fifteen children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi and her husband Paritosh live with their two daughters in Dhupguri. Both are students in the village secondary school. Both Madhabi and her husband could not complete their secondary education due to financial issues with their families. Madhabi is a 31-year-old housewife who looks after her family. Her husband is engaged in a small scale jute business, the only income holder in the family but his income is not sufficient to meet the household expenses smoothly.

Madhabi's elder daughter, 14-year-old Pallabi, studies in grade nine in Gosssairhat R.M.H.S (XII) school. She wants to pass out by scoring good marks in the exams. But as she hails from a low income family, she also struggles hard to give her best in her studies. Madhabi sometimes becomes puzzled when she is unable to cover household expenses along with her children’s education expenses. As her daughter is in secondary class, her educational expenses are high. For these reasons, Madhabi is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay the school fees, tuition fees, and private tuition fees for her daughter, Pallabi, and also purchase educational equipment, uniforms, a bicycle etc. for her daughter’s schooling.

Madhabi is very ambitious and is always trying to make her daughter well-educated to establish her as a good citizen with a good education. She wants to fulfill her daughter’s dream of being a teacher.

Madhabi and Pallabi (in the photo) are immensely gratified by BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and pay all schooling fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Dipali lives in the small village of Harinathpur, Falakata in West Bengal. She is a careful mother of a son and has a great determination to provide her only son a good education. Being a housewife, she works hard to provide every support to her son. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

Dipali’s son, 16-year-old Hirak, is studying in grade 11 in Falakata High School. He has chosen the Arts stream and is serious about his studies. He is trying to score good marks in his final Board examination. But Dipali faces difficulties in bearing the educational expenses of her son after meeting the household costs with her husband’s inadequate income. She is striving hard to provide an uninterrupted education to her son.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Dipali is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans to pay all the educational fees, buy study materials and a cycle for her son, so that he can easily go to school, saving both time and conveyance costs. The loan will help this bright rural boy to continue his education without any obstacles.

Dipali and Hirak (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear her son's educational expenses for grade 11.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Nheb, 61 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. He has six children, two are single and four are married. To support the family, he raises ducks and pigs for sale. On average, he can make an earning of USD 3.00 a day. So far, he has been in this type of job for two years.

Currently, he wants to enlarge his livestock by adding some more pigs to his farm. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. This loan will make a great contribution to extend his business. He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs to expand his farm

loans.name: Maa Mariyam Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sushila, aged 23, is a hardworking woman who is organized and persistent. She lives with her husband who is a farmer and their 2-year-old daughter in the village Malidom Guda of Koraput district. The lady standing on the left is Sushila. She is dedicated to her family and passionate about her job. For the last two years she has been an independent storekeeper. She has a store located in the village where she works ten hours a day, every day. She has the advantage of not having much competition because so many locals have become her main customers. 

Sushila does not have a bathroom in her house. She goes outside to a open field for defecation and urination. Two months back she was bitten by a snake while she was outside to attend to nature's call. That is why Sushila, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sushila will use her portion of the loan amount to install a commode and build a bathroom in her house so that she will be able to maintain health and hygiene for her family.

Sushila aspires to provide the best education to her daughter and has a wish to see her daughter become a doctor.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a commode

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. May, is the Thai ethnic woman, has been joining in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2011. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family’s main occupation is pig breeding; each year she can sell from two to 3 tons of pork with the income of over VND 100 million. However, the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of her family and saved a small amount. 

She wants to buy a breeding pig and foods for it but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time; she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in pig breeding with high productivity, and the breeding will bring her family a considerable profit in the next year.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and foods for it

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is an entrepreneur from Khoost. She has been running her business for 7 years now, which she started out with children’s clothing. Then she decided to open a small photo shop making photos of all sorts. Later a businessman offering printing services next to her little store decided to see it and Svitlana bought the business,expanding her trade as a result. 

At this point she offers printing services, makes Xerox copies and sells office supplies in her store. She rents her facility and has two hired employees.
  
Svitlana needs 30 000 Grivnyas to purchase different kinds of printing paper. One of Svitlana’s goals is to build a house for her family some day. She is only 32 with two kids. Her oldest son is 15. Soon it will be time for him to go to college and Svitlana is planning to make some savings to help him out with school fees.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of printing paper for her office supplies store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is from Khoost and is an entrepreneur selling clothing merchandise designed for younger women. She rents a vending location in a local mall. Irina has been working in this sphere for 16 years already. She remembers how hard it was to find her niche at the market at first and get loyal clientele. However, Irina is a workaholic and she worked hard to achieve all of her goals. 

Today she tries to help her only daughter who is 27 now. 
Irina is seeking a loan of 20 000 Grivnyas to buy summer dresses to sell to her female customers this season. Bright long dresses have become very trendy in Ukraine this summer which is why there’s a high demand on them among female clients.

loans.use: to buy summer dresses to sell to her female customers this season

loans.name: Thelesphore

texts.en:
Thelesphore is 43 years old. He is married with three children aged between 12 and 15 years old, and they are all in secondary school.He is requesting for a loan to to pay for his daughter, called Nicole, who enrolled in 2014, and he plans for her to complete secondary school in 2019.Thelesphore does some local consultance while the mother is a nurse. He wishes to pay this loan in installments which would otherwise not be accepted by the school. 

After he affords to pay back the loan he wishes to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To pay shool fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Ve

texts.en:
Mrs. Ve is 56 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Animal husbandry, small business and fish sauce production are the main income of her family. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standard as well as for environment protection.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh is 45 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children, two of them have a job. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improving the health for her family as well as environment protection. Animal husbandry and fishing are her main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity and selling fish, which her husband caught.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tith Theavy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Tith Theavy is 30 years old. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. She grows cassava on three hectares area as her main source of income. Moreover, she can get more income via renovating or making house for others. She did not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm, so her cassava did not grow well and she has involved her business for 10 years. 

For Tith Theavy, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. With her past loan, she can update her living has enough food for her family. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed, pay for plowing and labor fees to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can gain her yield more than before so she can get more income to update her family in better condition.

loans.use: to buy seed, pay for plowing and labor fees to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai is 31 years old, married and has three children, all of them at school. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from cultivation and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her young children

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is from Drogobych. He has already received financial assistance from Kiva which helped him increase his income as a result.
This time he is seeking additional 10 000 Grivnyas to pour concrete for the foundations of his house. He has recently purchased a land lot which is his property now.  Igor is building a house for his family at the moment which has been his dream for a while.

loans.use: to pour concrete for the foundations of his house

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de carne de res.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, contante, generosa, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ caracterizada por su artesanía en cerámica y sus comidas tradicionales. También es donde se elabora la jalea y tiene un amplio menú en horneados típicos. De clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Patricia es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la derecha, viste pantalón verde y solera a rayas horizontales). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que trabaja en el comercio de verduras, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe, madera y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus necesidad por pagar los gastos posnatales de su hijo menor, la obligaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como;  llantería, venta de pollo frito, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en tela, taller de cerrajería, venta de horneados tradicionales, venta de leche y elaboración de sombreros de sao, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de carne de res; ella diariamente se dirige al matadero municipal donde compra carne por mayor para llevarla a su puesto de venta y venderla al menudeo, las partes más vendidas son; Biste, Cuadrado, Cabeza de lomo, Peseto, Filete, hueso blanco, paleta, chuleta, molida especial y molida corriente, “vendo carne a clientes particulares y también a puestos de venta de comida la desventaja es la falta de una heladera dónde refrigerar la carne…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de una heladera dónde refrigerar la carne. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea realizar la compra de una heladera para conservar la carne. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Patricia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para conservar la carne refrigerada para establecer su negocio y pagar los gastos de su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Patricia is 24.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children, aged 1 and 9.  Her business is the sale of beef.  She is a good mother, and an entrepreneur.  She is independent, dependable, generous, attentive, responsible and a very hard worker.  Her business is in the community of  "Cotoca" which is known for its ceramic handicrafts and traditional foods.  Jelly is also made there along with a wide variety of typical baked goods.  It has a subtropical, very humid climate, with temperatures ranging between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Patricia has a brown complexion, brown eyes, and long brown hair that she keeps tied.  She is short with a strong physical build.  Her maternal language is Guaraní which she speaks at home.  She speaks Spanish for every day use and to conduct business.  (She is standing, first from the right, dressed in green pants and a horizontal striped shirt.)  She lives with her partner who works in the sale of vegetables.  They live in a house that belongs to the family, made of adobe, wood and cement, with a roof of corrugated metal sheets and a cement floor.  They obtain well water via a pump and have electricity but no sewage system.  

The postnatal costs associated with her younger child spurred her to form a bank of persons to seek loans and improve their businesses.  It is comprised of businesses such as tire sales, sales of fried chicken, sales of second hand clothes, handicrafts from cloth, a locksmith, sales of traditional baked goods, sales of milk, and making straw hats.  Patricia's business is the sale of beef.  She goes daily to the municipal slaughterhouse where she buys meat wholesale and takes it to her stand to sell at retail.  The top sellers are steak, cubed beef, beef tenderloin, round steak, fillet, marrow bones, chuck steak, rib steak, top ground and regular ground.  

“I sell meet to individual clients and to meat stands.  The disadvantage I have is the lack of a refrigerator to refrigerate the meat," she comments.  The advantage of her business is that she relies on daily sales.  The disadvantage is the lack of a refrigerator to refrigerate the meat.  Her dream is to have a stable business.  She hopes to be able to buy a refrigerator to preserve the meat.  This is her first loan with the institution in the first year of her business.  For these reasons, Patricia seeks a loan for the purchase of a refrigerator to keep her meat refrigerated, to establish her business and to pay expenses related to her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep meet refrigerated, to establish her business and pay expenses related to her youngest child.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is engage in vending of street foods like barbeque in their town. She is 35 years old, married and has one kid. Her husband is her partner in vending their barbeque. Lenita has been nine years in running her business. 

Lenita and her husband both wishing to expand their business to increase their profit for the future of their kid. She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy meat, sausage, and other raw materials in making barbeque. She strongly believes that the loan will help her to maintain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausage, and other raw materials in making barbeque.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 54 years old, a widow with three adult children who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has been running her retail business for ten years. Lilia's business activity is financed by Paglaum MPC. She is grateful to the cooperative because she has been supported in her financial needs. This time, she is applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy construction materials, including cement, plywood, and laths, and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, including cement, plywood and laths, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 70 years old, married, and has three adult children. She is a businesswoman in their neighborhood, where she owns and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store), which has been primarily financed by Paglaum MPC since she signed up for membership. She is glad for the programs that the cooperative extends to small-time borrowers like herself. Currently, she is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 to restock her store with consumables, including canned goods, oil, soy sauce and vinegar.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumables, including canned goods, oil, soy sauce and vinegar.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old and supports four children. 

She has been in a farmer for the last two years, earning an income of KES 7,000 per month. 

Alice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides as well as a jembe (digging tool).

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and to buy a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients and for family use.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides as well as a jembe (digging tool).

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 51 years old, married, and has ten children. With four children in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as candies, canned goods, home products and other groceries. Delia has been in this business for ten years, and she sells a variety of items, including coffee, juices, noodles, biscuits, candies, and eggs. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including candies, canned goods, home products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as bread, canned goods, home products and other groceries. Jessica has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and she also earns income by selling coconut wine. Jessica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including bread, canned goods, home products and other groceries.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 58 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of beauty products to sell. Imelda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crop produce

loans.name: Catharina

texts.en:
Catharina is an intelligent and very resourceful 69-year-old smallholder farmer. She has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are milk and planting different varieties of crops. 

Catharina hails from Kapsowar, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns and this boosts crop production in the area. Catharina wants to diversify and start sheep farming. Kapsowar area has a ready market for sheep meat (mutton) and wool, hence she will not have a need to go and look for a market. 

Being a hardworking mother, Catharina has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. Catharina detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking the loan. Catharina is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

You can help Catharina with a loan so she can fulfill all her dreams.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Tigmi Group

texts.fr:
Mme THERESE représente le groupe TIGMI. Elle se porte bien. THERESE est maintenant veuve, elle est mère de 01 enfant. Il est âgé de 07ans et va à l’école.
Mme est gérante de maquis depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les brasseries en ville. 
Mme veut s’acheter 15caisses de bière et 05caisses de sucrerie et 06 chaises. 
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne toujours ouvrir une cave.
texts.en:
Mme Therese represents the group called Tigmi. She is doing fine. Therese is now a widow, the mother of one child; he is seven years old and attends school.  

Mme Therese has been the manager of a bar for six years. She buys her inventory in local breweries. She wants to buy 15 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft drinks, and six chairs. 

With her profit, she wants to grow her business. She has always dreamed of opening a cellar.

loans.use: to buy 15 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft drinks, and six chairs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married mother of 3 children. She produced dairy on her 0.5 acre land in Inga village. To make better income, Florence engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 20 years that she has been in the farming business, she has made strong relationships with other actors in the market.

Given that Florence can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to build larger inventory of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will benefit Florence's family greatly through improved income.

loans.use: to buy farm produce

loans.name: Mung

texts.en: Mrs. Mung is a hard working woman, 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Her income is mainly from animals husbandry and fishing .With more than 20 years experience, she has support from her husband.  So her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 38 years and he supports four children. 

He has been a farmer for the several years now and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing his crops to enable him get a better harvest.

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and offer better medical services to his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing his crops to enable him get a better harvest for family use and the surplus to sell in the market.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 46 years old, married to Agnes, and supports 5 children.  

He has been a farmer for the last 8 years, and the business earns him a monthly income of 8,500 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan (25,000 KES) from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers to top dress his crops, which will enable him to have a better harvest.   

Peter plans to use incremental profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to further educate his children through the income earned.
 
His hope is to expand his farming business and to support his children through higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to top dress his crops, which will enable him to have a better harvest

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
You’ll be glad to meet Mercedes, a hard-working woman who hails from the beautiful city of Davao in the Philippines.  Together with her husband Felix, she operates a variety store (locally called “sari-sari”store), managing the household at the same time.   

You will notice from her photo that her store is well-organized and has indeed a variety of products being sold -- from laundry products to canned goods to sachets of coffee , fruit juice, shampoo and sandwich spreads.  Not visible in the photo is rice, the staple food of Filipinos, which she sells by the kilo.  Many Filipinos buy rice good for 1-2 days family meals.  And, like most sari-sari store entrepreneurs, Mercedes also sells electronic cellphone load.  In the Philippines, almost every household owns at least one cellphone unit which they usually re-load everyday. 

Mercedes has been in the business for 10 years, earning an average of PhP60,000 per month.  She firmly believes that she can earn more if she could add more commodities in her store, particularly rice.  A loan of PhP29,000 will go a long way to buy additional volumes of these products to expand her business.

Mercedes dreams of having a good life and works hard to reach this dream.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  Through the fellowship, she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.  *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice, soft drinks, and groceries.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Contribute now for Pedro. Recently, he was granted a loan which he used for improving his inventory. With heartfelt thanks, he would like to take another loan worth PHP 50,000. This time, he will utilize it to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his store. 

This loan will help sustain the family needs basically their main expenses for everyday living. He is hopeful that through your helping hand, he will be able to expand his trade someday. 

Today, what he simply wants is to finally have a stall for his business and have a good future ahead.
He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her seaweed culture and raising pigs  

Mildred dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Christine, who is a seasoned farmer with extensive experience working in the field. She is a honest, ever smiling mum; she has great people skills and the energy to bring any cultivation to a productive harvest. 

In 2000, Christine ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Fifteen years down the line, Christine is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments have helped elevate the quality of life led by her children, who are in school. 

Christine is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Christine will find your loan very handy. 

With KES 40,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. 

She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 42 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, noodles, etc.

May has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from direct selling Natasha products.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a smallholder farmer from the Thika area of Kenya. She is married and has two children. Five years ago, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing mixed farming on her farm

Due to the increasing needs of her family, Mary wants to scale her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.  Mary hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Nkoma School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jonathan, the head teacher at Nkoma High School, a mixed school with 420 students in the urban area of Mbale. The school does not currently have consistent clean drinking water for the children and so has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water.

Nkoma School has requested a 3,035,000 UGX loan from Kiva's field partner Impact Carbon to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The tank will hold 450 liters of water, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The school will repay its loan through its school fees, which it collects each term.

Jonathan ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases. This change will mean more students will be able to come to school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Cheng Leang's Group

texts.en:
Cheng Leang lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, is 46 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and another one works on her co-villager's farm for a fee. Nowadays, she does rice farm to support her family’s living for twenty-eight years. The deprecated of the rice price is the main challenge for her business, which cause her to have not enough funds to do farming for this season. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she repaid back her past loan successfully. She has enough household supplies to use more than before from her past loan. Cheng Leang is the leader of a group of three members, who will ask for new loan to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for growing her rice crops. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more yields so to get more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide for growing her rice crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: KARIA, c’est la femme qui tient la corde du mouton sur la photo. Agé de 55 ans, Mariée, son mari est un cultivateur. Karia n’a pas été à  l’école, ménagère de son état, Karia fait recourt à la caisse pour acheter des moutons. Elle est mère de 06 enfants dont une (1) fille est scolarisée, âgés de 13  ans. Elle mène cette activité d’embouche ovine depuis plus de 05 ans, elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés d’environnants. Karia est une cliente de RMCR depuis 2013 et elle est à son cinquièmes cycle, selon elle, le service de RMCR a beaucoup amélioré la condition de vie de ma famille.  Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier entre 25 000 f à 30 000 f CFA. Avec ses profits elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : comme en  couverture sanitaire, habillements, et alimentaires Karia souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus d'argent afin de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de moutons pour l'élevage.
texts.en:
Karia is the woman who is holding the rope around the neck of the sheep in the photo. Aged 55, she is married and her husband is a farmer. Karia did not go to school; she is a housewife and she has come to the Microfinance Institution (RMCR) to buy some sheep. She is the mother of six children of whom one daughter is enrolled in school, aged 13. 

Karia has been in the business of fattening sheep for more than five years. She buys them in neighboring markets. She has been a client of RMCR since 2013 and she is on her fifth cycle. She says RMCR's service has greatly improved living conditions in her family. 

After making a sale, her profit can vary between 25,000 and 30,000 F CFA. With her profit she manages to cover the needs of her family such as healthcare, clothing, and food. Karia hopes in future to have more money so she can buy lots of sheep to raise.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for resale

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang is 34 years old, lives with her husband and has two children. For the past 8 years, she has been working hard to manage her poultry business.

 The loan will be used to procure more chickens to increase her stock for selling later and will help her to generate greater profits and improve on her sales. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have more eggs also.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to increase her stock and will help her to generate greater profits

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is a strong-willed woman, who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman, and mother who never tires of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed for hog raising. Aside from her project of concreting the pigpens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feed for hog raising.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 39 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Alita works very hard to provide for them.

Alita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, candies, home care products, and other groceries.

Alita has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Alita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, candies, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jona works hard to support her family. Jona is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Jona has been in this business for 15 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rolita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rolita is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell at her stall.

Rolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell at her stall

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 62 years old and married with six children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nita has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Alta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.  Alta is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of farming rice to sell.

Alta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of farming rice to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 55 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 26 years, they all go to school. he sells clothes and he is in a business for the past 11 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more t-shirts, trousers for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare. In future, he wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, trousers for selling

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a young 33-year-old man who works day to day to get ahead, and searches for better living conditions for his family. He resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is situated in the Rift valley province. He lives together with his family on a small piece of land where he keeps sheep and grows a wide variety of crops. 

For ten years, Edward's primary sources of income have been from selling wool, meat (mutton) and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Edward made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his family. You can be part of Edward's dream -- make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, Sammy also does dairy farming for extra food and income.  

The key lesson he has taken away from years of banana farming is that farm inputs determine the quality and quantity of harvest. 

Sammy is seeking a loan to buy agricultural implements and farm inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy tools and improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase David’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Jasper

texts.en:
Jasper is a smallholder farmer based in Central Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. His main source of income is milk. Jasper aspires to grow his business, make better income and take good care of his wife and children.

One way that Jasper can improve his business is by ensuring his cows are more productive. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter, which is a machine that chops hay into chaff. Cows enjoy feeding on chaff because it is fodder that is evenly cut, free of dust, and of good color. The chaff-cutting machine will also make it easier for him to handle fodder in bulk. 

Through your loan investment, Jasper will improve feed management on his farm and that will lead increase in milk production. Jasper can also make additional income by starting up his own chaff cutting operation for other farmers. This investment will not only change Jasper's business trajectory but also improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en:
Sandrine is 29 years old. She is married with one 4-year-old child. 

Sandrine owns a bar. She has been in this business for four years and she enjoys her business. Her husband is a farmer. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more beer for sell. With the profits from the business to renovate her house. In the future, she aims to make good use of her profits.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, soda and Colgate to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin aged 33 years; he is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 5 years. He owns a shop in which he sells beer as well, he has been in a business for the past 10 years. His wife is a business woman. 

With the loan, he would like to buy soaps, toothpaste for selling. The profits from the business will used to buy a piece of land and to pay school fees of her children. In future, he aims to earn at least 100,000 per month

loans.use: to buy soaps, toothpaste for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more toothpaste, biscuits and rice for selling in her shop

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 20 years. They all go to school. She sells clothes and she has been in this business for the past 15 years while her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Theavin's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Theavin is 30-year-old and she has three children, two among them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. The source of her family’s income is from working at garment factory for eleven years. 

For Theavin, this is fifth loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Previous loans have helped her to renovate old house and now she has a better house to stay than before. 

Presently, she is leading a group of four members to apply for a new Kiva loan. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy paint for painting her old house. She hopes that this loan will help her to complete her house renovation and improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy paint for painting her old house.

loans.name: Tol's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of Mondulkiri province’s Keo Seima district, Tol is 38-year-old and she is a mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. For her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and she works for others for a fee to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in these businesses for five years. Before, her crops have been destroyed by insects is the problem for her business, which cause her to have not enough funds to do farming for this season. 

As the group leader of three members, she is going to take her first loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is willing to spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds to grow her cassava in order to generate more income to support her family. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income so that she has ability to renovate her old house and to update her family living condition much better than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow her cassava in order to generate more income to support her family..

loans.name: Zura

texts.ru: Зура, 48 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Зуры среднее образование. Она торгует на рынке овощами и фруктами, также занимается сельским хозяйством. У Зуры есть 5 коров, 25 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и клевер для реализации. Доходы составляют примерно 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Зура для перевозки скота, сельскохозяйственной продукции и товара на рынок нанимает водителя с грузовым автомобилем. Она подсчитала все расходы связанные с транспортировкой и пришла к выводу, что выгоднее приобрести свой автомобиль. Поэтому Зура и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку небольшого грузового автомобиля. Доходы от бизнеса Зура и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zura is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Zura has secondary education. She sells vegetables and fruit at the market, and also is engaged in farming. Zura has five cows and 25 sheep. On 1.0 hectare of land, she cultivates corn and clover for sales. Her monthly income is about 6,000 som (KGS). 

Zura hires a driver and a lorry to transport livestock, farm produce, and goods for the market. She has calculated all the transportation expenses and has come to the conclusion that it would be more favourable to obtain her own vehicle. 

Thus, Zura has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), in order to buy a small lorry. Zura plans to invest the funds from the business in its development.

loans.use: to buy a small truck for transportation of farming products.

loans.name: Khawasra 1 Group

texts.en:
Mujahid is standing in the middle of this group picture, raising his hand. He is 33 and married with 6 family members, and is a resident of Khawasra, Tehsil Noshehra Virkan, Gujranwala district, Pakistan. 

He is a farmer who grows wheat and rice on his farmland. He earns his income through the sale of his crop yield in the nearby grain market.

Mujahid and his group members are beneficiaries of JWS. Muhammad has successfully completed four loan cycles with JWS and paid back all the loans on time. 

The group have received training on agri farming from JWS to help increase their crop output. The knowledge and skills acquired by the group members have enabled them to realize how profitable farming is, and they are now yearning to apply this new knowledge. 

They are requesting a loan to buy farm inputs like quality rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for a rice crop, and this will increase their farm output.
 
Mujahid’s dream is to construct a beautiful house for his family to expand his agri farming business. He is confident that with a Kiva loan and continued support from lenders, he will be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Thinh is 51 years old and married. Her husband works in fishing. 

She is taking out the loan so her husband can have the necessary resources to do his great work. He and another person go out on the high seas in their small boat to do their fishing work. They fish alongside a fishing boat, to which they give their catch of fish during the days they are at sea. Sometimes, he goes out and doesn’t return for 15 days, which worries her, since there are many dangers on the high seas. But he has to do it for the good of his family. 

This loan is used to buy nets, fishing line, fuel and food for the days they is out at sea. Her dreams are to have a large boat for her husband to do his fishing work.

loans.use: To buy nets, fishing line, fuel and food for the days her husband is out at sea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corrugated tin, wood, and bricks in order to construct a small shed.

loans.name: Oblokul

texts.en:
Oblokul is a hardworking man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. He is living in small village with his family and has big garden. He is married and has four children. His children are already grown up and help him and his wife. He plants plums in his garden and each season sells at the domestic and rural markets. 

He asks a loan to be treated at a hospital. For the money that would give to him he wants to be treated, then with cheerful mood to raise the rest of the harvest. He hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: To be treated at hospital

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Janeth is in her early 30's. She is married and has two kids, a boy and a girl, who are at school. For 3 1/2 years, Janeth has been supporting her family by running a grocery, selling soft drinks, beer and spirits. She has a kitchen (JIKO) at the same business place, serving roasted meat, chips, etc. She opens the business from 03:00pm until midnight each working day. She is able to make a good profit each month. Janeth is able to sell more than five crates of drinks per business day.

This is her fifth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. The loan will be apportioned between the members of Shaba, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Janeth has managed to repay her previous credits successfully. She used these loans to buy business chairs and drinks. She earned an extra profit, which she used to cover part of the school fees and household expenses. 

In the coming years, Janeth would like to manage a big grocery with high sales.

She will invest a portion of her new loan to buy drinks, along with serving food, like more roasted meat.

loans.use: to buy drinks and serving food, like more roasted meat.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is aged 40 years, married to Mary and supports four children. 

He has been in the business for the last eight years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. 

Fredrick has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a new engine to put in his motorcycle. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and  buy a dairy cow for milk production and family use. 

He hopes to escape poverty and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase new engine to put in his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Peaceful Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is a 52-year-old businesswoman.  She is a member of “Peaceful” solidarity group.  “Peaceful” solidarity group has four members, one man and three women.  Mariatu sells rice, peppers, onions, and palm oil to many households who depend on her charcoal as a source of energy for cooking. She has been in this business for the past eight years.  She opens her business six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. 

Mariatu established her business to help support her children in school.  She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profits she gets from her business.  See Mariatu in the left of the picture.

Mariatu and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,500,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, peppers, onions, palm oil and salt for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits to support her family. She is married and has six children with the ages of 20, 19, 18, 17 and 15 years.

In the future, Mariatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.  She also plans to build a house for her family. Mariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, peppers, onions, palm oil, and salt.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a rice vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from working in a general store. Jessica is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell in her rice vending business.

Jessica has sustained her business activities with 7 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different types of rubber bowls and dozens of slippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items such as cakes, milk, and biscuits for sell in her general store.

loans.name: Wives Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 35-year-old businesswoman. Kadiatu is married and has three children, who go to school. She is a member of Wives solidarity group. Wives solidarity group has five members, who are all women. Kadiatu stands in the middle of the group picture.

Kadiatu sells cotton materials. She has been in this business for the past three years. She opens her business six days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Kadiatu and her group members need a loan totaling 7,500,000 SLL, of which Kadiatu is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL, which she will use to buy more types of cotton materials for her business.  She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. In the future, Kadiatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.  

Kadiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more types of cotton materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nheong's Group

texts.en:
Nheong, 38, is a farmer living in Prasat Sambo district of Kampong Thom province and a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She has been growing rice on a hectare area of farmland for 20 years as the main source of income. Sometimes, she and her husband work as a paid worker for a fee in order to make a better support to family’s living. Unfortunately, her hard-working at farming business has been ruined by heavy rain and flooding. She can manage to earn about 40,000KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

This time, Nheong is leading a group of four members to take out new loan, which will be her seventh time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This good client repaid her past loan successfully and she has used the sixth loan of her to provide family members with sufficient food and support her children’s studies better. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy a decent latrine for family so that they can live in comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases. 

She hopes that all her family members are healthy and they can perform their jobs better than before to earn more income to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for family so that they can live in comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 51 años de edad, dedicado a la cría y venta de ganado, este ha sido un medio por el cual este hombre ha tenido un gran progreso, pues de allí se generan los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia conformada por tres hijos y su esposa.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual hará unas mejoras a las corralejas y comprara leche y sal para su ganado.
Para este hombre trabajador y humilde no hay nada imposible, quiere seguir trabajando para que en un futuro sus hijos sean los dueños de este negocio que con tanto esfuerzo logro montar.

Como José, miles de empresarios están esperando de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Jose is a 51 year-old man who raises and sells livestock.  This has been the means through which he has made great progress, because from this business he generates enough income to support his family, which includes his wife and his 3 children.

At this time Jose is requesting a loan that he will use to make some improvements to his pens, and to buy milk and salt for his livestock.  For this hardworking and humble man nothing is impossible.  He wants to continue to work so that in the future his children can become the owners of the business, which took so much effort for him to establish.

Like Jose, thousands of businessmen are awaiting your help.  Take heart, and make a loan.

loans.use: to improve his stalls and buy milk and salt for his livestock

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
A los 36 años la señora Milena, logro montar su propio negocio, una floristería en la ciudad de Medellín, este ha sido un medio por  el cual esta mujer ha tenido un gran avance como persona y empresaria.
Trabaja todos los días entre 8 y  9 horas diarias.

Actualmente sus ventas han bajado, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual hará la compra de detalles y mensajes alusivos al padre, pues sabe que con esto atraerá a la gente y de tal manera sus ventas mejorarían.

Para esta mujer no hay sueños inalcanzables, ella desea seguir trabajando y ahorrar parte de sus ahorros para comprarse una vivienda propia.

Usted puede hacer parte de este sueño, anímate y haz un préstamo.
texts.en:
At 36,Milena was able to start her own business, a flower shop in the city of Medellin.  This has been a way for her to advance as a person and business woman.  She works 8 to 9 hours per day, every day. 

Lately her sales are down, this is why she requests a loan to use in buying gifts and messages related to fathers, she knows that this would attract customers and her sales would improve. 

For this woman there are no unattainable dreams, she wants to continue working and save a portion to buy a home.  

You can be part of this dream, go for it and lend!

loans.use: to buy gifts and messages related to fathers for her flower shop.

loans.name: Bobon

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Bobon. Bobon lives in Sumedang, located about a four hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks, and drinks and sells mobile airtime credits for his community. Bobon is happily married and together with his wife, they have one cute daughter. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about how to handle a business in technology.

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Bobon sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Bobon improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Bobon is the one who is seen in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph 39, is a boda-boda rider from Ikuma, Kagadi. He reached out to Ugafode again after his motorcycle got mechanical problems and could no longer work. He had initially taken loans of  UGX1,000,000, 100,000 and 2,500,000 respectively. He spent 2 weeks without working and his second retail income was not sufficient to pay rent and even school fees for all his 4 children who are aged between 19 and 8.

He has therefore approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to boost and expand his retail shop now that the demand for beans, sugar and others has increased. He wants to avoid late payment of school fees because he dreams of educating all his children.

Joseph would like to extend his sincere gratitude and appreciation for this great support that is really improving and changing lives in Kagadi.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, such as beans, sugar and others to sell.

loans.name: Saneka

texts.en:
Saneka, 48 years old, lives in a small village Khalaigram in Dhupguri. She has four children (one son and three daughters). Her elder daughter has got married and her son is now jobless. Two daughters are still studying. Her husband runs his agricultural business. His income is low to cover the education as well as household costs of his family. 

Saneka’s 18-year-old daughter Ratna is studying in grade 12. Next year she will appear for her Higher Secondary board examination. Thus she needs guidance of good tutors and study materials as well. Ratna is an average student and is trying her level best to score good marks in her board examination. Both Saneka and her husband have great expectations of Ratna as she is very serious about her studies. But unfortunately they have failed to manage her huge educational expenses.

So Saneka is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her daughter Ratna. She plans to use the loan money to pay school and tuition (private classes) fees and buy necessary study materials for continuing her daughter’s education. The loan will help this bright young girl to achieve her goal without any obstacles for being a nurse in future.

Saneka and Ratna (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education expenses.

loans.name: Basana

texts.en:
Basana is a 31-year-old lady who lives in a small village in Falakata of West Bengal. She is a mother of two children (a daughter and a son). Both of her children are studying in different grades in a local village school. Basana has attended school till grade 5 and could not proceed further due to her family’s poor financial condition. But she is willing to provide her children a good education so that they can lead a better life in future. 

Basana’s husband is a Toto van puller whose earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household costs for their family. 

Basana’s daughter, 12-year-old Pallabi, is now studying in grade 8 in Bara Soulmari Junior High School and very serious about her studies. She wants to continue her studies further with good marks, so she needs the help of private tuition (private classes) to score better in all her examinations otherwise she can not proceed further. 

Basana learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount she will pay the school fees, private tuition fees, and buy necessary educational articles for her daughter, Pallabi. 

Basana and her daughter, Pallabi, are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay the schooling fees and buy necessary articles for her daughter’s educational purposes.

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 2 C

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Pipe (pictured right), is 67 years old and married with three children. The parents are proud that all of their children are working on their own and have their own family. Pipe has 15 acres of crop farm and he has fifty years of experience in the crop farming business. He also plants coconuts, bananas and betel leaves for additional income. 

This loan will help Pipe invest in his farm and he hopes to continue to make more improvements in his farm this year. Pipe is happy that his farming consists of regulations in cash flow and that it is also able to cover most of his family's living cost. 
The group is overseen by a CBO leader.  The fund will help three members of the group to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds. Pictured above are the members of the Kyon Paing Village, named Zaw, Maung, and Pipe. 

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village, and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves.

loans.use: to invest in his farm and to help him continue to make improvements with his farming.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a rural hardworking woman hailing from Falakata.  She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and three children (a son and two daughters). Rahima is unfortunate that in her childhood she was deprived of any formal education due to her parents' poverty.  Her husband, Mafibul, having a primary level education, has been engaged in agricultural activities. Rahima's children are students in grade 11, 9 and 3.

Rahima and her husband face a lot of financial difficulties to bear the educational costs of their children. They generate a small income from their agricultural business.  Rahima's daughter Golapi is a student of grade 9 in Falakata Subhas Girls' High School. She got average marks in her annual examination in grade 8. Due to the lack of family income, Rahima could not afford proper tuition (private classes) and buy textbooks for her daughter. So, she decided to take an educational loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase her daughter's textbooks, notebooks, and other necessary study materials and pay the tuition fees for her uninterrupted education. 

With this loan amount, her daughter can buy textbooks, guidebooks including other educational equipment and can hope to understand her subjects better. Rahima is now quite confident about her daughter's education, and Golapi is also very happy after getting the loan for continuing her studies. 

Rahima, along with her daughter Golapi (shown in the picture), are highly grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary educational materials for her daughter’s schooling.

loans.name: Tausaga

texts.en:
Tausaga is a 22 years old unmarried woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, beans, cucumbers, eggplant,etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Tausaga has requested a loan to buy wires,seeds,chemicals,wheelbarrow etc. She has been a member of SBPD since June this year 2015. With her profits, Tausaga hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wire,chemicals,seeds,hose,etc.

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Olesta, who was born in 1978, is married with one kid who is still in school. She has been running a cosmetics shop. She has been in her business for two years now. She works from 08 am to 7pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Olesta’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more different kind of cosmetics. 

She dreams to expand her business. Olesia will share this loan with her loan group, "Asenal", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more different kinds of cosmetics.

loans.name: Coka Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Stephano is 34 years old and is a hardworking man. He has been running a hardware shop for eight years and works from 8am to 5:30pm daily. He is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Stephano‘s 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy hardware equipment for his shop, He is very happy with the loan. He has successfully repaid his loans, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to expand his hardware shop. He will share this loan with his loan group "Coka Kiwalani", which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  expand his hardware shop

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
He is Charlie, aged 35, resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Liwanag who takes care of their three children, two of which are in the elementary level in school and the youngest is not of school age yet. He works hard to provide for their daily personal and household needs.

Charlie operates a tricycle for twelve years already. His tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Cavite, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited and very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. 

Being a jeepney driver, on the road for almost 12 hours is really tiring and energy draining but Charlie bears all this for the love of his family. He is now humbly asking your help for a 30000 Php loan to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle. It is important that his unit is maintained regularly to ensure efficient service and continuous income to sustain their daily needs and school needs of his children. 

Charlie aims to acquire another jeepney unit and wants all his children to go to good schools to allow them better opportunities in life.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perlita is 54 years old now.

Perlita has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy frozen foods to sell for her business.

Perlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  frozen foods to sell for her business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 44 years old and married, with four children.  With three children in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

For 21 years Perla has operated a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages and groceries.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Perla would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages and groceries.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children who are in school.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines for over 6 years and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending. This is the second time that Diana is helped by Kiva.

Diana dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

Maria has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Barokatus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Barokatus. Barokatus lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married and together with her husband, they have one cute daughter. 

As her main source of income, Barokatus sells mobile airtime credits to her community. As the business grows, Barokatus is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for her communities. Your loan will be very useful to help Barokatus improve her business and accordingly her community, who needs access to such services. 

Barokatus is the one who is seen in the photo. She will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 2 D

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Myint (pictured left), is 58 years old, married, and supports a family of six (four children). He has six acres of crop farm. His wife manages the house chores, and will sometimes help him out in the farm. The parents are proud that most of their children are working on their own and helping them out in the farm. 

Proximity Design's loan will help the family to invest in their crop farm and to purchase fertilizers and seeds. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyon Paing Village Group 2 D: Myint, Lin and Hte. The fund will help the group purchase fertilizers and crop seeds that will help them boost their income. 

Kyon Paing Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar, where they mainly focus on crop farming. Some households have opened a grocery store in the village and many plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to invest in their crop farm and to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en:
Joselinda is a married woman, 55 years old. 

Joselinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Joselinda has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali lives with her family in a village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is a 34-year-old housewife. Her husband is engaged in sofa-repair work and earns a meager income, which is quite insufficient for her family. Dipali is blessed with one daughter. Her only daughter, Lovely, is doing her Master's degree in History from Rabindra Bharati University.

Extra efforts and sacrifices are always worth it when it comes to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life. Lovely is well aware of this, because she has always counted her goal as becoming a good teacher. Now she needs the guidance of private tutors in completing her Master's degree but her parents are unable to afford this.

So her mother, Dipali, is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to pay for her daughter’s University fees and private tuition fees and purchase necessary books. Dipali hopes in the long run that her daughter will establish herself as a competent teacher.

Dipali and her daughter Lovely (as in the picture) are very much thankful to their generous lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's Master degree education.

loans.name: Narang's Group

texts.en:
