Narang, 34, is a farmer living in Snoul district of Kratie province and a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school. Growing cassava on three hectares area farmland has been her main business for 10 years already. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn supplement income. This year, she can earn less income than before because the crop is not healthy enough to produce good outputs. 

Narang has ever been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a cycle already and she repaid back successfully. The previous loan has enabled her to improve her living standard better. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan and it will be her second cycle. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers and to pay for labor fee. She hopes to well support her cash crop so that it can produce good outputs to her.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizers and to pay for labor fee.

loans.name: Arpita

texts.en:
Arpita is a 21-year-old married lady who lives in Kandi of West Bengal. She is the mother of one daughter who started attending school. Arpita and her husband Indrajit run a milk selling business. They have a cow and sell milk every day to the villagers and to the local milkmen. She also sells byproducts like cow dung, which is widely used as manure, for additional income. Her husband helps her in supplying milk to her customers.

Arpita diligently saves a little amount and sets it aside for her son's education. The rest is spent for her family's household expenses. But realistically, she is aware that the amount she must save should be much more, if she has to provide a complete education to her daughter and improve their family’s living.

Now she wants to add one more cow, and for this she seeks a loan from Kiva through BJS. This will increase her business viability and also pave the way to provide her daughter the best education she deserves. After completion of the whole process, she hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to purchase more dairy cows for the expansion of her business.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Taulagaola

texts.en:
Taulagaola is a 36 year old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a retail store selling tinned fish, lbs of sugar, flour, rice, chicken, mutton, soft drinks,etc. in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Taulagaola has requested a loan to buy supplies of these items. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to pay for children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, flour, rice, drinks, tinned food, display cooler etc

loans.name: Sasae

texts.en:
Sasa'e is a 45-year-old woman who is married and has three children. She runs a sewing business and sells clothes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business.

Sasa'e has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials,a sewing machine, needles, thread,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, bean and squash seeds; manure; blight prevention; and fertilizers in order to be able to maintain his harvest and increase his earnings.

loans.name: Norayda

texts.en:
Norayda is 29 years old and married, and she has two children of school age. 

She always has enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their cornfield in Pagadian City and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase four bags of fertilizer, four gallons of pesticide, and labor wages for her workers. This will ensure that the cornfield will give her more of a harvest. Norayda knows that she has to get things right in order to yield more income this cropping season. 

In the future, Norayda hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizer, four gallons of pesticide, and labor wages for her workers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Celio

texts.es: Don Celio ofrece servicios de alquiler de habitación a turistas y personas que laboran en la zona. Solicita un préstamo de $2 100 para la compra de materiales y construcción de nuevas cabañas, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en: Don Celio offers rental accommodations to tourists and people who work in the area. He is requesting a loan of $2100 to buy materials for the construction of new cabins, with the goal of offering better service to his customers and in this way increase his business earnings.

loans.use: to build cabins to rent

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en: A mother of seven dependent children living in Battambang Province, Sarum is 56 years old. For her family’s income, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in rice farming for 12 years. She can save about 29,400 KHR per day. For Sarum, this is her seventh loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. With her past loans, her rice farm has improved gradually. She leads a group of two members to get another loan. She will spend her loan to expand her land and to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to increase her yields. She hopes she can get more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her land and to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to support her farming effort.

loans.name: Sokhy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Sokhy is 50 years old and a mother of four dependent children. She earns income to support her living conditions via rice cropping. She has been involved in her farming for 32 years, and it earns her about 33,300KHR per day. 

Her rice crop produced a bad yield because it was destroyed by insects, and this is her main challenge in business that caused her to lack funds for doing farming for this season. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan via VisionFund. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and buy more rice seed to support her rice farming. She hopes that her farm can gain her more yields, so she can get more income to update her living to get better than before.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and buy more rice seed to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Mary Jane has been raising livestock for 19 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and married, and she has one child.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and cooking oil, etc.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old and married with five children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, snack food, home care products and other groceries.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, snack food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Eni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Eni, one of Ruma’s agents. Eni lives in Malang, a small area in East Java located about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta by plane. She owns a stall that sells any kind of plastic cover for food, plastic glass, plastic plate, styrofoam glass & plate, etc. She is also happily married. Right now, because she joined Ruma and became Ruma's agent, she sells mobile airtime credits as well for her community. She feels happy because since she joined Ruma, she can try another business opportunity, as well as further contribute to her community.

As the business grows, Eni is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Eni improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Eni's goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. As seen in the photo, Eni is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Mitali

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Mitali lives in the remote village of Kathapara, Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and three daughters. All her daughters are students. Though Mitali only studied up to grade nine, she is willing to provide her daughters a higher education.

Her husband has been a cultivator for many years and his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their daughters after managing the household expenses. To supplement this, Mitali does sewing work to raise the educational expenses of her daughters. Her elder daughter, 17-year-old Aparna, is studying for her B.A (Bachelor's of Arts) in her first year in Sukanta Mahabidyalay. She passed her Higher Secondary Board exam this year, securing average marks. She is very much serious about her studies as well as her examinations. Having no private tutor, she is busy in her studies all day long. But now she needs proper guidance and adequate study materials to continue her education.

To achieve this, Mitali applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for her daughter's smooth education. With the loan amount, she will pay the private tuition fee and buy necessary articles like books, notebooks, and reference books to let Aparna proceed a step forward towards achieving good skills and knowledge. She wants her daughter to get the chance of being a responsible teacher in the future.

Mitali and her daughter Aparna (as per the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to bear the cost of her daughter’s graduate level education.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en:
Mesepi is 31 years old and has a partner with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes,buns,doughnuts,pop-corns,etc in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Mesepi has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour,sugar,oil,yeast,etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mesepi will use it to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, boxes of chickens,etc.

loans.name: Komila

texts.en:
Komila is a cheerful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1975 and is married with three children. Her husband works elsewhere. The area where her family lives is famous for dried fruits and nuts. Komila grew up in a family of farmers. She was taught to be honest, well behaved and helpful from her childhood. When she got married she started to work at a hydrometer in a pumping station that provides her area with water. Where she worked was constantly damp and it affected to her health. 

Each year she tries to get treatment at good and professional medical clinics. This year her husband earns less money than usual. But she still needs money to be treated and it is not allowing it to interrupt her treatment. She and her husband decided to get a loan for her treatment. She left her work and recently she has bought calves to keep and do business. This year she is planning to increase her working capital and at the end of season she would receive money transactions from her husband. 

Komila has a good loan story and she is one of the trustee clients at IMON. She requested a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to spend for health and repairing of house. She will use 60% of loan to treatment and 40% to repairing her apartment.

loans.use: To be treated at hospital and repair her apartment

loans.name: Ayudemonos Group

texts.es:
Griselda es una mujer de 59 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, en la mayoría; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Griselda es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lacio, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por cumplir sus metas la llevó a liderar en esta ocasión la banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano de forma ambulante; cada día ella junto a su hijo se dirigen a diferentes mercados y ferias, cargados de sacos llenos de su mercadería. Levantan un par de sombrillas y arman un puesto de venta, los clientes transitan por el lugar y compran sus prendas continuamente, “los precios que manejamos están muy por debajo de un calzado nuevo, por eso vendemos bien en ferias populares…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los precios de sus prendas son muy competitivos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión y la competencia.  Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande de calzados, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de un lote de zapatos para aumentar su oferta. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Griselda solicita un préstamo para la compra de un lote de zapatos y con los beneficios ayudar a estudiar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Griselda is a single, 59 year-old woman who has a 17-year-old son. Her business is selling second-hand shoes. She is a good mother, motivated, independent, persevering, responsible and very hardworking. 

She conducts her business in the 'plan 3000' zone, characterized by the multiculturalism of its inhabitants who are mostly Aymará, Quechua and Guaraní. Situated in the southern part of the city, the area has a warm, sub tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade. Migrants settled there and formed a constantly growing commercial sector.

Griselda has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long, straight dark hair, a short stature and a robust build. Her first language is Guaraní, which is spoken in her area, and she speaks Spanish as part of her general knowledge and for her business. 

She shares her life with her son who studies in school. They live in a room made of wood with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. It has potable water, electricity and a sewage system. 

The need to reach her goals led her to be the current leader of the bank of people -- with business like the neighborhood store, the butcher shop, sandwich sales, plaster crafts, refreshment sales, a bookstore and second-hand clothing sales -- to request loans and improve their businesses.

Her business is second-hand shoe sales as a street vendor. Each day, she and her son go to different markets and fairs, loaded with sacks full of merchandise. They put up a couple umbrellas and a stall. Clients walk by and continually buy her items. "The prices we offer are much lower than new footwear, so sales are good in the market," she says.

The advantage of her business is that the price of her footwear is very competitive. The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital and competition. 

Her dream is to open a big shoe store. She wants to expand her business by purchasing a bunch of shoes to broaden her offering. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in 3 years that is in this business. 

For these reasons, Griselda is requesting a loan to purchase shoes, and with the earnings, to help her son study.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

She supplements this income with earnings from her seaweed farming.

Reynilda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lunessa

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lunessa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling seaweed. Lunessa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Lunessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a 28-year-old father of a small child who is too young to attend school. He is a pig farmer and paid worker who is living in a rural area located in Battambang province. Thorn has been involved in his current business for five years and he is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day to support his family’s needs. After spending money on his family’s daily expenses, he could save about 13,000 KHR each day for emergency needs. 

Getting a small income is a main challenge for him to expand his business. Because of this, he is now leading a small group of two to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy more piglets and pig feeds and to build a pig cage to support his pig business and generate more income. This is the third loan cycle for him and his co-borrower with VisionFund. The past loans helped him to have better living conditions. He expects that this new loan will help him to successfully expand his current business and give him the ability to earn more income to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feeds and to build a pig cage to support his pig business and generate more income.

loans.name: Seila Isabel

texts.es: Sheila es una mujer que se caracteriza por su iniciativa y liderazgo, ella quiso ser una persona económicamente independiente y se dedicó al comercio desde muy joven. Hoy en día cuenta con 18 años de experiencia una amplia base de clientes a quienes les ofrece prendas de vestir, perfumes y artículos para el hogar.  Ella reside en compañía de cónyuge y sus dos hijos en una urbanización en el municipio de Soledad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la disposición de tiempo que tiene, al poder compartir con su familia y responder efectivamente en su negocio. Su principal prioridad es ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y considera que siendo audaz en las ventas podrá aportar mucho más a la economía de su hogar. Como su principal obstáculo ha sido el insuficiente capital de trabajo, Sheila está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para responder a pedidos de sus clientes; perfumes, colonias, cremas y demás e incrementar la cantidad de productos que solicita y aprovechar descuentos.  Esta inversión aporta a su meta futura, ella desea abrir un almacén y comercializar sus productos.
texts.en:
Sheila is a woman known for her initiative and leadership. She wanted to be a financially independent person and has worked in commerce since she was young. Today she has 18 years of experience and a large base of clients whom she offers clothing, perfume and products for the house. She lives with her spouse and her two children in a housing development in the municipality of Soledad. What she likes most about her work is the free time she has, that she can spend with her family and react effectively in her business.

Her main priority is to provide her children with a higher quality of living and thinks that being bold in her sales can bring much more to the household finances. As her main obstacle has been insufficient working capital, Sheila is applying for a loan from Kiva, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to fill orders from clients, buying perfume, cologne, creams and others to increase her quantity of products that she is requesting and take advantage of discounts. This loan will help her future goal. She wants to open a store to commercialize these products.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cologne, creams and others to fill requests from clients.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, she also earns additional income from general store. Jovita is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc for her for her fishing business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to to have more business so she can sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc for her fishing business

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Snoul district of Kratie province, Seak is 37 years old and a married mother of a dependent child who is in school. She has been growing cassava on a hectare area as her main source of income. To earn additional income, she sells ice in her community. Her cassava farming, which is seven years old, enables her to earn less income than before because it was flooded by rain. 

She is now leading a group of three members to take out a new loan, which will be the second cycle for her. The previous loan has helped her to improve her living condition a lot. Anyway, this time Seak will use her loan to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds, so that the crop can grow well and produce more yields. She hopes to earn more income to update her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds so that the crop can grow well and produce more yields.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida works hard to support her family. Bienvenida is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Bienvenida has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Bienvenida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Phrak's Group

texts.en:
Phrak is a 35-year-old farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province (Cambodia). She is a married mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school (the other one is not yet school age). 

Phrak struggles for a living via rice growing. She has been involved in this business for ages. Drought is the main challenge she faces these days. 

Now, Phrak is leading a group of two to get a loan. This is the first time she has worked with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group leader, she will use her loan to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to enhance crop productivity. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to enhance crop productivity.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Josephine, 59 year old married and has one dependent. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) with an aim of learning more on enterprise and financial management. She has completed all the trainings offered by HiH EA.

The purpose of the loan Is to buy feeds and more chicks to boost her income thus making increase on her income and enable meet her daily expenses like food and clothing

She appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds to boost her to chicken rearing business for increased income

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is a 36-year-old married factory worker with four children and resides in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2011 and makes $6 per day. Her husband is a 40-year-old driver, one of her four children also works in the factory and three others attend school. Sreymao, her husband and the child earn $17 each day. 

Currently, her husband is working as a driver in the city, therefore she needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband for commuting to work. This loan will help her husband have his own motorcycle for commuting to work to earn income to support the family. Sreymao plans to build a new house and she hopes to have enough money to help her children in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband for commuting to work

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is a 29-year-old married factory worker with a dependent child. She lives in a village in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2006. Her husband is a 36-year-old carpenter. Her only child is in school. Srey and her husband can make approximately $13 per day. 

Srey would like to request a loan because she needs to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her family's income. In the future, she is going to expand her business and support her child to go to high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kolotea

texts.en: Kolotea is a 43-year-old partner woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows beans, cucumbers, eggplants, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Kolotea has requested a loan to buy wire, chemicals, seeds, hose, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Kolotea hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wire, chemicals, seeds, hose, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 36 years old and single. He has two children. As a single father, he wants to earn a living to provide for his children's needs. 

Ruben is engaged in a transport business to earn a living. He aims to increase his income because of the increasing needs of his children. He decided to request a loan to buy motor parts for motor repair so that he can cater to more passengers and create a better income.

Ruben's plan for the future is to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old and married with six children. With four of her children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 13 years now. 

Norma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk food, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Shiella works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling personal products in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.  Shiella is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more personal products to sell, like perfume, body lotion, bags, underwear, etc.

Shiella has sustained her business activities through 5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products like perfume, body lotion, bags, underwear, etc. to sell

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is 48 years old,married and has six children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Geneva requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Geneva has been raising pig for 20 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Geneva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of pig feeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter wishes to thank Kiva for the previous loan that enabled him buy more lambs for slaughter hence boosting his butchery business.  He was able to meet his customers demands and also increased his profits.

He is borrowing additional Kiva loan to buy additional lamb for slaughter to continue boosting his butchery business. He hopes this will further increase his profits and be able to meet his family's basic needs e.g food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy lambs for slaughter to help him earn more income for his family's basic needs e.g food and clothing

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
A resident living in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province, Seng is a 55-year-old father of five children, one of whom is dependent on him. As the breadwinner, he struggles for a living via growing soybean on two hectare-area of farmland as the main source of income. He also grows cashews and work for others for a fee in order to earn supplemental income. He has been in these businesses for 37 years already. The challenges he faces these days are to harvest low quality of crop products from his endangered soybean farming and to sell it in low price in market. 

Now, he is applying for a loan, which is the first cycle of him, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to buy soybean seeds, organic fertilizers and organic pesticide, which will be used to enrich the nutrients and to prevent the from being destroyed by pests. He hopes that he can get good output from his healthy crop so that he can earn good income to update his living standard.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds, organic fertilizers and organic pesticide, used to enrich the nutrients and prevent plants from being destroyed by pests.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a pensioner from Parlita village, Ungheni Region in Moldova. She is married and her husband, Vladimir, periodically works as builder in Russia. Ludmila and Vladimir also work on their little farm. Ludmila raises chickens, rabbits and pigs. 

Serious and motivated, Ludmila wants to develop her farm to meet her family’s needs, be self employed, and sell her own farm products. Ludmila will use the loan to build a new hen house.

loans.use: to build a new hen house.

loans.name: Nurjon

texts.en:
Nurjon is a 28-year-old single man who has one child to provide for. To earn a living he engages in a transport business so that he can provide for his child's daily needs. He wants to give his child a good life; that's why he borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance so that he can continue to cater to more passengers and generate a better income.

Nurjon's plan for the future is to expand his business with his income.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Cristita has been in this business for 11 years. Cristita earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children. She is 25 years old and four of her children are presently in school. Rosalie is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Clarice

texts.en:
Ana Clarice is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Clarice is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ana Clarice has an Internet shop business in the Philippines. Ana Clarice requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a mouse and keyboards and other supplies needed.

Ana Clarice has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ana Clarice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a mouse and keyboards and other supplies needed

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Nhor is a 55-year-old farmer living in the Kratie district of the Kratie province. Two of her children are dependending on her. 

To support her family, Nhor grows dry-season rice as her main source of income, and has been involved her main job for 37 years. Sometimes she works as a paid worker to get a fee to supplement her income.

Her fertile crop, which was expected to produce high output, has been destroyed by pests. As she lacks the capital to save her business, she decides to apply for a new loan. This will be her second time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she has fully repaid her past loan. The previous loan has been very beneficial to her and her family, by improving their standard of living.

For the new loan, Nhor, the leader of four-member group, will use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fees and buy rice seeds to plant so that she can earn more income. She hopes that she can earn more income to continue expanding her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees and buy rice seeds to plant so that she can earn more income.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 44 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Olivia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries to sell.

Olivia has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Olivia would like to build on and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in staple foods, oil, drinks, bread, tomatoes, onions, cold meats etc., just purchasing the raw materials needed to make the snacks that she sells

loans.name: Shiba Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Kanchana, the lady standing to the right, is a 27-year-old woman who lives in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha, India. She is a hardworking and creative mother with one son. She deals in jewellery for women and women's personal care products with a capital base of 60,000 INR. 

Kanchana is borrowing from People's Forum now for the first time, taking a loan through the group to expand her stock. After her husband's illness, Kanchana resorted to vending to earn a living and support her young family. Since then, Kanchana has never looked back. She says her hard work has helped her to survive in business among her peers. Her major problem however is price fluctuation. This happens so often, forcing her into losses. 

Kanchana along with her group member Sukanti has requested for a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She intends to use the loan to acquire more stock and to acquire a permanent place to operate, as they are always faced with threats of eviction by market authorities. She is hardworking, and the group appreciates the work done by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to acquire more stock for her jewelry shop and a permanent place to operate.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Mrs Chung is 48 years old and she is married.
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Chung lives in a rural town in Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.
In 2014, Chung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Chung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is engaged in a manufacturing business particularly furniture. She and her husband has been working hard to improve the finish products they offer. Leonisa has been involved to this kind of business for 15 years.  As additional source of income, she also raises hogs,corn and rice crops.The couple was blessed with three children.

Leonisa's finished furniture products are cabinets, dining sets, folded tables and sala set. With her determination to improve her furniture shop business, she decided to borrow additional capital of PHP14,000. She will use the amount of loan in buying woods, varnish, plainer and saw blade for furniture business. Leonisa would be grateful if her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to be use in buying woods, varnish, plainer and saw blade for furniture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the ingredients such as wheat, sugar, eggs, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milled glutinous rice, coconut milk, and sugar

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 54 years old, married with two children. 

Cristita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Cristita has been raising pigs for thirty years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and has four children. Rosita is married and has one child in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlita is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marlita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marlita requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marlita has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Marlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a 41-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Victorina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for six years. 

Victorina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. For her living, she earns income via rice cropping and cow raising to get extra income. Her rice grows not well because of drought. She has involved this business for 12 years and it earns her about 27,800KHR per day. 

For Sovann, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee for her rice farm to produce more output. She hopes that she can gain her income from her rice farm to improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee for her rice farm to produce more output.

loans.name: Nemol's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Nemol is 27 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. To support her family’s living, she earns income via cassava growing on three and half hectares area. Moreover, she can get extra income via working for others for a fee. The main problem for her cassava farm, she did not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support on her farmland. 

This is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. With her past loan, she can make a good income to update her family’s living better than before. In a group of two, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fee to support on her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yields and income to update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fee to support on her cassava farm.

loans.name: Faalo

texts.en:
Faalo is 57 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour, frozen goods, snacks, canned food, etc. She has been doing this for three years.

Faalo needs a loan to buy a new display cooler, bag of sugar, bag of rice, bag of flour, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and also to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, sack of sugar, sack of flour, sack of rice, etc.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials such as a fishing net, wood, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Nerissa successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as a fishing net, wood, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 fish for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent, Patricia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring.  Patricia is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like pillow case, etc. for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pillow case, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 62 years old, married and has eleven children. One of who is in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been farming sugarcane for nine years now, and has borrowed  times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her sugarcane and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 33 years old and has one child in school.

Raquel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Raquel has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, 30, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and growing beans. Moreover, she can earn more income via cassava growing and running a business as motor taxi driver. Her cassava had a bad yield because it was destroyed by insect. She has involved her business for 10 years and she can save her income for daily about 12,700KHR per day. 

This is first time for Sokhon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will manage her entire loan portion to buy seed, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to upgrade her farmland to get more yields. She hopes that she can get good yield and more income to update her farmland and her family better than before.

loans.use: to buy seed, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to upgrade her farmland to get more yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phally makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en: Sovann’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sovann makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his or her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
A resident living in Chol Kiri district of Kampong Chnang province, Soy is a 46-year-old mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her.

To make a living, Soy has been growing rice on a five-hectare area of farmland. She has had this job for 26 years. The crop has produced lower outputs because there was insufficient water to supply the farmland.

Now, Soy is applying for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time she has done so. Soy will use her loan to a buy solar light bulb for the family to use. She hopes to update their standard of living much more.

loans.use: to buy solar light bulb for the family to use.

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Special Interests Environment Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand holding a passbook in the photo is Francis. He is 56 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Francis practices mixed farming, including crop and dairy farming. 

Francis joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and animal feed to increase dairy and crop production and increase his income. This will enable him meet his family's needs such as food and clothing. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and animal feed to boost his dairy and crop production for increased income to pay for family expenses

loans.name: Sustainable Development -N4Th6Quảnghải Group

texts.en:
Mr Yên is 36 years old and married. He has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for more than 10 years. Yên lives in the Quang Xuong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

His business created jobs for many workers in the region, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Yên faces is lack of capital. He is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Yên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, the members unanimously agreed to vote his to be the leader of "Sustainable Development -N4th6QuảngHải" group. He is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to make furniture for sale.

With his business profit, Yên hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make furniture for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Josenette

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josenette works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Josenette is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shirts, shoes, etc. to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear product business.

Josenette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shirts, shoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Princess is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Princess requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Princess has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Princess would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is a 46-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and two sons in the small town of Dhupguri. Her husband is a farmer by trade. Their elder son studied until eighth grade and now works as a day laborer. Though Laili has limited education, she knows the utility of education and so she is not reluctant to give education to her younger son.

Laili's younger son Chattar, 13 years old, is a student of grade 7 at Shalbari High School. He is a good student and scores well in his exams in spite of his adverse situation at home. At present, the problem arises when his father, being a farmer, is unable to cover his educational expenses. Chattar did not take any outside help for his studies before, but now he needs some private tuition, reference books, notes, etc., for his coming examinations. Laili is helpless to manage the household expenses, yet she is unable to handle the educational expenses also. This creates a great pressure on her mind.

For that reason, Laili took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy her son's school uniform, study materials, and for school fees as well as private tuition fees. She hopes this loan will help her son to proceed smoothly in attaining his education. She dreams that one day her son will succeed in life with the help of this education.

Laili and her son Chattar (seen in the photo) are very much thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, tuition fees, textbooks and other stationery for her son.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 33 years old and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell.

Analiza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple goods, biscuits, candy, etc

loans.name: Manuchehra

texts.ru:
Манучехра 47 летняя мать двоих детей, жена и просто замечательный человек. Она хорошая хозяйка и очень вкусно готовит. Манучехра не только имеет талант в приготовлении пищи, но и в области шитья и торговли. Летом она занимается продажей не дорогих легких тканей для женской одежды. В другие сезоны, Манучехра шьет и продает "курпа" и "курпача".
   "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны.
  Она в этой сфере деятельности уже 10 лет и примерно столько же она работает на этой швейной машинке. Манучехра хочет создать себе условия работы и купить новую машинку. Швейная машинка стоит дорого, и она просит Вас помочь.
texts.en:
Manuchehra is a 47-year-old mother of two children, wife, and simply wonderful person. She is a good hostess and cooks deliciously. Manuchehra does not only have a talent for preparingf food but also in the field of sewing and trading. In the summer she sells inexpensive light fabrics for women's clothing. In other seasons, Manuchehra sews and sells "kurpa" and "kurpacha".

"Kurpa" and "kurpacha" are quilted mattresses. "Kurpa" are sewn in a standard square size and used as a blanket. Kurpacha are long mattresses used as sofas.

She has been in this sphere of activity for ten years and has been working on this sewing machine for about just as long. Manuchehra wants to create good working conditions for herself and to buy a new sewing machine. A sewing machine is expensive, and she is asking for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a happy woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1954 and is living in a district with her family. She is married and has three children. She has higher pedagogical education. For almost 20 years as she has worked as an editor at a newspaper in her place of living Zafarabad district. Her husband of 25 years works at a secondary school as a teacher. 

She is applying to get a loan from IMON and Kiva for the first time. She and her husband are wishing to be treated at a medical clinic. They hope to be healthy and await you kindness.

loans.use: To be treated with her husband at medical clinic

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a forty-two year old married woman residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has two dependents ages 14 and 12 year old respectively. She  engages in fire wood vending business for more than 10 years now.  Aside from that, she also engages in food vending business. She makes and sells polvoron ( is a type of heavy, soft and very crumbly Spanish shortbread made of flour, sugar, milk, and nuts). Her husband works in construction. 

Avelina is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending  like sugar, flour and flavoring. With these, She could be able to produce higher quantity of polvoron and it enables to augment her daily income.
 
With these, she will be able to pay her obligations and able to handle her finances. 
She is hoping that her both livelihood will become successful to be able for her to continue finance the schooling of her children and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending  like sugar, flour and flavoring

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo is a careful father. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. He lives in the Zafarabad district with his family.  He is married and has one child. His wife is a teacher. She teaches at secondary school to beginner classes. Ziyodullo has 20 years has experience working at a domestic market selling meat. He is a kind, honest, and generous person. 

Ziyodullo's daughter is sick. He tried to take her to every hospital in Tajikistan, but unfortunately they could not help her. He decided to take his daughter to Uzbekistan’s medical clinic, because he heard that there are well-known and good professionals that may help his daughter to be treated. He appealed to IMON and seeks a loan to get his daughter to Uzbekistan to be treated. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to get his daughter to Uzbekistan to be treated

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has owned his own janitorial business since 2011. He is originally from Honduras and has been in the United States for 19 years. Before opening up his business, he worked as a janitor for other companies. He is now proud to run a business in a field in which he has much experience and knowledge.

Jorge is currently seeking a loan to purchase office furniture and improve the appearance of his business. He is constantly working on how to keep up with or be one step ahead of his competition. His biggest challenge thus far has been in signing contracts with new clients.

Jorge is passionate and proud of his work and hopes his business continues to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his business office.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley is 32 years old now.

Shirley has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Shirley has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Berte

texts.en:
Ma. Berte is 48, a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Berte has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Berte requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ma. Berte has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Berte would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 57 years old and has five children. Francisca is married and has one child in school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Francisca has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Koagma Group

texts.fr:
Mme Koudpoko Justine représente le groupe  KOAGMA.  EVELINE se porte bien mais ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 37ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme prépare et vend du dolo (bière de mil) depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 05 sac de mil germé et 02rangées de bois pour la préparation du dolo.
Elle veut renforcer ses activités avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande productrice de dolo pour que les revendeuses viennent prendre chez elle.
NB: sur la photo, Koudpoko Justine tient un bidon et une calebasse de dolo.
texts.en:
Mme Koudpoko Justine is the representative of her group called Koagma.  (Eveline is doing well but is no longer part of the group.) Koudpoko Justine is married and the mother of seven children. The oldest is 37 and the youngest is 9. Two of them attend school. 

Mme  Koudpoko Justine has been making and selling dolo (millet beer) for three years. She buys her supplies in surrounding villages. She wants to buy 5 sacks of sprouted millet and two rows of wood for the preparation of her dolo.  

She wants to expand her business with her profit. Her ambition is to be a large-scale producer of dolo so that the women who resell it come to get it from her. 

NB: in the photo, Koudpoko Justine is holding a bottle and a gourd of dolo.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of sprouted millet and two rows of wood to use to prepare dolo (millet beer)

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Dina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.
